question_list.author: Celia Warren
question_list.text:
Oh, don't throw your toys out your pram!
Yes, I treat all your emails as spam.
Hurt your feelings? Don't care;
I don't like you, so there!
Just accept that I don't give a damn!
question_list.question: Why do I treat all your emails as spam?

question_list.author: MikeAq
question_list.text:
To compose a morose epicedium
Can brighten one's torpor and tedium.
I myself have an urge
To create a sad dirge —
One not overly mournful, just medium.
question_list.question: How can one brighten one's torpor and tedium?

question_list.author: neilski
question_list.text:
Dear fans, re the letters you write:
Peace and love, but I'm losing the fight.
From October, I'm sure,
They'll be answered no more:
I've no time. Peace and love, and goodnight.
question_list.question: From October, what will be answered no more?

question_list.author: MikeAq
question_list.text:
Mr. Thistle, what's this all about?
All our rules you dismiss — baldly flout.
I have read your epistle;
It made my hairs bristle.
I'm blowing the whistle — you're out!
question_list.question: Does Mr. Thistle follow our rules?

question_list.author: Richard English
question_list.text:
Some folks might think cranberry glass
Is for fruit of the cranberry class.
But it's glass of deep red,
With a gold sheen, and said
To be sought by the English top brass.
question_list.question: What is sought by the English top brass?

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
When I'm out shooting grouse with the Queen
We are hidden; by grouse we're not seen.
Just a low wall will do
For this butt made for two
Out of stone, or of turf that is green.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though I don't accept Mazda or Zeus,
Or any god, that's no excuse
(Yes, my creed's atheistic,
And I shun all that's mystic)
For subjecting my views to abuse.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Though the beatings Sarge gives are severe,
There's one fact that is perfectly clear:
Beetle Bailey's whole cast
All exist in my past.
I knew each in my Air Force career.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The brattice: a structure you'll find
In the places where iron is mined.
When correct indications
Exist, ventilation's
Controlled when the planks are aligned.

limerick_list.author: GeneralE
limerick_list.text:
When those CME credits are due,
And you still need to gain quite a few,
It might take an all-nighter
To make things seem brighter
And all of those credits accrue.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A counterdeployment is planned;
We have seven battalions on hand.
This impressive array
Is a way to convey
To our foes that we won't be outmanned!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An apothesis isn't a theory,
Or a deification. (How cheery!)
It's a room off the path
In a large public bath,
Or some shelves near a chancel. (How dreary!)

limerick_list.author: Jesse Law
limerick_list.text:
I could synthesize lipids all day,
But that acetyl coenzyme A
Is a substance I lack.
Now Krebs' cycle's off track:
Mitochondria in disarray.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though the fugitive seems extraditable,
The public is roused and excitable.
"He won't get a fair trial,"
They protest, rebel-style,
And I fear a revolt is ignitable.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Let's call in a bulwark installer
To make our stone ramparts still taller,
For the waves are immense,
And without more defence
Our small island will keep getting smaller.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"You're a bubblehead!" That's what he called me;
I'll admit that the insult appalled me.
Though I totaled his car
As I drove through Joe's Bar,
Did he have to get angry? That galled me!

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Now, old bean, please discuss flageolet.
"It's a kidney-shaped haricot, pet,
And to boot, it's a flute
One can toot. There's one root
For this word with two meanings, I'd bet."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Made of corn? It's our favorite muffin,
So I wonder—is Muffy just bluffin'?
Has our tough southern cousin
Just baked us a dozen?
If so, soon our mouths we'll be stuffin'.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A coral, named Carol, related
How the amorphozoa she dated
Made profound social blunders,
Were all gutless wonders,
And sponged all her cash, which she hated.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It's a game that my eighth graders played:
I'd ask, "What's a good word for decayed?"
The response I have cherished
For years is "emperished,"
Which a budding young linguist once made.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Father John is no friend of great shows.
They're expected in church though, he knows:
His externalist parish
Likes the pompous and garish,
So for Heaven's sake anything goes.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
To do craftwork, you'd best understand
You must make every item by hand,
But the craftwork produced
Gives your ego a boost
As your fame and your fortune expand.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
This front porch campaign, new-created,
Was effective and, yes, underrated.
He'd prevail in a breeze,
Self-assured and at ease:
He stayed home, issued statements, and waited.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
As the goyim in Glasgow might say,
"I am fated to die — yes, I'm fey".
Now my Barry will marry
A shiksa named Carrie;
For me, the end's nearing. Oy vey!

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
His state of annoyance, or peevage,
Was suddenly changed to quivivage
When he saw that young Nellie,
South of throat, north of belly,
Showed the valley (V-shaped) of her cleavage.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
For my verse, you're a callous mortician:
You've depoetized every submission.
An original trope
In your hands has no hope,
And is butchered beyond recognition.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Death camases give me the willies.
They look like some edible "lilies,"
But their bulbs, leaves and flowers
Can kill you in hours,
Whether you stands for ewes, cows or fillies.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
This wine-tasting party's too tame
For the godhead of oenophile fame,
'Til it turned orgiastic;
A feast so fantastic
Deserved Dionysus's name.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
There's a conclave about to begin;
See the Cardinals, gathered within.
Each has conclavists, two,
For assistance. Do you
Think they're privy to cardinal sin?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
To pour out, much more quickly than "ooze"?
There, the word that I'd use is effuse,
But for "scattered, spread loose,"
There my choice is effuse.
Such distinctions can greatly amuse.

limerick_list.author: Taillefer
limerick_list.text:
The concepts I lodged in my book
Are beliefs that from others I took.
They wanted them spread
But were scared to embed
Them in theirs. Does this make me a crook?

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
If you live in the water while young
Then develop an air-breathing lung,
You're amphibiotic,
Which ain't idiotic,
At least if it's frogs you're among.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
"Lady, listen: I can book a crew,
But the wait is a week—maybe two.
We can concrete your drive,
But it won't be by five.
Still, your drive'll be smooth when we're through."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
An earnest old man (not some stoner)
Called me up to announce, "I'm the owner
Of knives that you sell
And I like them real well.
What I need now's a seven-inch boner."

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Colonel Blimp, from a thirties cartoon,
Was an ultraconservative goon.
To be blimpish, indeed,
Means to hold such a creed
(Or resemble a bulging balloon).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Did cryptorchism trouble Hephaestus?
He worked next to fire, so each testis
Got hot. Did he tote 'em
Way down in his scrotum,
With underpants made of asbestos?

limerick_list.author: danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
This is you if you hew to the view
That we've screwed up the world that we knew.
There can be no repair.
Buy a gun, say a prayer.
Clearly chaos is coming.  We're  through!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I was tied to the rack and held fast.
"You'll confess to the sins of your past,"
My inquisitor said,
"Or we'll cut off your head,
But acknow, for this offer won't last!"

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
When American Bandstand debuted
What's the first song the disc jockey queued?
Lots of noise kids were makin'
'Cause a whole lot of shakin'
Was goin' on thanks to this dude.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
With flat nethermost parts apropos,
They're designed so that flatboats may go
Through low-water locales
Such as shallow canals,
Seldom running aground even so.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
All my buddies said, "Try almond milk!
It's delicious; its texture's like silk."
I believed in them, but
After squeezing a nut
Felt betrayed by false friends and their ilk.

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
"Antiques are much better than new,"
He declared, "'cause they're tried and they're true."
A chair caught his eye
So he gave it a try.
(I hope they will throw in the glue.)

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
A numbnut geologist, Ned,
Cracked a crag with the back of his head,
Thence finding profusions
Of rounded inclusions
(Or blebs) in the rocks, as he bled.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This story's a downer—it's sad.
My old milk cow's been ailing real bad.
Now she can't even stand.
Called the vet for her, and
The guy called her a downer, the cad!

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Mum, I know you will find this insulting:
Yes, your pride and joy's room is revolting,
But your housework and cleaning,
Though no doubt well-meaning,
Is way the hell too much adulting.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Compared to Broom-Hilda, she's prettier.
Next to Agatha Crumm, she is grittier.
But the reason I read
The strip Betty, indeed,
Is that stacked up to Cathy, she's wittier.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Latin's neat. What I'll show you right now's a
Phrase that lawyers employ — it's a wowser.
To curtail trials' longevity,
For the purpose of brevity,
I just say "brevitatis" then "causa".

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
A cherry that calls itself glacé
Might think that it gives itself cachet.
But the term only means
It has sugary sheens —
And glacé is really quite passé.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though he's cute and would like to be cuddled,
When he chases the "wabbit," he's muddled.
He'll never win hugs
If he runs after Bugs;
He'll remain Mr. Elmer Befuddled.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Then a student of great dedication
Presented on nerve decussation:
"Don't forget," said Horatio,
"This cross (decussatio)
Discloses each nerve's destination."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Closed my eyes and I counted to twenty —
Gave my friend time to hide, time a-plenty.
Then I started to seek,
But it's now been a week . . .
I'm bewilderedly wondering — where went he?

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Picky neighbors, close-by, felt dysphoric,
Seeing packrat Sue's lot (allegoric).
Just next door, they grew yews
To block junk, shield schlock views.
Five years passed, hedgerow thrived! That's historic.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A slow-witted friend of mine, Nick,
Without doubt's an abderite, a hick.
From Abdera he hails,
A place famous for tales
Of the locals, all thought to be thick.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
Master, please, come and see with your eyes.
Where I placed it, my talent still lies.
In this field, by that mound,
It is safe in the ground.
You'll take note I've been fiscally wise.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Round the Christmas menorah we're rockin',
And the Chanukah bush needs a flockin'.
And the atheist dons a
New robe just for Kwaanza.
Any credo or faith?  Come a-knockin'!

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
As I've got my pawns into a mess,
I can see that my queen can't progress.
Behind their ranks, serried,
She's trapped. She's a buried
Piece. King? He's exposed. Such is chess.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
There's gold leaf on my face — I'll explain:
For this foiling I went to some pain;
But I see you're nonplussed,
So my effort's gone bust.
You don't love it — I'm foiled again.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A six- and a five-membered ring,
Fused together, covalently cling.
There are nitrogen joints
At two pentagon points:
Benzimidazole's doing its thing.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
No complaining from me in the least,
Though I age and my power's decreased.
While some times have been rough,
I've been given enough,
And enough is as good as a feast.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
There once was a whaler named Bob
Who suddenly started to sob.
Said the blubbering fool,
Throwing down his sharp tool,
"I'm just not cut out for this job!"

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
A blood sport is one where there's killing,
Like hunting (which some folks find chilling).
But when culling some pest,
Then surely it's best
That it's done by those finding it thrilling.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
As our priest made the case for salvation,
His passions arose; escalation
Of tone and intensity
Increased my propensity
To escalate Sunday's donation.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Euphemistic expressions — oh, phoo!
They annoy me.  Well, what can I do?
Friggin' words that would hide
One's intemperate side
Are for straitlaced Victorians like you.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
He says, cussedly, "Over my dead,
Lifeless body!" It enters my head:
Such a threat from my spouse,
Who's a pig-headed louse,
Tempts this wife to arrange what he said.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
"Making dance follow music's perverse,"
Said a Martha Graham grad, dancer Merce.
Random dance took the stage
Thanks to partner John Cage
And I Ching (but one still must rehearse).

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
Says Gramma: "I like it just fine
Pickin' pole beans that grow on a vine.
But crawlin' aroun'
Pickin' bush beans low down
Ain't the best fer my knees or my spine."

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Aloha's a word for "hello"—a
Hawaiian term, wouldn't you know—a
Pronouncement of greeting
(They use it when meeting),
But also farewell: so, aloha!

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
I'll be firing a porcelain potty,
For stoneware is simply too shoddy.
For trotties' wee waste,
I'll be starting with paste,
Whereas pottery's thrown from a body.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Celebrities, famous and rich,
Overnighting in London, will pitch
Up, direct from their flight,
At The Dorchester, right
Where it's at: five stars up from the ditch.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
This medicinal plaster is rich
In a substance called Burgundy pitch,
Which the chemist refines
Using resin from pines,
And the doctor applies to your itch.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
It's crazy, dear listeners. What cheek!
Who'd intrude in the night, like a sneak,
And strew compost around
On my plant-laden ground?
The plot thickens—so tune in next week.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
Even though this pandemic's a hoax,
I'm still keeping my distance from folks
Lest I hear some fake news
Like vaccines aren't a ruse
Or we went to the moon. All just jokes!

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
I exploit the resource I have mined.
I exploit the recourse law defined.
I exploit the young horse.
I exploit the tongue, Norse.
I'm exploitive—perforce I'm maligned.

limerick_list.author: Jac
limerick_list.text:
Busman's holiday: that's what they say
When your work is mixed up with your play.
Doc watches ER,
The valet cleans the car.
Same tasks as your job — but no pay.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
What honor it is to illuminate
The pivotal role of albuminate.
It's of the same ilk
As casein in milk:
Two proteins upon which to ruminate.

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
My language: it stutters, I stammer,
'Cause I know not so much from it's grammar:
Composition of phrases
Inability raises.
My grammar are all with no glamour.

limerick_list.author: Taillefer
limerick_list.text:
This cake's full of tongue-tingling taste.
I devour it with greed and in haste.
As this flavourful titbit
Is rich, I'm a nitwit
Who loses control of his waist.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
I wouldn't give half of a Pez
For the silly round hat called a fez,
But my brother's a Shriner
And thinks nothing finer.
(The doof is the local Shrine prez.)

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Homosexual women or men
Make society's A-list again?
See the affluent A-gays—
Those très distingué gays—
Draw praise from the journalist's pen.

limerick_list.author: rhymedawg
limerick_list.text:
The world's lacked a leader named Cleon
From four twenty-two (that's B.C.) on.
Had his life been dilemma-less,
Maybe Pericles' nemesis
Would have ruled over Athens an eon.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Our bodies are pressed close together;
Heavy cloth and a thin coat of leather
Keep us slightly apart
As our work day we start
With commuting in cold, wintry weather.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Scandinavian birdies may perch
On this beautiful tree: downy birch,
So to see one, go speedin'
To Norway or Sweden.
That Eden is where you should search.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
The Viking called Eric the Red
Sailed from Norway to Iceland, it's said;
Then fled on to Greenland,
That rarely-been-seen land—
He left his poor neighbours for dead.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
Thick walls and a big iron door
Make a bank vault a good place to store
Your money and rings
And valuable things—
Or wait out a nuclear war.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
Astrologically speaking, I'm torn,
And all horoscopes leave me forlorn.
Ask my sign and I answer,
"I'm leaning towards Cancer,
Uncertain of when I was born."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
As I write this (hang on, just a mo)
Little verse (interrupted, you know!),
Discontinu (what?) ation
Breaks up my narration
That's (otherwise) ready to go.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
That curriculum dean is a pain.
His long talks? Not ad rem, not germane.
He makes meetings a mess;
He can't help but digress,
And it drives us professors insane.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
Overcooking will sometimes dismay
Fans of pasta who hate it that way.
Some say, "Firm to the bite:
Mastication delight!"
That's al dente. Go try some today.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Far-off India's where they are from,
And these cluster beans give us guar gum,
Which gives thickness to food.
Though its name may seem crude,
To its charms the food chemists succumb.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I met someone superb at the dance —
Hoped that moment would lead to romance.
Halitosis she smelled.
"Holy Moses!" she yelled.
My bad breath burst my break — blew my chance.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"That club's moniker sure disconcerts
All its fans," said the mayor.  "It hurts
City pride and brings shame.
So I'm scrapping the name
Of that Little League team: Hershey Squirts."

limerick_list.author: AES
limerick_list.text:
Not oral — let's make it quite clear,
Your auris is what lets you hear.
With your os now, you pout,
Blow kisses and shout,
But aural belongs to the ear.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Ancient words are the fare of my care
And I've one that I'm longing to share.
It means "gravelly beach"
Or "a sandbank". What peach
Of a word have I heard? Why, it's air.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
She'd been known for her pacifist rants,
And her strong vegetarian stance.
When her one-year-old spewed
Out pureed baby food,
She yelled, "Bubbeleh, give peas a chance!"

limerick_list.author: Robert Schechter
limerick_list.text:
Eden, for those who still cleave
To the Bible, means "garden where Eve
And Adam once dwelled
Before being compelled,
For eating an apple, to leave."

limerick_list.author: cecelia
limerick_list.text:
Her passion for him made her gush,
"I'm bound to admit I've a crush.
His clothes are so dandy...
He's tasty eye-candy!
Such a pity he's daft as a brush."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Captain Wright was alight (he's excitable).
"Can the North and the South be unitable?
I adore civil war—
Never bored if there's gore;
Blood galore flows when battles are fightable."

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
You bought fair trade — an action which means
That your coffee's arabica beans
First attracted a price
Which the grower found nice.
(This could also apply to your jeans.)

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
Some addicts abuse their own pets
To get pain-killing drugs from their vets.
Cut your dog with a blade —
Got it made in the shade!
Very sad how bad drug seeking gets.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Well, your candidate didn't get picked
And beforehand not one could predict
Just how bad the defeat—
Oh, good Lord, he got beat!
It's an avalanche!  Asses were kicked!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
So this frail saunters out of the fog
On two pins to set blind men agog.
"I'm a check girl," she claims,
And I'm thinkin', "These dames
Could make patsies like me move to Prague."

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
In England the Law makes it clear:
A pint is a full pint of beer.
The glass must be brimmed,
Though the lights might be dimmed,
And if not — well the fines are severe.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Son, your wife's taking life on the chin,
So step up, help her do for her kin.
They'll need basics and care,
So be patient… be there.
And forbearance is where you begin.

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
When the speed of the sound in a gas
Is the speed of its flow, this will pass:
A choked flow is produced,
Which gives rockets their boost
And helps valves to control flow of mass.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm in awe; that new chef leaves me wordless!
Her divine milk-based sauces are curdless.
But with guys she's not hip,
And she's dating a drip,
Man, I'm hoping she soon will be nerdless.

limerick_list.author: Elliot Niman
limerick_list.text:
An equinox leads us to spring,
With summer to be the next thing.
Length of day will increase,
And the schooldays will cease,
While baseball will be the new king.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
This demolitionist's work is top drawer.
Pounding pavements, he sells door to door.
He turns structures to rubble
And gets paid for his trouble.
Yep, business is booming, for sure.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A doper was looking to hide
Marijuana, but nowhere he tried
Seemed a suitable place,
Till he noticed a vase
That was perfect to cachepot inside.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"My back teeth," cried Cassandra, "are floating.
I'm pretty damn near to exploding."
She'd put off nature's call,
So she — quick — grabbed a stall
And proceeded with bladder unloading.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Slow election results are the fount
Of conspiracy. Feel tensions mount.
Each political side
Will find ways to deride
What they'll label as lies. Let's recount!

limerick_list.author: Paul Lusch
limerick_list.text:
The arrogant man's overbearing;
He's proud, and he's rude and uncaring.
And further, he knows
That his shoes and his clothes
Are much better than those that you're wearing.

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
I'm a quiet, teetotaling bird,
And from drinks that are shaken or stirred
I routinely abstain,
But I'll sip some champagne,
Although don't tell my wife — Mumm's the word!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
"Listen, you goons, I got dibs
On this uterine space," says His Nibs.
"Ain't no embryo schools;
Adelphophagy rules."
And the sandtiger shark eats his sibs.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
This frivolous frippery's mine,
Sparkling kitsch and cheap brooches — divine!
They're not gold, no, you snobs;
Just some old bits and bobs,
But they twinkle and glitter and shine.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
Shot on film in his skivvies, good grief!
Hussein has a genuine beef:
"We don't pose in our Jockeys,
Us Muslim Iraqis."
His lawyers are filing a brief.

limerick_list.author: Reia Light
limerick_list.text:
The substance called blende's not a drink.
It's part sulfur, which means it might stink.
It's the brownish-black ore
Of some metal—want more?
You can figure it out if you zinc.

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles
limerick_list.text:
"You're despicable, Bush!  End the war!"
Yelled the liberals with scorn; they were sore.
All that's changed (by and large)
Now Obama's in charge:
They, despicably, protest no more!

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
That red line on the front of the court
Is the cutline—your serve came up short.
It's just squash; don't get nervous—
Make sure that your service
Is in bounds (not at me or athwart!).

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Canadian healthcare — sublime!
You'll start clinic appointments on time,
Except when there's a hitch,
Unpredictable glitch —
Multitasking doc's late, but no crime.

limerick_list.author: limarico
limerick_list.text:
"I want nothing to drink," she says first;
Alternately, "I'm dying of thirst."
Such a wavering mind!
Of all vices I find
Connie's constant inconstancy worst.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
At the front of the festive parade
Is a pennant that's war-torn and frayed.
This honored old rag
And the national flag
Are the colors of Quentin's Brigade.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An unfortunate man named MacGregor
Went from rising young yuppie to beggar
After losing his cash
In a stock market crash,
And from moderate drinker to kegger.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
When an earthquake occurs in the ground
A reaction is felt all around.
The most damage will be
At the epicentre, see,
Straight above where the fault rupture's found.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The cartulary holds all the deeds
And the copies of charters he needs
To divide the estate
And decide on the fate
Of her baubles and bangles and beads.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
"Don't talk with your mouth full," we're told;
Deipnosophists surely would scold —
For they're the ones able
To chat at the table,
Amusing, while dinner gets cold.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
Entoparasites, carried inside,
Were the reason that Josephine died.
She had hookworms galore,
Protozoa and more,
Plus a tapeworm along for the ride.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
With a bottle brush, bottles with dirt'll
Be cleaned out in no time.  A fertile
Beaufortia would do.
Callistemon makes two
Well-named substitutes, kin to the myrtle.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Conspurcation: the act of defiling,
Which conscienceless types find beguiling.
They spread their pollution,
Escape prosecution,
And boast to their stockholders, smiling.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I knew two Kentish blokes, dim-bulb divvies,
Who'd go hunting clad only in skivvies —
Not in Wellies or tweed
Breeks or waistcoats; indeed,
Should they come, they're the ones a host chivvies.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The highwaymen couch by the road
In the bushes and signal by code.
There's a horse-driven coach
That is on its approach,
So get ready for guns to explode.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
At his funeral she felt on the verge
Of a meltdown, complete with the urge
To intone, loudly groaning,
Her own lonely moaning
To merge with the organist's dirge.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
In my favourite recipe book
Every dish has a photo. I look
At the words (on the page
The pic faces) to gauge
How to roast, boil or fry what I cook.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
At Dee's party, we'll happily maffick.
Her book that is biogeographic
Is grand; it tracks species
In space and time. Gee, she's
The maven of animal traffic!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
For my good-looking ex, I still yearned,
But my love for her wasn't returned.
So I made it my aim
To forget my old flame,
Since I'd carried a torch and got burned.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
The Lord High Protector, he kept her,
The dead King's young Princess, and prepped her.
She reigned, but he ruled,
Though a crownlet bejewelled
He gave her (so too, a toy sceptre).

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
Some people might think it sublime
To live in a sunnier clime,
But they shouldn't complain
If it pours down with rain:
For us slugs the sun ruins our slime.

limerick_list.author: Rose Nunez
limerick_list.text:
Not auditing each nook and cranny?
The acid-test ratio's canny:
Just add up their net,
Then divide by their debt,
To see if they're worth a rat's fanny.

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
I rebuffed a flirtatious advance
From a wraith at a séance in France.
I could see through her clearly:
She would not love me dearly—
We hadn't a ghost of a chance.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
Cells make embryos. How? It's fantastic!
The action this cell takes seems drastic:
Without aid of a knife,
It divides, forms new life!
Such a cell is called embryoplastic.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
No Washington Redskins appear
To have noses to grindstones this year.
They're just rich sons-a-bitches—
Too big for their britches—
All chiefs and no Indians here.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Alphabetically ordered are three
Of Afghanistan's letters, I see.
So I'll Kabul together
A limerick, and whether
It works doesn't matter to me.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
"The harder I work," said young Finn,
"The more I love learning — win-win!"
"It's true," said his dad,
"And I'm glad for you, lad!
You get out," he said, "what you put in."

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
Anarchic means out of control,
Without law, and where surely the whole
Of a country's behaviour
Cries out for a saviour,
Though few could adopt such a role.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The boundaries of logic I'll push
As I sit here at home on my tush:
If I hold half a bird
In my hand, it's inferred
That it's equal to one in the bush.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
I suppose I should plan on resuming
Some attention to personal grooming.
People constantly stare
At my teeth, nails, and hair
'Cause they're nasty. Or so I'm assuming.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
I considered the dish of the day
At a lackluster Baghdad cafe.
On the chef's bad advice,
I was served "Condi Rice",
Which the chef made a hash of, they say.

limerick_list.author: rusty
quartus
limerick_list.text:
Good limericks have to combine
More than humorous words in each line:
With rhythm and meter
The scansion's much sweeter —
And it helps if you make the thing rhyme!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Epidemiologists learn how disease
Can transmit through the masses. Then these
Epidemic-trained pros
Diagnose and propose
Based on specialized field expertise.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Though word processing's now what I pick,
I will still need to pick up a Bic
Ball point pen when I jot
Down a thought, and it's not
Very likely I'll quit scribbling quick.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Shooting drugs, getting high was my lot,
From the substance dependence I'd got.
So cold turkey I tried:
Laid off drugs; nearly died.
Have I kicked them? One more? Well, why not?

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
No, I didn't like Dwight a whole lot;
With my wife he appeared hot to trot.
Pulled wire tight round his neck —
He died choking like heck.
For garrotting, in hell I'll go rot.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Spells of goety, solemnly read,
Conjured evil ones, raised from the dead.
Now, despite my dissents,
They'll change future events:
They're within me, controlling my head.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Persian puss loves our Persian rug's mat nap,
Its voluptuous velvety fat nap;
And on it, she chiefly
(Just lightly and briefly)
Flops down and drops off for her catnap.

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
At Christmas, the world hopes for pax;
But that hope contradicts all the facts:
There's disease and decay,
Disarray and dismay…
Don't despair —  Merry Christmas — relax!

limerick_list.author: LoudNotes
limerick_list.text:
Our old Irish rebel (a Fenian)
Got two given names: he's Eugene Ian.
When his crimes were policed,
Ian moved to the east
And lived meanly, but free, as Armenian.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
Sparta's ephoralty: five men respected
So highly, their kings were subjected.
Any Spartan intelligible
Was patently eligible,
But never could be re-elected.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
As a sculptor, Dossena sold many
Fine works, but for hardly a penny.
"He's a forger!" some cried.
"It's my dealers who lied,"
He replied. Now his fame? Hardly any.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Not a Japanese radish, no daikon,
Nor a waterside dike path to bike on,
Is a dykon.  No way!
She is famous and gay,
Just like Ellen, a lesbian icon.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I'm a Cancer, which serves to connote
I'll be crabby with you if you gloat
After butting my head.
You're a Capricorn, said
To enjoy getting everyone's goat.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The "Departure Lounge"—what could that be?
Geriatrics, it's easy to see.
That's where oldsters are stored.
Average age on this ward
Is approaching a hundred and three.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
The cnidarian sea-nettle fends
Like a hot pepper jelly; it sends
Its nematocysts, cnidae,
To burn nerves inside me:
This jellyfish stings at its ends.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
¶ Blind Ps (also pilcrows) are signs
For new paragraphs' starts. ¶ Draw two lines,
Then a back-facing bump
Near the top. (Or a hump
On its back? Are those lines double spines??)

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
The harp is beyond me.  Oh, jeez!
I never could play it with ease—
All my fingers are thumbs.
But the wind itself strums
The aeolian harp.  It's a breeze!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Said Ramón, a plantation official,
"Air-curing is so beneficial
To tobacco!  Repeat:
Never use any heat
On your leaves from a source artificial!"

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
They came cloudily into my view —
Indistinctly, obscurely.  I knew
That that spouse-cheating pair
Could not see I was there.
I, in cuckold-despair, shot the two.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
"Lutra lutra!" I call, and she's there,
Long and slender with thick, warming hair.
She feeds mostly on fish,
As did we on this dish,
But to kill otters now, none would dare.

limerick_list.author: RGiskard
limerick_list.text:
Cage aux Folles was a play made in France,
Which Hollywood filmed to "enhance."
Called The Birdcage, this rag
Had Gene Hackman in drag
And a pre-Ally Flockhart romance.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Beach volleyball's sand-covered court
Makes us think of a summer resort,
With some gals, in bikinis,
As sprightly as genies.
Is this an Olympic Games sport?

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
Hung over, I couldn't abide
The headache or nausea, so I'd
Antidotally use
A few ounces of booze;
Without "hair of the dog," I'd have died.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
In my government-issue fatigues,
I am drafting and planning intrigues.
In these state-supplied clothes,
The best teams I compose,
So I'll win my war fantasy leagues.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If I clobber a Slav or a Russian,
Slug a Frenchman, or batter a Prussian,
I'll not only cause pain,
But may injure the brain—
A commotio—that's a concussion.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
The speaker wrapped up his oration
With an epigrammatic quotation.
This added a bit
Of succinctness and wit,
And some welcome diversification.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Here's a talent I learned after school:
How to bank off the cushions in pool,
Beat my blocked-shot travails
With those rubberized rails,
And stay confident, crafty… and cool.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
A particle, bit, tuft or lock
Of fiber or hair is a flock.
Empty clouds, quoth one book,
Have the semblance or look
Of some high flocks of wool, white as chalk.

limerick_list.author: Egbert
limerick_list.text:
If your natural demeanour is meek
And your friends call you "square", do not seek
To conform with the boobish.
Far better be cubish
Than a tit any day of the week.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I asked if she wanted to dance
In the hope it might lead to romance.
"Gotta run," she replied
As she swept me aside.
With that brush-off, she spurned my advance.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
"You're not funny. Your jokes suck," she said.
"They are boring. The punch lines fall dead.
You will not get a smile
 With your blah comic style."
But she laughed when I jumped in her bed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Continuousness—action non-stop:
That describes how, each Christmas, I shop,
And it's true (no denying),
Excessively buying.
"Merry Christmas," I cry, as I drop.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Backhand slaps (not the palm side) I get
Now from Mom.  Seems I've made her upset.
Statement charges she sees.
"I don't recognize these!
This was your doing!  Now we're in debt!"

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
When gray storm clouds dissolve the sky's blue,
Utter bleakness and weakness ensue.
Each day becomes duller—
Sapped of life and of color.
Does the winter devitalise you?

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Two new rabbis have dressed their first deer:
She's been skinned and then emptied. They hear
Someone say, "Don't employ 'em,
They're hunters — like goyim.
Bet they're noshing on chitlins and beer."

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When the choir was discordant and bored,
Every chord in the score was ignored.
With its harmony wrong,
'Twas a singular song,
Since they couldn't agree on accord.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
I'd been searching for bargains in Beares
Without finding a trace of such wares.
Then I saw in their basement
This sign of displacement:
"Bargain Basement on Fourth Floor Upstairs".

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In Haiti, you knock on the door
Of a witch doctor called the bokor.
You try to be calm—be
Composed when a zombie
Responds, offers rum, starts to pour.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Lest you think that it's just posts and railing,
A bannister stops you from flailing.
Climbing stairs, you hold on,
Although some kids are drawn
To slide down one for thrills quite unfailing.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When I showed her my bracelet,  Aunt Jean
Said, "This gem is the strangest I've seen.
With a sort of a stripe,
It's a cymophane type
Of a cat's-eye, and yellowish green."

limerick_list.author: mino
limerick_list.text:
Use the bark that they call angostura
For bitters: there's no bark that's purer.
Mix with lemon and lime
For a drink quite sublime;
For the sick, it's a world-famous curer.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
We elected a principled fellow
To Congress, who quickly turned yellow.
With his courage askew,
I'm ashamed by this true
Gutless wonder whose spine is like jello.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The senator used camouflagic
Behavior for masking the logic
That just wasn't there.
He even would dare
To call honest dissent demagogic.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Your gallantry, sir, has no bound;
Though that courtliness stuff, I have found,
In seducers like you
Has a good deal to do
With the fact I've young daughters around.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
When such peace dawned (a blessing I knew,
This beatitude, special joy, few
Come to feel)—how to say—
Is there more than to pray,
Giving thanks for this gift? Hallelu!

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
"My congregants long for a beacon,"
Said the priest to the elder archdeacon.
"In the Bronx, they all claim
That the bishop should name,
To succeed you, a young Puerto Rican."

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
A biker chick known as Sweet Lilian
Got a ride from a swarthy Sicilian.
Astride his big Honda
Relations grew fonder—
But they waned when she fell off the pillion.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
Father Jim is becoming obsessional
About dubious doings Congressional;
But he can't say a word
'Cause it's something he heard
In the secrecy of the confessional.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
When deciders (in line with the truth)
And causers (decidedly couth)
Are allied, then a pride
Of young lions beside
Frisky lambkins will sunbathe, forsooth!

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Vaunted gardens can flaunt their regalias,
Floral indicas (vintage azaleas) —
Drayton's planted them brashly
At his home on the Ashley,
For those eye-catching spring 'saturnalias'.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
"Here's a trip to the Faroes, half-price,"
Said my wife, "I think that would be nice."
She means Egypt, methinks—
But instead of the Sphinx,
All we'd see would be tundra and ice.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Said a dove-eyed young doughboy named Nate,
"This conflict I surely do hate.
I was given a gun,
Then was sent to Verdun.
I wonder why this war's called Great."

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
My old quilt with the grape Kool-Aid stain,
That was sewed by my mommy's Aunt Jane,
Keeps me comfy and snug
When I ache with a bug.
I guess that's why it's called "counter-pain".

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The orator moved one and all
As his baritone voice filled the hall.
By the end of the night
We were ready to fight
In response to his clarion call.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Are we able to keep our own plan
And our doctor?  We're told, "Yes, you can."
My employer says I'm
Being dropped to part time.
He won't offer me coverage.  Aw, man!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Yellow quartz has a beautiful sheen.
I declare it is fit for a queen,
So don't call it a fake;
Give this gemstone a break.
Not false topaz, please call it citrine.

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
My beloved has every grace;
Jacob's beauty is seen in her face.
She will blush like a rose
If I also disclose:
She has Esau's too (guess in what place?).

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Bookaholics like you love to buy
And then read lots of books — dunno why.
Can't you get on the 'net
All that's written as yet?
Kiss those dead-tree editions goodbye.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
"When some circles, concentric (same center),
Are drawn, any number many enter.
An infinite lot
Find, as center, one spot,
As you'll note in my trumpets," says Stentor.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There is darky, and crow, and then coon,
Used by folks who from tact are immune.
What you cannot escape:
If you call a man "ape,"
It is you who's the racist baboon.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
As he listened to Mama and Dada,
The baby grew madder and madder.
"These ickle wee bootees
On his footsies are cuties!"
On cue, diddums emptied his bladder.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Last weekend when we were together
You asked for a poem about feather.
This is it!  See those things
That comprise a bird's wings?
They're for tickling dark regions (yours, nether).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In his pocket, our dad keeps a flask.
To carry some brandy's its task.
It is thin, narrow-necked,
And I somehow suspect
He'd prefer to be toting a cask.

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
In case you are feeling inclined,
To consume, on a gouda, the rind,
Try the gold rind instead
Of the casing that's red.
('Cause for eating, that rind's not designed.)

limerick_list.author: C. H. Carpenter
limerick_list.text:
Muscularity stretching his shirt
(Which was sweaty and stained) made her blurt,
"His rough brawniness there
And his strength made me stare.
Great physique, but I don't like the dirt."

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
Though he sounds like a drummer, he's not.
He's a beatboxer – hear what he's got.
His astonishing feat
Is in voicing the beat.
His percussion's amazingly hot.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Caveman Dana was brought to his knees
By his latest invention: a cheese
From the milk of great woolly
She-mammoths. He'd fully
Expected to milk them with ease!

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
A dock-walloper, that's what I be.
Longshoreman or lumper, that's me.
I unload, check, and sort
What the buyers import
When their transports return from the sea.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Said a sugarcane planter, "I wonder
What to do with the dregs we call dunder
And black scum that we skim
From our vats' bubbling brim?
We'll make rum! That's the answer, by thunder!"

limerick_list.author: Barbara Robson
limerick_list.text:
When an axis is shared by two things —
Two tubes, two propellers, two springs —
They're coaxial, we'd say:
It's the best 3D way
To call them concentric, like rings.

limerick_list.author: Bob Egg
limerick_list.text:
With speed and superb close control
I jink goalwards—that is, towards goal—
Where I'm forced to surrender
The ball: their defender
Stands firm as a telephone pole.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
Many students when wanting to crib'll
Write facts on their hands in a scribble
To stop them from failin'.
But why did Ms. Palin
Use notes?  So the public can quibble!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Advertisers are running amuck.
They're pursuing the almighty buck.
Though I'm anticommercial,
It's noncontroversial
To those who just endlessly suck.

limerick_list.author: Tom Foolery
limerick_list.text:
What is used to entice is called bait,
Which to place in the water and wait
Is a pastime held high
In regard, though just why
No one's ever been able to state.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
I write code for my website with ease: No more styling my

s and s. Bootstrap's got all I need For my site to succeed: It makes HTML-ing a breeze.

limerick_list.author: psh and danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
Practiced colature (straining technique)
Is performed by top chefs as we speak.
While just pasta some sieve,
Many others may give
A fruit sauce or a soup a nice tweak.

limerick_list.author: mino
limerick_list.text:
You'll find lancelet, eelesque amphioxus,
Face-down in the sand by the dockses.
With a cord but no spine,
He tastes mighty darn fine;
You can catch him in nets or in sockses.

limerick_list.author: Nick Szymanski
limerick_list.text:
Dearest reader, I welcome you. Hi!
Here's a riddle: what's wet and yet dry?
Here's the answer: dry wine,
Good to drink while you dine—
It's not sweet like a liquorice pie.

limerick_list.author: BobfromThirsk
limerick_list.text:
Now it's time to BOGOF at the sales
And to sort through the clothes on the rails.
We'll go on a spree
And buy one, get one free,
'Fore the Amex or Visa card fails.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
"Make 'em die," say the bird-hating folk,
Unaware of the sexual joke.
Being loath to sit idly,
They act avicidally,
Just itching for chickens to choke.

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
In love with her right from the start,
I foolishly offered my heart.
Being hers to abuse,
With the heels of her shoes
She contused it and tore it apart.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
So much blissfulness fills up our tutor.
Negativity doesn't pollute her.
Her abundance of joy
Is enough to annoy;
It's so cloying, the class wants to shoot her.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Send the updated BG to me;
Take the flight number BG-03.
Fly from Munich, Bavaria,
To Sofia, BG.
See you later, or (German) bg!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I make sure that the gas tank is full,
But the car doesn't start; have to pull
It to town with a horse—
A big strong one, of course—
For repair.  I declare, "That's no bull!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"For external use only" it said.
(It was meant to be rubbed on one's head.)
But Tom ate the whole tube,
Like an ignorant boob.
Two days later, this moron was dead.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
An arm of the famous UN,
FAO as it's known, is where men
And women are meeting
With hopes of defeating
World problems of hunger, but when?

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
When I met you 'twas love at first sight.
I thought you were handsome and bright.
And now that I know you
I hope I can show you
How happy I am to be right.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Without rattles, I'll go putt-putt-putt,
Drawing air in, then out of my butt.
The sound that I make'll
Be known as cloacal
(Putt) popping. No need for "tut, tut."

limerick_list.author: hugh.adler and Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
If you drink, due to some predilection,
Dirty water, your lungs, on dissection,
May be found to possess
A huge abscess, no less:
An acanthamoeba infection.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If a plane features berths, does that make
It a bedding plane? What a mistake!
Geological data
Show planes between strata;
The site where the rocks often break.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Good King Wenceslas' cook is on leave on
A rather remiss Feast of Stephen;
So he orders and eats a
Thick, well-risen pizza.
His meal? Deep-pan, crispy and even.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
There's no trauma that's hard to accept
For the linguist who's language-adept,
Since in truth it's not hard
To define a bee yard:
It's a place in which beehives are kept.

limerick_list.author: LoudNotes
limerick_list.text:
If a country is ruled by just one,
Protestation is met with a gun.
Autocratic's the rule
In an autarchy cruel,
And El Jefe, he has all the fun.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
If with ... stick it's your aim to provoke
And describe something bad with a joke,
Then take care what you pick
For the type of your stick—
When in Britain, it's dirty we poke.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
In my childhood, a dustman was strong,
For he worked lifting bins all day long;
Carried high on his back,
To the cart, was a knack
He could master, while whistling a song!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A sprinter was beaten by ploys in
A race with a tough Illinoisan—
A flash who talked trash
In the hundred-yard dash.
(One man's meet is another man's poison.)

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
My babe's pedagogical treasure;
I use her to teach cubic measure.
Three-dimensional size
Is her lesson for guys —
To determine her volume's a pleasure.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When he thinks of the hours she keeps,
Gina's dad is so sad that he weeps,
As by day Gina carhops;
By night Gina bar hops.
Dad wonders just when Gina sleeps.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Mom's embroidery's second to none,
The fine finger-work perfectly done,
Not a thread misaligned.
Yet Mom's legally blind
And still stitching — a young ninety-one.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
Now this green Aubusson in the hall
Is the carpet we bought, you'll recall,
Near that little chateau
On the coast, near Bordeaux,
From that charming old rug maker's stall.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The star of our featured ballet
Is a tragic Camille, critics say.
She plays the role dreamfully—
Naively, not schemefully—
Like a sleepwalker: fey, not risqué.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
In the age of "Magnificent Lawrence",
Some Sandro, who looked with abhorrence
On a corpulent belly,
Was called Botticelli:
A marvellous painter of Florence.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Adhesive tape's handy, I guess,
Yet it sure gives me lots of distress.
It adheres to the floor,
To the door, and what's more,
Sticks to me, all gummed up — what a mess!

limerick_list.author: SenatorZen
limerick_list.text:
Mixing acid with jazz may enthuse us,
Though explaining just why might confuse us.
Stir the pot with a dash
Of beats bleeping and brash,
But those dance steps will always bemuse us.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
De Chirico's colour and line
Were intense; his determined design
Was to paint the surreal-
ness of Turin. Most feel
The results are declaredly fine.

limerick_list.author: Kalleh
limerick_list.text:
Dental caries are sometimes quite painful;
For my dentist they're frequently gainful.
First he drills, then he fills,
Then come burdensome bills.
Of his greed I am rather disdainful!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"All present," he states, "and correct,"
To the major. "None gone, sir. (We checked.)
Not like last week when we
Came up short twenty-three,
A regrettable case of neglect."

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
That quack chiropractor named Jack?
Lacking tact, he attracted attack.
He was sacked when he smacked
Every back that he cracked,
Which, in fact, left him taken aback.

limerick_list.author: proof and Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Chang: a place Cameroonians hang.
Harps from Persia, once: changs (how they rang!).
Ale from Thailand: Chang beer.
Name for Yangtze: Chang's here.
Grand Slam tennis, young champ: Michael Chang.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I was bred in Keewatin—a scion
Of indigenous groups—Chipewyan.
Nature's lure's oversold
And the cold's getting old.
Hell, I'm numb! If I'm lyin', I'm dyin'.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
I'd imagine it's not a surprise
That my Moggy's a magnet for flies.
That's how maggots are bred
In a body that's dead:
They arise, I surmise, when it dies.

limerick_list.author: Jared Wright (LimerickLife)
limerick_list.text:
Take care, Masticophis flagellum,
That when coachdrivers turn up, you tell 'em
Your species endorses
For use with their horses
The coachwhip that leathersmiths sell 'em.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
It's so sticky and humid and clammy;
With the heat, it's a real double whammy.
I can't understand why
The damned dew point's so high
Since I moved from Duluth to Miami.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
A cramped canyon defile through walls tall
Allowed Butch and pal Sundance to stall
In this venue austere.
Once their pathway was clear,
They'd debouch from their Hole-in-the-Wall.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
What's acanthin? A skeletal start
To some radiolarians, part
Of the ones not siliceous
(Some find them nutritious);
It's strontium chloride at heart.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The anglers in Boston are odd.
For their neighbors, they've nary a nod.
The Lowells will yak
With the haddock and jack,
But the Cabots speak only to cod.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
To set a good table, include
A wide-ranging assortment of food.
Salads, vegetables, ham,
Pasta, cold cuts, roast lamb
Should all be attractively viewed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Several grasses have spikelets like brushes
That look foxy," says Jane as she flushes.
"They are sharp and not plush-like,
But spiky and brushlike."
(She just thinks about foxtails and blushes.)

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
Will you marry me, Susan, this spring?
Just my surname — that's Vincent — I bring.
What, my name's not enough?
Are you calling my bluff?
Well then, here's the evincement — a ring.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The Cuff Links sang "Tracy," a hit.
And the members?  Ron Dante—that's it—
Singing background and lead
On the song and, indeed,
The whole album.  This "group" he then quit.

limerick_list.author: Scott Campisi
limerick_list.text:
The word are means the same, don't you see,
Whether rich, poor, or plain bourgeoisie—
Whether urban or rural:
The third person plural
Indicative form of to be.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I'll exinanite myself of all pride
And all power, till empty inside —
Self-reduce, self-abase
As did Christ for our race:
Man, not God, till the day that he died.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Your Schrödinger's Limerick waits:
Ambiguity's one of its traits.
Is it funny? Perhaps.
We won't know 'til collapse
Of its superposition of states.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The estimator said, "How bizarre!
You've totaled, once more, a new car —
There is no need to estimate!
You were, I'd, guesstimate
Totaled as well, in the bar!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
There's a plant about which my prof banters:
Circaea—it's nightshade (enchanter's!).
"Have no fear," teased Doc Smedley.
"This nightshade sounds deadly,
But it's not. People grow it in planters."

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
A bold-hearted madman named Cassity
Confronted his docs with audacity.
He stood on his head
And drank six Watney's Red
As a proof of his mental capacity.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
They couldn't get in if they tried;
The tall fence signalled "entrance denied."
Safe within the exclosure
There'd be no exposure
To scrumpers — kept strictly outside.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Room 13's FTD, which is why
All his visiting loved ones will cry.
With his cancer now spreading,
We know where he's heading:
The patient is fixin' to die.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
"That Holstein is calving!" he yelled.
Her new heifer, the mother expelled.
She didn't seem rattled,
Her nerves were not addled.
At calving, that cow had excelled.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
Said the teachers, "He's acting unruly in
His classes" (my younger son Julian).
Typing "hyperactivity
AND bored NOT passivity,"
I started a Google search (Boolean).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My friend Rita had asked that I meet 'er
At her brother's new bistro: Chez Peter.
When I groused that the meat
Was as hard as concrete,
Rita cried, "Gee, you're some picky eater!"

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles and Ulfras
limerick_list.text:
Archetypical archetypes feel
Like my perfect Platonic ideal.
But collective Mankind
Sends my Jungian mind
The reminder, "C'mon, keep it real!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A back-up that offers you nerve,
A reliever who's known for his curve,
And the White House's wings
Are auxiliary things,
Supplemental or kept in reserve.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I thought they would sell at that store
Some glazed porcelain dolls, but they swore,
"We've no china dolls, though
To find chana dal, go
To the Indian restaurant next door."

limerick_list.author: asjchae
limerick_list.text:
In seeking good health, folks are very
Enticed by this fruit, red and merry.
To obtain healthy skin
Or feel peace from within,
People swear by the great goji berry.

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
The young sheep was not yet one year old
And was almost too cute to behold.
But this eanling tormented
His mom, who lamented,
"I love him and just cannot scold."

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
Orestes should fear this epiphany:
Alecto, Magaera, Tisiphone!
Beware the Eumenides
When singing their threnodies;
You'll go mad when you hear their polyphony.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
He's a very small adult, homuncular,
Who acts like my uncle — avuncular.
Though he's quick with a grin,
All those boils on his skin
Are repellent — they're oozing, furuncular.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
My mind is a blank, I confess,
'Cause my memory's really a mess.
I just wish that I knew
What so recently flew
From my brain. I am cuckoo, I guess.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
As my colleagues each hold a firm note,
A new tone issues forth from my throat:
Not a fifth or a third,
But so near it's absurd.
Does close harmony garner your vote?

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
A horseman who'd ride on a disc
Would certainly run a bad risk.
But DJs won't ride—
They guide you, with pride,
To the music you like, slow or brisk.

limerick_list.author: Basingstoke
limerick_list.text:
Holding aqueducts up, a great host
Of arches, the Romans could boast,
Would bring water for friends'
And for countrymen's ends,
'Cause the arch beats the lintel and post.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The odd weather of late's like my life:
Satisfactions beleaguered by strife.
I'm on top, but plateauing;
In the sunshine, it's snowing—
Guess the Devil is beating his wife.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
A garrison settlement's here
In a land Romans conquered with fear;
Of young soldiers bereft,
Only veterans left—
Now this colony meaning's quite clear.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Though at Adwalton Moor Fairfax lost,
He made Royalists pay a great cost.
Stout Sir Thomas, outnumbered,
With raw troops encumbered,
Was doomed—his bold gambit star-crossed.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I have been in a state of euphoria,
All due to my landscaper Gloria.
She planted an herb
Now in bloom: a superb,
Showy knapweed—the thistly centaurea.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
I confess, in my dissolute youth
I've been drunk as a skunk, that's the truth.
Now I'm old and my bladder
Is shrinking. What's sadder?
I'm stinking and out of vermouth.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The Internet's growing with vigor,
And a brontobyte's massive, you'd figger.
You'd be right. It's the top
Of where byte names now stop.
Whatever's the most, bronto-'s bigger.

limerick_list.author: Colin Salter
limerick_list.text:
Chubby Checker, I wish you'd desist —
It was you, got me dancing the Twist.
I was still twisting when
You sang "Let's twist again!"
Then I fell and I twisted my wrist.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
"See that none of your actions embarrasses.
Those slopes, like that tower in Paris's,
Are thousand-foot drops.
Do not run!  No fast stops."
Our whole class walked on air at the arrises.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
A sober young shortstop, named Grieg,
Moved from minor up to a big league.
But he found that to play
For a top team each day
Made him drink to relieve the fatigue.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Bradycardia: heart beating slow;
Take care if your pulse falls too low.
The cause? Not specific,
Perhaps soporific
Effects from The Brady Bunch show?

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
Though to menace I'm hardly a stranger,
Don't scream if I'm not in its range, or
Alert me: "A fire!"
If the peril's not dire.
Could this threat be a clear, present danger?

limerick_list.author: geniuswaitress
limerick_list.text:
A doctor once found a new way
To tout his religion all day:
He told all his clients,
"Believe Christian Science.
The Rx is simple — just pray!"

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
A gammadion cross marks our door:
A vile swastika — hatred hardcore,
Most accursed of brands,
Scrawled by odious hands.
"Pass it over," you counsel? No more!

limerick_list.author: man from tashkent
limerick_list.text:
While it's true that I could have been blunter,
Through my words, I am still an affronter.
  The words that I used
  Left her ego so bruised!
(But I still think she's fatter than Gunter.)

limerick_list.author: Virge
limerick_list.text:
Young girls used to walk down the aisle
When wedding while young was the staisle.
Now, to see Mr. Right
Down that aisle of white,
I'll wager you're waiting a whaisle.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
At communion today, Father Seth
Took the cup and his very last breath.
Someone poisoned the wine
So that less-than-divine
Had a staged eucharistical death.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Either-or is the choice I like best.
Only two must I put to the test.
"Is you is? Is you ain't?"
Hamlet asked with restraint,
But in language poetically dressed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In botanical study, one learns
There are plants that one treasures or spurns;
But I love microscopical
Study of tropical
Actiniopteris ferns.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Dilatoriness: slowness to act.
Jack procrastinates, breaking his pact.
He had sworn to his mate
He'd be home before eight,
But he's late for their date—that's a fact.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I cook dishes with rice as a base,
Some so spicy they'll crimson your face.
Suffused with great flavor,
Rice works in my favor.
Supportive, my rice knows its place.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
"Let me put my arms round you. My hug
Will enfold you and wrap you up snug.
Let me squeeze you in tight,
My embrace will delight...."
"Keep that mitt of yours off of my jug."

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
They all gather outside and blow smoke.
As you pass them, it's hard not to choke.
Aspirational goal:
It's to breathe through a hole
In the top of my head — that's no joke!

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
In Asgard, three Norse gods of war,
Namely Woden and Frigga and Thor,
Thought they'd all be unique,
And have days of the week
Named after them. Loki's still sore.

limerick_list.author: Wordmatic
limerick_list.text:
Humidity's out. So are lights,
Not to mention flash cameras, most nights.
And it wouldn't be smart
To touch paintings—our art
Conservator's given to fights.

limerick_list.author: EdRush
limerick_list.text:
Cacophonously did they play
Heavy metal all night and all day,
'Til nine Scottish neighbors
Produced pipes and tabors,
And gleefully danced a strathspey.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
An old car's acetylene lamp
Worked well when its carbide was damp.
If by chance that got dry
With no water close by,
Then the driver's "supply" would revamp.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
An enolate's high concentration
In a ketone, and then dehydration,
Causes strengthy attraction—
A bonding reaction
That chemists call aldol condensation.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Mickey Mantle, your dream I must shatter,
Since, although you're a world-famous batter,
In Who's Who in the Game,
The main text shuns your name —
But in back's one brief line in "end matter."

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
—You're a passable handyman, Prof,
But you knew that we had to block off
Just the window, that's all?
—Yes, I did: there's the wall.
—Well, you've blocked off the passageway! —Cough.

limerick_list.author: Michael Daws
limerick_list.text:
If you're walking alone on the strand,
And a clam clan sweats salt on the sand,
Would you claim they're a clammily
Oozing clam family,
Or, tempted, stretch down a damp hand?

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Said Carmella to Tony, "Let's pack!
There ain't no more capi to whack.
The Sopranos is done,
But we've had a great run.
Choose a song, say so long." [Cut to black.]

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Some look at the belly on me,
And, quite sadly, that's all that they see.
Yes, it's huge, but their mocking
Is evil and shocking:
They treat me abdominally.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
You have heard, I am willing to bet,
No Balanta from your TV set.
Local churchmen have stated
The Bible's translated,
But reruns of Seinfeld?  Not yet.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A man in the Air Force or Navy
Can purchase a package of gravy
In a base exchange, where
There's shampoo for his hair,
Even lotion to make it more wavy.

limerick_list.author: EdRush
limerick_list.text:
The Creole State stands all alone.
Its assets are globally known:
Great places to dine,
The jazz halls so fine,
And zydeco music, homegrown.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
Six brothers lie squashed in a bed;
They hear footsteps which fill them with dread.
Now a seventh will enter
And edge up the centre.
"Don't push in! Just push off instead!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Some regimes can exact a great price:
If found innocent, folks are tried twice.
To allow this in law
Is a serious flaw;
Double jeopardy—tyranny's vice.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When women develop ascites
Their shapes are unlike Aphrodite's—
With bellies, once splendid,
By fluid distended,
They favor voluminous nighties.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
You have no sharpened pencils, so how
Can you write? I will answer you now.
I shall fastigate these
Yellow Dixons, so please,
Just be patient and don't have a cow.

limerick_list.author: Brian Cairns
limerick_list.text:
As a botanist, thirsty for knowledge,
You'll have learned of this bead-tree in college.
It's in Java, you'll know,
Where azedaracs grow,
Fairly tall, with bipinnated fol'age.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
We were landlocked and dry as could be.
We decided to issue this plea:
"You're our last, best resort;
We need use of your port
And a corridor through to the sea."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Though I'm told that it doesn't help cleaving,
I'm still in the process of grieving.
In sorrow I'm trapped,
Yet we all must adapt
To life's changes.  My childhood is leaving!

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
My fretwork is fine as can be,
And I carefully cut, you can see.
I exhibit strong will,
Concentration and skill—
Ooops! Damn it! Start try ninety-three.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
A honeybee trapped in the bore
Of a gun could foresee what's in store.
Said the bee, "I had betta
Flee this lethal vendetta;
I'll get zapped if they trigger a war!"

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
All collectors from Prague to Des Moines:
Want to purchase a rare ancient coin?
Though the seller's in Rome,
You can bid from your home.
Get on eBay. No membership? Join!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My faith in this town is restored.
After decades of being ignored,
All our dear volunteers
Who have worked many years,
For their civism, won an award.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Making pickles? Use this, with dill weed.
Chicken salad? It's just what I need.
And in stuffings, it's great,
But not plain, on my plate.
So what is it? It's celery seed.

limerick_list.author: OxfordVictor
limerick_list.text:
When in Paris, and feeling audacious,
I met Kate, who was cutely vivacious.
But in the hotel
My garlicky smell
Put her off: I was far too cepaceous.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan and Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Pa liked gnawing on chaw, although "Gah!
All that chewing is crude, Pa!" cawed Ma.
"The brown drool down your chin
Is a source of chagrin —
It is gross and a grievous faux pas!"

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
In the aftermath, tell me, what track
Is your mind on? Your tongue's fallen slack.
Are you thinking it out
And conceding some doubt,
Or conceiving your counterattack?

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
When gases explode with ferocity,
The result may be quite a monstrosity.
There's research, so we read,
That can tell us the speed
Of the wave front — the CJ velocity.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Maybe doublets were just in the air.
He rolled boxcars. Hard ten, a square pair
For me; Jimmie Hicks (hard),
Ballerina ... I'm jarred,
Hitting snake-eyes. Crapped out with a flair!

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
Anticonservation's the lifestyle for me!
I have no use for hugging a tree!
I will walk on the grass
And use gallons of gas
As I cruise in my huge SUV.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
The shoplifter cast a quick glance —
He's a habit he has to finance —
But a CCTV
Means he soon won't be free:
He's walking to jail in a trance.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Antiques Roadshow's my vice, I confess.
I've a house full of junk—it's a mess.
I conjecture, with pleasure,
Each vase is a treasure
As weekly I watch PBS.

limerick_list.author: C. H. Carpenter
limerick_list.text:
One must catalog books with respect
To the subjects they clearly reflect,
Since the headings will lead
Searching patrons to heed
Needed books they might elsewise neglect.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Here in Rome, which is where we are from,
We sell energy—makes us a bomb.
But our email address
Caused the Pope much distress:
Ciao@powergenitalia.com

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
If you're thinking of selling your house,
Check for liens by a vengeful ex-spouse.
You should know that it's vital
To get a clear title
So nothing will go to that louse.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Though Bosch painted heavenly sights
In The Garden of Earthly Delights,
The devils all tell
Of its portrait of Hell,
Which exquisitely tortures their nights.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Many websites you may have been cruising.
Time to close some you're no longer using:
Hold Control plus one key:
Don't think "close" and press "C" —
No, it's W. Ain't that confusing?

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
The minstrel sings near where we sit:
"Beef stock spiced, broth to simmer a bit."
So I ask, "Is that art?"
He replies, hands apart,
"No, it's just a soup song of my wit."

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
The lumberjack started to wail, "Ya
Might think I'm a bit of a failure!"
As his hatchet was shattered
Just when it most mattered
By an axe-breaker tree in Australia.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Bosnia and Herzegovina
Once sported a happy demeanor,
But suffered a fate
I'm averse to relate...
Sarajevo's Olympics were cleaner.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Sun with rays ending smoothly in hands
Is a sign that for Him only stands:
One god, Aten, self-made
By a pharaoh who paid
With his life for his god in the sands.

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
A bachelor seal, young and male,
Tests his hormones but likely will fail.
He'll be kept from the breeding
By old bulls who keep seeding—
It's a frustrating tale of no tail!

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
"Episodic recall," said  my Clyde,
"Is a matter that gives me great pride.
I know just how I felt
When the bullets were dealt
Down in Dallas when Kennedy died."

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
Steve Rogers, a scrawny young teen,
Was the skinniest boy ever seen.
Then they gave him a shot;
He got buffed; now he's hot!
(In the film, my wife squeals at this scene.)

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Sir, your hard disc's near full, so I fear
That the time for a new one draws near.
The free file space you've got,
Just two megs — not a lot —
Will not last till the end of the year.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
You think opium use is splendidious?
Its pleasures are clearly insidious.
Once the high goes away,
A bleak after-dream may
Serve to show that your real world is hideous.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Chinese okra, zucchini-like veg,
Can give bathers a definite edge.
When it's left on the vine
It forms loofah. Divine
As a sponge, keep it close on tub's ledge.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"If your gastrointestinal tract
Tends to cramp, causing pain, and impact,
Take these daturine pills.
They'll relieve all your ills,
And diminish your farting, in fact."

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Our accountants had quite a high torpor rate,
So it's us bosses now disincorporate.
They're dividing us off
From the firm. You may scoff:
Your plate's princely, while mine's what a pauper ate.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Our connubial rites will take place
On June 4, when we stand face to face
And we say our I do's.
Should she choose to refuse,
You're my backup, my love, just in case.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Just at daybreak, the sun first appears,
As the crowd of his worshippers cheers,
"Aton-Ra. Hip-hooray."
That's the song of the day—
Not exactly the music of spheres.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle and S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
You've turned my life 'round, have you not?
And you've made me much hotter than hot.
Now it takes all my strength
Keeping you at arm's length—
I think stalkers like you should be shot!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
