All the boys in the bay side-by-side'll
Convince you my guys are not idle.
At low tide every day
Crews clam North and South Bay.
They're in sync 'cause the shores are cotidal.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
At times my computer will freeze,
But I'm chilled and can fix it with ease.
I just tug on the plug,
Yank it out, give a shrug,
Then replace it. A cold boot's a breeze.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
They gave me the death sentence, Mom,
Since I murdered nineteen with a bomb.
Then I shot Melvin, Ed,
Betty, Randolph, and Fred,
And then strangled Luigi and Tom.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
"I will show that, in space," Albert stated,
"All positions are interrelated.
First I'll dump the old frame
Of reference (lame!)
Used by Newton — that system's outdated."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Once jilted, a dog in the manger,
She's a homewrecker now, an estranger.
She will turn your affection
In her own damned direction.
Your marriage she's sure to endanger.

limerick_list.author: MattMonitto
limerick_list.text:
A transmission (a notice of tax)
For his farm brings him stress and he cracks.
So he splatters the page
With some dung in a rage!
Just observe as he feces the fax.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
When speaking of something that's strange
Or deviant, outside the range,
Use anomaly, or,
If the norm you abhor,
Anomalism's nice for a change.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
The monk in contemplative prayer
Fought his demons of doubt and despair,
And in wordless communion
Sought mystical union
And faith in a peace he could share.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
If blood didn't congeal, but instead
Gushed from wounds in a torrent of red,
First, its pressure would drop,
Then your heartbeat would stop,
After which, pretty soon you'd be dead.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
The Allium genus is handy;
Some chefs might prefer it to candy.
There's leeks and there's chive,
There's garlic,  and I've
Got a yen for some onions in brandy.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
An absentee ballot is swell
For the soldier, the old, the unwell.
Being sick or remote
From the polls, they can vote
In advance from the place where they dwell.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The crab-running, crooked-legged bay
Started out of the running that day
Then ran wide round the pack.
There was no looking back —
A dark horse won the Derby. Hurray!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Democracy often is spurned
By some activist judges, concerned
We're a nation of fools
Where majority rules.
Thus, our will is, at will, overturned.

limerick_list.author: Engineer
limerick_list.text:
Little Henry would show up each day
For spring try-outs. "Third base," he would say.
But each grounder that came
Caused him nothing but shame;
Seems his catcher's mitt got in the way.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
See the bridegroom ride up on a horse
And abscond with his sweetheart. The source
Of this wrongheaded mission?
The bridelope tradition.
It's probably grounds for divorce.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
To the Winnipeg River it slinks,
Looks around, and then furtively drinks.
Ever cautious, this deer
Has a wildcat to fear—
The intrepid Canadian lynx.

limerick_list.author: alkahuna
limerick_list.text:
The Bulgarian priest Bogomil
Had a dualist truth to reveal.
He said Jesus's brother
Was Satan, no other!
(This schism took decades to heal.)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Maurice Micklewhite cannot complain
Since his life's not the least bit mundane.
With great roles he's been blessed.
(I liked "Alfie" the best.)
You have seen him perhaps: Michael Caine.

limerick_list.author: Nathan Howe
limerick_list.text:
When I needed a cure for my houndlessness,
I gave an old Sheltie her poundlessness.
I can let her roam free;
She won't jump up, you see,
So her boundlessness comes of her boundlessness.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
For the arborist studying fir,
Abietic's a word de rigueur.
It refers to the wood
From a tree that you could
Say is firm and erect, as it were.

limerick_list.author: C. H. Carpenter
limerick_list.text:
In their habitat, haddock (marine),
Or Atlantic red perch can be seen.
This bergylt's head is spiny.
Fish are mottled when tiny,
But when grown, rosefish glow with a sheen.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My gal Val done me wrong, took a groom.
So I sentenced them both to their doom.
Tried to shoot 'em both dead —
Aimed my Colt at 'er head,
But she bolted clear outa the room.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
In your tissues, you hope won't exist
Any sort of acephalocyst.
It's the globular germ
Of a larval tapeworm;
When it grows, you are bound to be pissed.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
This outgoing, sociable guy
Is an extrovert; friends who stop by
Know he throws a good party.
He's friendly and hearty,
Though once he was timid and shy.

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
Scott Foresman did help me attain
Skills in reading that, with me, remain.
Yes, of cheers, I'm a leader
For that old basal reader
And my childhood pals, Dick and Jane.

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
I'm intrepid — I chuckle at danger;
To whims of mischance I'm no stranger.
But for twenty more years
I'll have genuine fears
From my choice of this mortgage arranger.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Like Tchaikovsky's, my music's poetic,
Or when needed, can wax energetic.
The critics are cruel;
Their reviews say, "A fool!"
And "It ain't Pathétique, it's pathetic."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The term French fried potatoes implies
That it's France that in some way supplies
All the spuds we enjoy.
We'd do best to employ
A more accurate term. Call them fries.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Apancreatic: a big empty space
Now exists in my gut in the place
Where my pancreas ain't.
Give me air—I may faint!
(I have locked up my lungs just in case.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Her husband was quite reverential
As he looked at each well-framed credential—
But their doc's PhD
Was in finance, and she
Found its relevance somewhat tangential.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
In German lands after the war
This Republic was brought to the fore:
It was (Marxist) dogmatic
Though named Democratic—
And communist right to the core.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Rural hedgerows in Britain provide
Secure shelter for livestock, while wide
Five-bar gates made of wood
Provide access. They're good,
Even if (latches broken) they're tied.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
There's my nuclear family, then cousins
And aunties, then uncles. The buzzin's
Real fierce when we meet
(Grab a plate, find a seat!)
All my calabash folks, by the dozens!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There's a word I encountered online
That I'd like to define. It's diffine:
To take words and explain
What they mean, in the main.
(It's a personal hobby of mine.)

limerick_list.author: kandabongo
limerick_list.text:
I nibbled a bit on her auricle
(As foreplay, licked ears are historical).
But just then—oh my dear,
What I feared I might hear—
She complained, "You have slobbered galorical!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When you spend your days worshiping dross,
Thinking only of profit and loss,
Love will pass you right by
In the blink of an eye—
Then you've wasted your life chasing gloss.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When I think of Dinichthys, I wish
I could actually catch such a fish,
But this kin of the gar
Is a fossil and far
From a fish for a dish that's delish.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
As an early chauffeuse, Bertha Benz,
Just to visit her mother and friends,
Took her husband's new car
And then drove rather far—
She started those new-fashioned trends.

limerick_list.author: RCK
limerick_list.text:
If Akbar were here he would shout,
"All you kids better not leave me out!
As the head of the great
And immense Mughal state,
My importance can not be in doubt."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I am sorry to have to report
They returned me. Again I face court.
While it's true I broke jail
Sticking stamps on my tail,
The damn postage was twenty cents short.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I find giants throughout the whole land:
Female brutes eight feet tall when they stand.
When they march five abreast,
Folks are really impressed
By the Large Ladies Contrabass Band.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
In the game that we call Tic Tac Toe,
Place a circle (we call it an "oh")
Scribe the sign that comes next
Decussately (X'd):
Then repeat each as onward we go.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Excuse me, sir, please do not fuss;
This is customs, and I must excuss
All your luggage: go through it.
Been smuggling sir? Knew it:
Here's contraband ... seized. Off the bus!

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Descriptivism says that my morals
(Value judgements) should never cause quarrels.
My deep motivation
Defies demonstration;
I rest on inscrutable laurels.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
A collapsar's a gravity whisk;
On approaching, you run a great risk
That your atoms will flow
In a gamma-ray glow
And accrete in a spiraling disk.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
All the saccharides, everyone* knows,
Have x carbons and y H2Os.
If that x = 2,
It's a diose. Wah-hoo! —
That's the sugar the Milky Way froze!

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
"Let the sinless one cast the first stone."
Jesus spake.  Next — a rock and a moan.
"Who dared cast that?" he cried,
Then the thrower he spied —
"Gee, you tick me off, Mom!" with a groan.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
It's an herb that's akin to a carrot.
Though I like its taste, you can't bear it.
I say celery's best
With a dip; you protest
That it's food only fit for a ferret.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
Due to dentoalveolar trials
His courting is met with denials.
Yes, he's charming, it's true,
But his teeth are too few,
And it scares all the girls when he smiles.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Shedding branches from trees make a mess.
Cladoptosis: reaction to stress?
Reproduction? Self pruning?
Or simply fine tuning?
It's a topic I'd like to address.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
My sweet lady, I'm now in a spot
For your arrow is hurting a lot.
But before I expire,
May I lastly inquire:
Who the hell labeled you a "great shot"?

limerick_list.author: cecelia
limerick_list.text:
In winter, why is it he's chosen
To dress in such short Lederhosen?
All the chafing and rubbing
(Despite constant dubbing)
Just heightens the pain when he's frozen.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
When a company's main aspiration
Is affected by trade fluctuation,
Such as cyclical knocks,
Then the  company's stocks
Have a cyclical stock appellation.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Whispered grave-robber Mouldy Old Meg
To her client, "You want it? You beg.
I'll be going in deep
So the price will be steep:
It'll cost you an arm and a leg."

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
The Dowager Duchess of Down
Pulled a heist—she's the talk of the town!
Works by Breughel, Vermeer
And Fred Phelps were all there
'Neath this lady's commodious gown.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
It was early one morning when Tonto
Spurred his pinto to sprint to Toronto.
A sign he'd passed by
Read, "Drink Canada Dry",
And he'd thought, "Worth a try, me go pronto."

limerick_list.author: Scott Campisi
limerick_list.text:
For wormwood I'm truly fanatical;
Its acid is quite enigmatical.
Absinthate's defined
By this acid combined
With a base or a positive radical.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
An engraver drew gowns with his burin
For beauties to flash their allure in.
But instead of chiffon,
Mothers made them with lawn,
Which their daughters looked safely demure in.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
No professors, no backpacks, no noting,
No theses, no school board promoting
Devotion to knowledge
At Electoral College,
Where everyone majors in voting.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A backronym starts as a word,
Something simple that everyone's heard,
Then each letter is given
A meaning and driven
To generate something absurd.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In Line 1, my first A-rhyme is "joke"
While Line 2 has the second: "provoke."
There are none in Line 3
Or Line 4, but you see
That Line 5 gives us "pig in a poke."

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
A depth gauge is used with finesse
To measure a groove or recess.
It's also its role
To measure a hole —
It's better by far than a guess.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
A gangling young fellow I knew,
Loved sailing, but folks it's so true;
If you're tall and you're thin
It's unlikely you'll win
A place in a cup-winning crew.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This medicine's cardioprotective,
So my heart won't become more defective.
Now my ticker works well;
I feel great. You can tell
From my swell optimistic perspective.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Luscious Lulu has choices galore:
Deevy dandies just flock to her door.
Which divine one to choose
With such charms to peruse?
It's the tryouts that doll's drooling for.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Show some pep! Get a job!" I just frowned.
Let me lie on a beach and get browned
Or read comics all day.
On my ass I will stay.
Maybe that's why they say "bum around."

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
At present, he's still feeling fine,
But should he have any more wine,
His vision will blur
And his speech start to slur,
And his balance abruptly decline!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My frau has a brow that is wrinkled;
From worry, her forehead is crinkled.
Its corrugant power
Reflects how, each hour
That passes, she still hasn't tinkled.

limerick_list.author: Mr E S
limerick_list.text:
I'm engaged in genetic research
Into why there are people who lurch
When they're taking a walk,
Or who spit when they talk,
Or who curse even when they're in church.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Superhero's your goal? You can try,
But there's more than just learning to fly.
You must always impress —
That means dress for success;
Be a capable cape-able guy.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
I breathe a deep sigh of relief
When an unfunny limerick is brief.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
On Cohen's grave, let's place a stone. All
His songs touch our hearts. This is known: all
Those lyrics  — so many,
So soulful — by Lenny.
(But why, tell me, so monotonal?)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
He will never achieve much seniority.
His stance is too antiauthority.
When he said, "I don't like
The firm's logo.  Let's strike!"
Moving up didn't seem a priority.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Though our wedding is planned as no-frills,
Should we film it, or settle for stills?
When old age is advancing,
We'll want to see dancing.
Let's choose movies, and hope for some spills.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Since the seafloor dives down at the edge
Of a continent's plate, I'd allege
That the surface gets scraped,
And the scrapings reshaped
To produce an accretionary wedge.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
In the Battle of Cowpens,  defeat
Would be Tarleton's fate.  A retreat
Made him order his men
Into charging. And then,
Said Dan Morgan: "Success was complete."

limerick_list.author: old dad
limerick_list.text:
Epidermal discomfiture (itchiness)
May promote evil symptoms of witchiness.
You could treat it with balm
As you try to keep calm.
Failing this — YOU COULD SCREAM WITH A BITCHINESS!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Juan Sebastian del Cano was tellin'
About circling the globe.  He was yellin':
"I was first! There, I said it!
But who gets the credit?
It goes to that moron Magellan!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Lift the edge of the carpet. What's there?
Just a section of floor that is bare?
No, there's dirt that I've swept.
Cleaning house? I'm inept,
But to tell you the truth, I don't care.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
We complain that school's hard back in Kitly.
As is suitable, Kit answers fitly,
But her comment's not pretty.
"Enough of self-pity!
In the Bronx it's much worse," she says. "WHITLY!"

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
Bearing ads that they hope to make pay,
Lurking links lead our surfing astray.
They're the sirens that tease
On the binary seas.
Trim their sales, me lads!  Anchors away!

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
Definining accel. isn't hard,
So there's no need to be on your guard:
It's a musical sign
Meaning "speed up the time"—
Just the opposite of a ritard.

limerick_list.author: Colin Salter
limerick_list.text:
A cadastral map shows us how grand,
And whose holding, is each piece of land.
Where's the boundary line?
Is it your fence or mine?
It's a useful map. Keep it to hand.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Using bulbs in the kitchen's in favor;
Either onion or garlic adds flavor.
But don't crush it, just bruise it —
That's the best way to use it.
Take a crack; get the knack — it's a saver.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This plant's belladonna, the lily,
Meaning "beautiful woman."  It's silly
That it's called "naked lady"—
Which makes it sound shady.
Amaryllis, you're truly a dilly!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It's not just a brand of computer,
Or a gift from a student to tutor.
The Ambrosia's repute
As a delicate fruit
Makes it fit for a belle, from a suitor.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
This delicious cake makes a great team
With strong coffee that's topped with fresh cream—
Just single, not double,
But real ('cos the trouble
Is fake stuff will ruin the dream).

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Where the Promenade lines Brooklyn Heights,
The East River reflects dazzling sights
Of Manhattan beyond
As my love and I bond
Amid strollers and floral delights.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
Both Seanna and Suzie were versed
In developing bean plants. The first
Anasazi beans Sue
Saw Seanna saw, too.
They're dark red and with white spots dispersed.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I love cackle fruit, scrambled or fried,
With a few greasy links on the side.
Said my doctor, "You need
Fewer eggs in your feed."
"Oh, I'm eating more tofu," I lied.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
True amateurs, often decried,
Should take all such slurs in their stride,
Since working for love
Must come well above
Their working while ungratified.

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
VP Calvin Coolidge succeeded
Warren Harding (a coffin he needed).
He was dubbed Silent Cal,
And he stopped the cabal
From Ohio, a gang he got weeded.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
My emotions you're starting to stoke,
Cause those pleading eyes soon make me choke.
Even though you just ate,
Take the rest of my plate.
There's no way to resist when you groak.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
On the front is the sovereign's head,
A king or a queen, and I read
That it promised to pay
The bearer — what? — say,
Twenty pounds: paper banknote — or 'bread'.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Our eternal rest comes when we die,
'Cause it looks like we're sleeping.  But why
Use this phrase?  Just the body
Stops functioning.  God?  He
Takes souls to live on in the sky.

limerick_list.author: Duncan Stevens
limerick_list.text:
Sought a cup sung in many a tale.
Retrieval: a feat all would hail.
Found it, filled it with stout—
Which came pouring back out.
It was holey, not holy, that grail.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
In a free port all traders may trade.
No exclusiveness, ban or blockade
Stops the imports brought here,
Nor do exporters fear
They'll be kept from big deals to be made.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
A knight was sent forth by his sire
To atone for his crimes, and enquire
Under pain of his life
What moves maiden and wife —
What's a woman's most heartfelt desire?

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Since, dear Margaret, I just heard you beg
I'll explain the strange term crawling peg:
When exchange rates get jumpy
Their landing's not bumpy,
As pegs slow things down. Get that, Meg?

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Since my three-score-and-ten years have ended,
My expiry date's just been amended,
Renewable yearly;
Don't want to die early.
My life-span's, I hope, long extended.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Will and Bill took me out (just a phase,
When I courted them both). In those days,
Our old theatre was willing
To show (double billing)
For one ticket entry two plays.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
Pininana's blue flowers compel,
As this Echium casts its tall spell.
On La Palma it's best,
Though in Britain's south west
It survives, though it's fussy as hell.

limerick_list.author: GeneralE
limerick_list.text:
Be careful in speaking, my son,
And assure this campaign will be won.
Keep on thinking out, test;
Each idea must be best.
Recall, Howard, how words come undone.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Applied arts produce items we use,
From teapots to toques to tattoos.
One aesthetically pleasing
Device is for squeezing;
Another's for polishing shoes.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The madman had set out to scare us all
With his threat: he intended to tear us all
Into bits Lilliputian,
Then, mixed in solution,
He would spray us on walls via aerosol.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
She was pregnant, the coroner said.
She took arsenic (ratsbane). She's dead.
"Doesn't write. Doesn't call.
Doesn't want" — that was all
That she scrawled in the note by her bed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Greedy people just itch to get rich,
And will fall for an obvious pitch,
Unaware of its stealth.
"You can cumulate wealth!"
—that's until they discover a hitch.

limerick_list.author: Fergus Follower
limerick_list.text:
Annie feeds him and irons his clothes.
When he smells bad she plugs up her nose.
When he's cranky she's sweet:
She massages his feet.
This conciliative girl gets a rose!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"That's a foot fault; your toe touched the line,"
Barked the line judge (the finicky swine).
Damn the tournament rules,
Made by fussy old fools.
Please inform them this backcourt is mine.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
An agent employed by the county
Helps folks with a cow or a mount. He
Assists with the farming,
Preventing them harming
The land, so each crop is a bounty.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
D: a grade that can indicate slips.
Do both starts and ends musical trips.
Don: put clothes on one's frame.
Dona: Portuguese dame.
Donat starred in Goodbye, Mr. Chips.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"There's a fly in my soup; can't you see?"
"No I can't, sir, it's only debris
From the herbs and the spice,
Or a large grain of rice."
"But it's having a race with a flea!"

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Frankie Phelps held a knife when we met.
I broke out in a sudden cold sweat:
Now too hot, now a-shiver,
I cried, "Not my liver! —
Cut it out!" Said Mad Frankie, "You bet!"

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Both our scent hounds are down with a flu.
Has the vixen now earthed? Then we're through.
Once the beast's gone to ground,
She's a bitch to be found—
Damn her eyes and her whole mangy crew!

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
My ceramicist friend's really potty,
The clothes that she wears often spotty
With clay. Ever scatty,
Decidedly batty,
Eccentric, distracted, she's dotty.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
If it's more education you lack,
Try DL and you'll never look back.
The computer's the place
For the courses you face.
This can help your career get on track.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Daughters three, but it isn't quite clear
Who's the one holding daddy most dear.
Two promise their love
While the third gets a shove.
What a trio, this queer band o' Lear.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
"Hyperbolic, these cotangents rule!"
Says a cute little classmate at school.
Though at math I'm a sloth,
She gets off writing coth,
So I'm figuring trig'll be cool.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
Elementary school was the place
Where the tests were so easy to ace.
Later, high school was stressing;
On tests I was guessing.
My grades were a total disgrace.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
It appears something's wrong with my chow;
I've been farting and burping, and how!
And the worst of my troubles?
I'm drooling small bubbles —
My face is all foamy right now.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Some ambitions of mine are to share
In the profits from rents in Times Square,
Then to end work at noon,
And to walk on the moon.
Are these castles of mine in the air?

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Down the canyon she fell, my dear wife.
Roped together, in deep (oh dear) strife,
I'm dragged over the edge.
Now we cling to a ledge,
Grimly hanging on ("HELP!") for dear life.

limerick_list.author: Julia
limerick_list.text:
A Scotsman from west Aberdeenshire
When dining was offered some beans or
A plateful of haggis.
"To fart or to gag is
My evident fate," said the lean sir.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"For shame, caddy butcher! They say
You sell horsemeat in here every day.
What has happened to you?
Can these rumors be true?"
But the butcher just frowned and said, "Neigh!"

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
Curiosity didn't kill Cat.
No, it's even more crushing than that:
He had let caution fade
In the steamroller's shade.
'Twas complacency made the cat flat.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
As I traipse to the train in the rain,
I'm inclined to complain, but refrain;
For this storm stopped our bout
With a damaging drought,
So bitching for now's down the drain.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Here's my principle, clearly assertable:
In a car crash, each passenger's hurtable.
If a drophead should roll,
It would take a grim toll,
So I always avoid a convertible.

limerick_list.author: Bob Colonna
limerick_list.text:
My thoughts on creation are secular:
That beings called biomolecular
Owe their birth to the pang
Of a really Big Bang,
Which must have been rather spectecular.

limerick_list.author: alkahuna
limerick_list.text:
At the close of the Era Victorian
Came a self-proclaimed "Royal Historian".
L. Frank Baum was his name;
Tales of Oz brought him fame
(Each story a fun and non-gory 'un).

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
Who started the anti-Bush club?
Molly Ivins, the author of Shrub.
She alone had Dub's number.
She warned he'd encumber
Our nation as President Dub.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
It's a down-at-the-heels place to stay,
Where the johns and the prostitutes play:
The carpets are bumpy,
The mattresses lumpy,
And the towels are threadbare and gray.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Dinner service is up; move some ass!
Broil that steak!  Roast those peppers!  Torch glass
On those ten crèmes brûlées!
Where's my mushroom sauté?
That's right, people:  we're cooking with gas!

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Our desire, we all find, is a thing
Which with age slowly fades; it takes wing,
And performance lacks wellie.
We'd rather watch telly.
In fact, chaps, our dong's lost its ding!

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
An investor should be quite discerning
Of a company's level of earning.
A useful convention
That's worthy of mention,
EBITDA, will aid in this learning.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
My wife wore a costume tonight.
She's an Indian demon, a fright.
"Am I looking okay?"
It's a trap! What to say?
"You look bhut-iful darling, all right?"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Diffeomorphism? Time to break out
The ol' Webster's. They'll know it, no doubt.
"A differentiable" (swell!)
"Homeomorphism" (Hell,
Two more words I know nothing about!)

limerick_list.author: Edmund Conti
limerick_list.text:
Our life, as we know it, best functions
By ignoring all angst and compunctions.
No ifs, ands or buts—
They will just drive you nuts.
So soldier on, minus conjunctions.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If your blood pressure's high as a kite,
And you fear you'll succumb in the night,
You need not despair;
Just seek medical care,
And let Aldomet make it all right.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
They're a talented field at this meet.
Still, my Pinchie is certain to beat
Every racer in sight —
I'm not putting that right —
All the rest! (Pinchie's here at my feet.)

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
How I long for the total cessation
Of hunts for the noble cetacean!
This barbarous game
Brings immeasurable shame
To an otherwise civilised nation.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My forebears earned blackbirder's pay,
But they weren't ornithologists. They
Sailed their boats o'er the waves,
And they caught and sold slaves.
I regret their black deeds to this day!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Every medical student will brag
On the day he acquires a black bag,
But that satchel's for fools
Who use burglary  tools;
And in England it's what dustmen drag.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Come now, my friends, go with me
To the local Girl Scouts' camporee!
Sing some songs by the fire—
Add some wood! Make it higher!
Then tell scary stories! Wow! Whee!

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Sick and dying, John made a mistake
When he crawled to the kitchen to take
Some baked goods from a plate,
To be told by his mate,
"Those damn brownies were baked for your wake!"

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
For this sauce with tomatoes, you've gotta
Have garlic; you won't need ricotta.
Then red peppers you add,
Which makes the sauce mad,
And your dish is all arrabbiata.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Our delivery men are undaunted
By spirits. Their courage is vaunted.
One delivered a fridge
Across Emily's Bridge,
This in spite of the fact it was haunted.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
"It's the funfair! Let's head on inside!
Look, a ghost train! Let's go for a ride!"
Dad was over the moon
For the whole afternoon.
Jenny screamed. I was sick. Timmy cried.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
"Don't emure us!" the kittens all mew.
Says Mom, "What a hullabaloo!
I would not wall you in,
But for making this din,
I'll enmew you — confine you — for true."

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
The bilabial consonant "p"
Could be made if the lips were to be
Placed together a piece,
Followed by a release
When they're done, though that's no guarantee.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Rome was crude during Ostrogoth rule;
Barbarocracy done, we retool.
How to turn to our roots
Now we've ousted the brutes?
To the prole kids the Goths were "way cool."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Do you feel you are really depressed?
Stay in bed? Don't get up or get dressed?
See your doc; ask to try
This new SSRI
Called citalopram. Give it a test.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
In maternity wards women died
Because doctors infrequently tried
To keep everything clean;
Thus infections were seen.
Childbed fever was spread far and wide.

limerick_list.author: johng
limerick_list.text:
A yak and a common horned cow
In the past got together somehow.
You might like to know
The result was a dzho.
If you didn't before, you do now!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As I study his face, my pen slides
Across Bristol board.  Swiftly it glides
As I draw my friend Walter.
It's nice: if I falter,
I can flip it and draw on both sides.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
A most beautiful sight, all agree,
One of which I'm a real devotee,
Is Dungeness named.
For ecology famed,
It's a headland 'twixt marshland and sea.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
"It appears," Mr Johnson just stated,
"You're all destinable — destined, or fated —
To stay here after class,
If you're hoping to pass
The exam that for Tuesday is slated."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
A baseball bat maker named Nash
Found five hundred dollars in cash.
Excited, he tore
To his fave lumber store,
Where he paid for a great piece of ash.

limerick_list.author: RCK
limerick_list.text:
Andy Carnegie proudly did say,
"I shall give all my money away.
Then I'll go down in hist.
As a great altruist,
Which carries a pleasing cachet."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I am hoping (in votes) I will dominate
The candidate Katie will nominate,
As I find him a lout
Who will curse people out.
When he's crossed, he is likely to comminate.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
Take an antipode, Lydia bets,
And the opposite thing's what she gets.
Friends and foes, ins and outs,
Highs and lows, floods and droughts —
And my nest egg compared with her debts.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
"Have you heard? Widow Jones won ten grand!
And she's dating a speed-metal band!
They're the age of her son—
Something has to be done!"
"Just belt up! Or else talk to the hand."

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
All accursed with inflation's disgrace,
Silver coins are worth more than their face.
When the Mint's in a pickle,
It coins copper nickel:
It's shiny and white, but it's base.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
My Barb colt in Morocco was bred
To run swift when I give him his head.
Though it's me now astride him,
The Berber inside him
Drives on till the foeman is fled.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A famed Scandinavian sculler
Thinks blonde couldn't be any duller,
So he's dyeing his hair
Peacock-blue to declare,
"I'm a Norse of a different color."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Norma's known as a has-been because
She's not famous, although she once was.
"I'm a star!" she declares.
But the press says, "Who cares?"
She now generates negative buzz.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
'Tis blue chip, my  company's label,
So highly regarded and stable.
Had my chips? Got the blues?
Nay, there's no way to lose.
It's making great profits, no fable.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I'm a hat and my buddies are, too,
And good manners we hope you pursue.
When you enter an office,
The rule is to doff us.
Plus, where ladies are present, please do.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
To disyllabize Ben, call him "Benny."
Do the same thing with cent, it's a penny.
If a movie has plots
Within plots, lots and lots,
The two-syllable term there is many.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
An attempt to come closer, approach
May refer to a movement by coach
Or by car, or by talking,
Or even by walking,
Sneakin' up on some game you might poach.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
You're a beggar on horseback.  The switch is
Not only from poorhouse to riches.
You were humble and kind,
But you left that behind.
You're corrupt and too big for your britches.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Want to split a whole body in half?
Here's a medical term (not some laugh):
It's the coronal plane—
Just your front may remain!
I should draw you a picture or graph.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
Want a rather self-centered projection
Where, in each azimuthal direction,
Shortest paths appear straight?
Squash the globe like a plate;
That's your fine equidistant confection.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
A bottlenose dolphin, it's said,
Has a smoothly defined rounded head.
With its long smiley beak,
Its expression says cheek!
See it swim the Atlantic or Med.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
In Chicago the restaurants are model;
I've been gorging here so much I waddle.
Though this place has renown
As a "toddlin' town,"
I'm not certain that I can still toddle.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
It's acute, this disease, a malaise
That will keep me in bed for some days.
On the plus side, this sickness
Is known for its quickness,
But it sure isn't 'cute'. What a phrase!

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
"Atonal," A. Schoenberg averred,
"Is a perfectly horrible word.
Though I dare, if you please,
To write songs without keys,
Writing songs without tones is absurd."

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
Hit that hi-hat to keep up the beat.
Tap that tom-tom; that snare skin mistreat
With those hickory sticks.
Flip and twirl them. Do tricks
With your drum sticks. Your show's now complete!

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Your body is pressed next to mine,
And your hair in my face smells divine.
Though we're strangers, we two,
I feel so close to you
Commuting this underground line.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
At our picnic, a Brie fly impressed
As a devilish cheese-eating pest.
But his presence was chiefly
Ad interim, briefly
Alighting, then squashed on request.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Swarming angels so strangely appear,
Always yelling ideas in my ear.
I'm in hell—that's enough!
Now they're telling me stuff
That a fellow so rough shouldn't hear.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Since I'm sure you won't want to misspeak
When pronouncing in ancient-type Greek,
Stress is never incurred
In a barytone word
At the end. Make that syllable weak.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I will state my position with clarity:
I seldom contribute to charity,
As in fact, I'm in debt
From the bills that I get
Just to pay for my phone's cellularity.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
From Naples, Campania, they came.
They were criminals; crime was their game.
Like the Mafia hoods,
They stole money and goods—
Camorristas, to call them by name.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Anvil" Smith is an anvil-smith. (Haw!)
He's been learning the trade from his paw.
Once he makes two or three
Of these anvils, you see,
They are sold door to door by his maw.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
She's magnetic; her smart conversation
Can attract any guy in the nation,
But the folks in the know
Say it's all a big show.
You get close? There's depolarization.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"I love you, my dear, all the more
Since I've learned you long worked as a whore.
I believe we're a match!"
"Jack, you're not a great catch,
Inasmuch as you've turned ninety-four.

"But you say that I'm loved all the more
Now you know that I whored heretofore;
And since I'm ninety-three,
Guess it's OK with me —
Get your wheelchair unstuck from the door!"

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
It was such a bright cart, painted yellow,
With each spoke and each axle and felloe
(A curved piece of rim)
Painted red. "Don't be grim,
Ratty boy!" came the Toad's cheerful bellow.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
A baleen whale (a gray one, quite big)
Of a Baja lagoon took a swig.
Through baleen plates she sifted
And ate, while she drifted,
Some plankton and shrimp and one fig.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
It's gone right off the charts—it's a block-
buster hit. Crowds of people will flock
To get tickets to view
This most recent of new
Whoop-dee-doos (but, to me, just a crock).

limerick_list.author: EdRush
limerick_list.text:
A bun goes 'round some kind of meat
To make a traditional treat.
If in it are clustered
Some catsup and mustard,
Some call that a meal you can't beat!

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
When his model one day didn't show up,
The photographer griped she should grow up.
He enlarged on this theme
With developing steam —
Which exposed her next day to a blowup.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Cross-reacting agglutinin lumps
Nonhomologous microbes in clumps.
Having antigens bound
In a mass, docs have found,
Helps them study a virus like mumps.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
For a year, her sick brother she nursed,
Yet got nothing when funds were disbursed.
All it said in his will:
"My sincere 'Thanks' to Jill."
It was then that she stamped, screamed and cursed!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
It's ghost-plagued and far from baronial:
A two-hundred-year-old colonial
With papers to prove it.
You're forbidden to move it.
Any change would need God's testimonial.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
At the altar, the bride looked a belle,
But they couldn't afford a hotel
For the bun fight that followed.
Their pride was soon swallowed:
Church halls make good venues, as well.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
Diametrally leaning against
The old gate post, both Pa and I sensed
That the only thing stopping
That pylon from dropping
Was us, so cement was dispensed.

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
It's gas. A gargantuan leak
Makes the air down in Porter Ranch reek,
Causes noses to bleed,
Heads to ache; what folks need
Is the breathable air that they seek.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
See that child? She is way above par,
And I'm sure her career will go far.
She can dance, she can sing,
She can act—anything!
One day soon she will be a big star.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Intellectual Ted's too darn serious,
And his 50-cent words tend to weary us.
Buying books by the armful
Must surely be harmful,
Or as Ted would have said, "deleterious."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Edward Colston went swimming this week,
As a part of a moral critique.
Well—his statue, not him,
Has been sent for a swim.
Any chance for replacement seems bleak.

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
In the hospital, I nearly died—
All the air to my blood was denied.
So, I breathed in two tanks
Of O2—many thanks!
Now my aerated blood burps inside!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Expressionless, tightly controlled,
His poker-faced countenance told
Not one whit how he felt.
None could tell, as we dealt,
If he'd raise, or stand pat, or just fold.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Navel-gazing involves meditation,
Self-reflection.  From that, contemplation
Of the same came to mean
One's own problems are seen
In a self-absorbed preoccupation.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
He stays tranquil, with effortless grace;
Keeps a calm, placid look on his face:
The man's equability
Implies a stability
Of mood, irrespective of place.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
"I may vote upon Blackburn in Lancs,"
Tam Dalyell told political ranks,
"But should they divest
Us of Lothian, West:
'May I vote on my Blackburn?' — 'No thanks!'"

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Just confused? As they zig and they zag
Through the flour that escapes from the bag,
These small beetles proceed
To meander and feed—
Leaving frass in my food. What a drag!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When we say that a person's between
Two stools, what the hell do we mean?
This phrase is applied
When you cannot decide
What to do when two choices are seen.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"All these scars on my face, I am sure," Les
Declared, "to the girls are allureless.
Had the pox on my chin
In Berlin. With chagrin,
I found out the infection was cureless."

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman and Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Simple telescope lenses deflect
Passing light; the refracted effect
Is an image that's spread
Between violet and red.
Dialytic ones make this correct.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
Your dresser appears to be swelling.
It's outwardly curved, thereby telling
The world it's bombé.
That's a style, now passé,
Of the chests that stores used to be selling.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The dance of a honeybee shows
To her sisters some info she knows:
"Here's the nectar I've found—
Watch me waggle around,"
Since a bee cannot shout, "Thar she blows!"

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
There's a book I've been aiming to get.
To receive it, I'll glue and reset
All the pieces you rent
And then gradually sent:
It's an old ante litteram 'Net!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
God willing, it's gonna be great
To be rid of a bad head of state,
Who'd aspired to be Rex,
Dei gratia Ex-
Presidente. Just show him the gate.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
Agnus Dei (God's Lamb, now we pray)
Qui tollis (—Who takest away)
Peccata (our sin—)
Nobis (far from our kin)
Miserere (Thy vengeance to stay).

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
After blowing long notes on his cornet,
A corneter sucked in a hornet!
He endured being stung
Till the fat lady'd sung.
Since 'the show must go on,' he had borne it.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
In a stadial, climate grows colder,
Like the Dryas (the Younger or Older).
New tundra is settled
By plants octopetaled
In white (and their pollen is golder).

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
"It's not fair, because we're citrus too!"
Say the envious limes that we grew.
This green fruit feels maligned
By what Webster defined—
Only lemons have citreous hue.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Our data mile's six thousand feet,
'Steada six thousand eighty. We cheat.
Large round numbers are practical;
Making miles that are tactical
Needing calcs mathematical, neat.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Hoped my girl would be rarin' to go
To a fabulous full nudie show.
I assumed titillations
But she damped expectations
By saying not "No" but "HELL NO!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When Nate's record, unfairly, was smeared,
The election was lost, as I'd feared.
Nate was greatly irate.
I said: "Save your rage, mate.
Just accept your sad fate; dree your weird!"

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
Abear means to bear or behave,
To put up with, endure, and be brave.
Those things you can't change
You must surely arrange
To dismiss with a nonchalant wave.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
You can bet on this side of the Channel
There's no candlewick spread that a man'll
Ever use on his bed.
But he'll sleep well instead
On a sheet made from sandpaper flannel.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It's a close-fitting top or a blouse,
Not the usual wear round the house,
But a body shirt's fine
If you're trying to shine
Down at Gold's as you mine for a spouse.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle and Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Just a hammock, a basket, and bark
By a tree-stump in Jellystone Park
Are the residue left,
And poor Boo Boo's bereft.
(Yogi Bear fell asleep in the dark.)

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
"Chinese horoscopes", so said our teachers,
"Map twelve signs to one's personal features:
Rooster, rabbit, rat, dog,
Tiger, snake, horse, goat, hog,
Monkey, dragon and ox — what strange creatures."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"Boss, our wool shop's run short of a yarn —
It's called Gone-With-The-Wind Southern Barn."
"For colors strange-named,
I care less," he exclaimed.
"My dear, frankly, I don't give a darn."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The computer repairman was vexed
At the work that's described in this text:
"Each component must be
Set in line, one, two, three.
You must daisy-chain each to what's next."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Her disinterest in me I lamented.
Then to intimate sex she consented.
You ask how I succeeded?
I begged and I pleaded
For favors.  She finally relented.

limerick_list.author: johng
limerick_list.text:
A draught is a current of air
In a room, and it shouldn't be there.
In the States it's spelt draft
(And that rhymes with waft,
Which also means draught, I'm aware).

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
So funny's the joke that you told,
I died laughing.  The floor's where I rolled.
I guffawed so damn much
And so hard, it was such
That my bladder could not be controlled.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
You're drowning; please do so with grace.
If you flounder about, you lose face.
Rise above the wild norm;
Die with class, in good form.
If you flail, show some tempo and pace.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Though both hide in the leaves while you're hiking,
A rattlesnake warns before striking;
But a copperhead lurks
For an ambush, and smirks.
Such treachery's not to my liking.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The mahogany knife here displayed
Has a thin and elongated blade.
It's a cream-slice—employed
By my grandfather Floyd
To cut ice cream my grandmother made.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
The things kids get up to today
Go beyond simple mischief at play.
Now they hack main computers
And fire grown ups' shooters;
We'd scrump pears, but real stealing? No way!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"I'm reacting with horror, recoilment,
To the looting—the utter despoilment—
Of this innocent town,"
Said our chief, with a frown.
"Now we're caught in an awful embroilment."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
This American Craftsman style dwelling
Shows a mastery rare and compelling,
And what adds authenticity:
Graceful simplicity.
It's pricey? Be grateful they're selling.

limerick_list.author: Dick C. Erd
limerick_list.text:
Here's augitic! "Taree! Tataree!"
There's a fanfare of trumpets, you see,
To announce the arrival*
Of the form adjectival
Of the mineral augite, q.v.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"Would you like to play soccer today?
We can do it the easiest way
With my home foosball game."
"Twisting rods?  Jeez, that's lame,
Getting kicks 'kicking' balls on a tray."

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Chocolate ice cream's my favorite treat,
So I hijacked a truck in the street.
Now I'm pleased to report
It'll never fall short;
It'll take me a lifetime to eat.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Hey, it's Bjorn, right?  You used to not pay
Any heed to religion."  "Today,
I make calls door to door,
House to house, in God's corps."
"Bjorn, no way!  A Jehovah?"  "Ya, way."

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
A ball or a beam (wave or matter)
May rebound from a wall or a platter
Or whatever — you know,
Any surface.  Just so:
It may bounce (or the window may shatter).

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
Some people of prominent birth
Or of longstanding status and worth
Are known as blue-blooded
(With honours they're flooded),
But as we do they end in the earth.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
The checkerbloom's common along
Grassy trails in the west, growing strong
Near a high mountain slope
Where some shade gives it scope,
As it blooms in a pink, lacy throng.

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
"Pour that slop in the goat?" asked his daughter.
"Feed it this? I don't think that we oughta."
"Don't mistake my intent.
No, the gote's what I meant.
That's the gutter, the channel for water."

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
I'd be flying with ease and no care,
But I feel there's a "Humph!" in the air!
Perpendicular breezes
(Like teasing with wheezes)
Blow crossly, so fly if you dare!

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
The dentist had meant to benumb
My whole mouth 'fore he worked on my gum
So I wouldn't feel pain.
He forgot, yet again,
So I bit really hard on his thumb.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A silly goat sometimes called "Billy"
Was filled with desire for a filly,
But she called him "Wee Willie,"
A name he thought silly,
Asserting the weather's just chilly!

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Disemvowel means to cut the vowel bits
From a word; but hang onto your wits
(If at first you're perplexed)
To decipher the text
That could mean either 'tuts', 'tots', or 'tits'.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The actress Elena Verdugo
Kept a pet flying lemur (colugo).
She took her sweet lemur
For rides on her Beemer.
On such elegant motorbikes, few go.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
This argument's dragged on too long.
I have stated my case and it's strong.
Can't you see what I'd do
By agreeing with you?
I'd quite simply make both of us wrong.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
Are you hugging an egg? What a muddle!
You're the easiest one to befuddle!
No, please do not spoil it;
I meant lightly boil it.
That's coddle, you wally, not cuddle.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Careful probing uncovers what's true
As the sunshine evaporates dew.
Therefore, lie, if you will:
It may serve you, until
What is genuine slowly shows through.

limerick_list.author: woozy
limerick_list.text:
In caverns, the Morlocks live under us.
We'll need a fierce weapon most thunderous!
If the muzzle is flaring,
Then the sound will be blaring,
When firing the gun called a blunderbuss.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Not likely a user of oppio,
He worked hard—Gabriele Falloppio.
He excelled in anatomy,
Both of giant and atomy.
For pep did he order a doppio?

limerick_list.author: jayrusalem
limerick_list.text:
My roommate Roberta is shrewd;
At restaurants, for months she's pursued
Extra food at her meals
With her "Send it back!" spiels.
Yes, her canniness works, though it's rude.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Claude the auditor seemed to have fun
Telling me, auditee, "Listen, son.
These accounts are suspicious,
In fact, they're fictitious;
The books you thought cooked ain't half-done!"

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
At the edge of the drawer — what's this?
It's my church key! — my symbol of bliss.
Its triangular punch
Brings a long, liquid lunch
As I puncture each can with a hiss.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
You say you've "forgotten", my pet,
All those things that I asked you to get?
Then, please, feel at leisure:
To wait is my pleasure.
Mañana, don't hurry, no sweat!

limerick_list.author: Quickbeam
limerick_list.text:
Any process where oxygen's near
Is aerobic, which fills me with cheer.
When they tell me to train,
I trot out my refrain:
"I'm aerobically drinking my beer!"

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
He sat still in a cogitative pose,
Breathing deep, out his mouth, in his nose;
Chanting "om" he went deep
In a trance (not to sleep).
It was there all his best thoughts arose.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
My girlfriend, as long as I've known 'er,
Has been happiest being a loner.
Now the whole of the nation
Is in self-isolation,
She's desolate: my, my, Corona.

limerick_list.author: johng
limerick_list.text:
Dear, I think you are ever so kind.
I am sure  that my sweetie won't mind
Doing something for me
Since she's  nice as can be.
(Such cajolery's handy I find.)

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Red heat, and the sweat and the smell
In the ring where the death-dances swell —
Can bloodshed be art?
No, not deep in the heart
Of bullfighting's passionate hell.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Into bed I was hoping to leap
With a knockout anesthetist.  Deep
Was my interest, I thought,
But it all was for nought
On our date when she put me to sleep.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Acoustic ecology shows
The contact that constantly flows
Between us and our sphere
That's perceived though the ear
As opposed to the eye, tongue, or nose.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
At long last, we've acquired a rail line—
Not grand, but a rather small-scale line.
Don't, please, misconstrue us:
Our dummy will do us.
It's poky; we've dubbed it "The Snail Line."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Dopart
limerick_list.text:
For your date you should know the best way;
Get good traveler's info today.
5-1-1 you can call
So you'll speed and not crawl.
And your tryst? All your fears you'll allay.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
You've contracted catarrh — such a sneeze!
What a toxic and powerful breeze!
I can see your cold bloom;
I don't want to enrheum,
So you'll cover your orifice?  Please.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Baby-minder." The ad sounded fun.
"We will pay you to mind our young son."
On my very first try
I was fired, but why?
Each demand the kid made I had done.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The Brothers Four jumped on the scene
With a song about fields that, once green,
Became parched by the sun —
Almost made number one.
Then they sang for the big and small screen.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Joe, your poems have a formalized style,"
Said a critic, "and after a while,
They seem lifeless and ashen.
Don't be slave to one fashion.
Diversify! Readers will smile!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Our lab's gerontology crew
All came down with that new kind of flu,
But the old folks, protected,
Remained uninfected—
Vaccines we came up with came through.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Attorneys in various firms
Have been known by a number of terms:
Words like bloodsuckers, giving
What they do for a living.
(No offense, Hirudinean worms.)

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
You bought me a spankin' new door latch.
It's cheap and godawful, a poor latch.
Dumb spring just goes "PING!" —
Doesn't do a damn thing,
Neither locks nor unlocks, unlike your latch.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My favorite shop was now shut,
Out of business—its life had been cut.
The door's sign, I was wishing,
Might have said "We've gone fishing!"
"Out for trout" would have calmed down my gut.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
"Doctor Livingstone, I presume?" can,
Alongside "One small step for a man,"
Link explorers, but then,
What impelled these two men?
(Curiosity's where it began.)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
She decided quite early that Clay
Was the boy she would marry some day.
He was four. She was three.
I advised, "Wait and see.
Either one of you might turn out gay."

limerick_list.author: cauliflower
limerick_list.text:
Long ago, when the news-gath'ring squad
Of the Nazareth Times got the nod
To report a sensation-
al Annunciation,
LOCAL GIRL, ran their headline, MATES GOD.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
If a pedlar in Athens declares
You'll receive, if you purchase his wares,
A free grizzly that dances,
Don't take any chances—
Beware of a Greek gifting bears.

limerick_list.author: matthewg and Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Ambrosia, the food of Greek gods!
Don't complain how it tastes, or the odds
Are that Zeus will get mad,
And for you, 'twould be bad,
If you haven't installed lightning rods.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Was Ivan a terrible czar—
The worst ruler of Russia by far?
And was Peter so great
'Cause he pulled his own weight,
So historians rate him a star?

limerick_list.author: Engineer
limerick_list.text:
Do you know the ex-congressman who
Thought payola was strictly taboo?
After years in the place,
He has turned "about face";
Now a lobbyist's life he'll pursue.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A castrensial life—not a care!
Just a tent and the sweet summer air.
Me and Donna knew this:
Outdoor living is bliss!
(But then Junior got mauled by a bear.)

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I was sassing my dad and my mum
For their ban on the chewing of gum.
Now I'm blowing a bubble,
Inviting more trouble:
A doubling of smacks on my bum!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Though it's late, and past time that we went,
We're awaiting her royal consent.
Once she deigns to bestow
Her permission to go,
By her leave, we can leave this event.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I came on to Marie in my car,
But she found my behavior bizarre,
Saying, "Didn't you know
We're just friends?  We can't go
Any further.  That bridge is too far."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My meter'd be neater, I guess
(And my verse a lot less of a mess),
With a different PG
Giving stress that would be,
As you've guessed, on the syllable ness.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Whenever you're feeling inventive,
Your pride may become the incentive
To finish your work.
You will find, if you shirk,
That your pride is for sure discontentive.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
With exogamous marriage, you flout
Expectations by marrying out.
Though your folks tried to nix a
Respectable shiksa,
No grandparent's quite so devout.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Cosmic irony: Life can't be led;
It is life that leads us all instead.
It's so huge, we are small,
And it cares not at all
If we're thriving or failing — or dead.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
E15, Iceland stratovolcano,
Spews out fog that can clog up your plane. O!
If explain it I must,
It's just ashes and dust.
Can't they wash it away with some Drano?

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Aramaean tongue's called Aramaic,
Though in everyday speech it's archaic;
Using words Christ would say,
Baghdad Christians still pray
During bomb-blasts unparadisaic.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
J.D. Salinger, pen-and-ink scratcher,
Remarked, "I'm a feeble plot hatcher.
My latest tale stunk
('Bout a ballplayer, drunk).
I'm rewriting The Rye in the Catcher."

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Towns and cities have clear building codes
To describe occupational modes.
English basement employs
A design one enjoys
Part above, part below, nearby roads.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Avatar means a godhead's descent
As a mortal on earth, bless'd event.
Now when avatar's spoken,
It's merely a token:
Motif on a message you've sent.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
"The vasectomy won't hurt your vigor,"
Said my doc, "Or your thingamajigger."
Though it's blanks I now shoot,
Something doesn't compute,
'Cause I'm way, way too quick on the trigger.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
"Dear Vanessa," young Kevin replied,
"Though I see your affection has died,
I am cool; there's the rub.
Now I'm off to the pub
With the boys, without breaking my stride."

limerick_list.author: Bill Middleton
limerick_list.text:
A motto that's presently shared
By the Boy Scouts was loudly declared
When a tenderfoot tyke
Fixed the horn on his bike
And then proudly announced, "Beep repaired."

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
It's been many a day and a night
Since dainty meant "joy" or "delight."
This sentence I saw, sir,
From the era of Chaucer:
Gret deyntee have we that he write.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If your book's been in print for a year
It's on backlist, but be of good cheer.
Don't mix up the backlist
With boycott or blacklist;
It's the publisher's catalog, dear.

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
I swear, folks, it's simply a myth
That the hippie Chrysanthemum Smith
Beads and flowers eschewed,
And joined up where a Jew'd
Get empowered: "The Sons" (B'nai B'rith).

limerick_list.author: nevadaace
limerick_list.text:
In Daman, Wanda wanted to run
For dewan when her son was just one.
But the boy liked to whine
And he puked on a shrine.
That mistake, it just couldn't be spun.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Citrinin—that's stuff found in mold—
Is quite toxic to kidneys. I'm told
It's the cause of the Balkan
Nephropathy—talkin'
Of which sets my blood running cold.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
Lady Flavia Phelps, such a card,
As at poker, she cheats really hard—
Marks the edge of a jack;
Hides an ace in her mac—
Now the clubs have all told her she's barred.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
In Brazil, in a grassland or swamp,
Is the place where I frequently romp.
I'm a black-bellied seed-
eater, vanishing breed—
On my habitat, humans now stomp.

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
The "Wayfarer's Dole" at St. Cross
Is some bread and some beer (but no doss).
They are served on an alms plate.
If you don't keep your palms straight,
The dole will fall down, a dead loss.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
An anatomy prof has a jones
For a vertebrate's skeletal zones.
He gets off on the arm,
Which provides him both charm
And a humerus take on its bones.

limerick_list.author: kavi
limerick_list.text:
So you knit and you purl with the best?
Aran patterns? I'm duly impressed,
For I am unable
To finish a cable—
Three needles! I'm sorely distressed.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
A defendant would finally wilt
As an alfet its sordid case built.
By boiling his arm
In a cauldron, such harm
Was deemed proof of the poor fellow's guilt.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
The flight's landing, a routine event
For the crew, and most passengers pent.
Seat-backs upright, ears pop.
We all tilt; start to drop
On the glide path of prudent descent.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Yo, cryal means "heron", okay?
There isn't much more one can say.
I could pad and add fluff,
But already, enough.
Hey, cry all you like. Make my day.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A bunny who married his honey
Got confused, so he spent all his money
In the store where they sold
Stuff with diamonds and gold.
When she ate them, she died.  Life is funny.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
DenmarK
limerick_list.text:
For prescient wagers I'll boast:
As a better, I'm better than most,
But better by far, be
It dogs or the Derby,
I am when I bet ante-post.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
Determinists say what's contained
In this limerick's been preordained
By the fates or whatever,
No matter how clever
My wording or how I've been trained.

limerick_list.author: zqms
Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
At the oche, he's had a fast start.
Now he's easing his beer-gut — vast fart!
Something's wrong — he can't throw!
It's dartitis — oh, no!
He just can't seem to chuck the last dart.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Well, this court action sure gets my goat.
No one cares for a creditor's vote.
I'll defeat, if I can,
This man's bankruptcy plan.
It's a cramdown—and that you may quote!

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
A scribe who'd been able and chaste
Wrote some lim'ricks, uncouth and debased.
They're ascribable to
His imbibing bad brew.
Like his lim'ricks, it left a bad taste.

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
When a dowager opts to bepaint,
It's apt to create some complaint:
Bold layers of makeup
May flake, cake and shake up
The passersby—if they don't faint.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
When this tidal bore bears down on thee,
You'll be eager the aegir to flee.
If the maritime god
Strikes your vessel roughshod,
You'll feel Aegir's long reach from the sea.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My demure European pet tortoise
Is dead and in stiff rigor mortis.
My garden's Testudo,
A dude I named Pluto,
Was killed when I spilled aqua fortis.

limerick_list.author: sigg
limerick_list.text:
On the stream bank the dark Alnus grew.
And beside 'twas a Taxus debut.
"You'll lose our light fight,"
Said the tree of great height,
"For I'll always be alder than yew."

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
The Acontias lizard's no snake,
So I hope you don't make that mistake.
It is legless, that's true,
But between me and you,
It's a skink, so I think it's a fake.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I'm a knight who can handle his lance,
But a joust rarely ends in romance:
I am gamboised —  thick quilting
Rucks up while I'm tilting.
I'm raw at the post-tourney dance.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
Downright devilishness! (Damien's way
To please Nanny with antics "at play".)
"Trapped the cook in the freezer?
You puckish young teaser..."
By the end, she'll get hers (Hell to pay).

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
The family of fungi named A-
garicaceae's crossing your way.
Have a closer look, dear—
We would otherwise fear
You might eat the wrong mushroom one day!

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
In baseball, the caps that you wear
Have a bill on the front, so the glare
Of the sun is at bay.
If you're bald, say hurray!
It disguises your absence of hair.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
On a clipper asea on the deep,
We are clipping and shearing a sheep.
But the hold is so full;
Won't she stop making wool?
I can tell ewe that shipping's not cheap.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
At Madame Tussaud's, several backs
Sport a deadly and blood-dripping ax.
These are real, not charades,
And these murderous blades
Are the source for the name House of Whacks.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When the tenor sang: "Ricco non sono..."
He delivered it con abbandono.
"He was brilliant!" cried Benny,
"But made not a penny."
He'd given the concert pro-bono.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
The beat is heard hither and yon,
Whether rhythmic or sweet, from the dawn
Of African drumming
To Indian tom-tomming
Into boogie and rock on and on.

limerick_list.author: Brian Cairns
limerick_list.text:
"Buy my fruit, try a Burgamy pear!"
"Come and look at me dance with a bear!"
"See the black tattooed man
From remote Hindustan!"
—The delights of Bartholomew Fair.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My weight-watching diet is drudgery,
What with ritual measures of pudgery.
I stand on the scale
Every day without fail
And engage in numerical fudgery.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Into his rathole he staggered,
Unshaven, disheveled, and haggard.
"I bin out on the street
Cheatin' people I meet—
Just doin' me job as a blaggard."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
Engineer
limerick_list.text:
Bun a hamburger hot off the grill.
Spoon on chili — prepare for a thrill.
Oh, the grease and the spice
Make a taste treat so nice.
Hours later you're tasting it still.

limerick_list.author: Harris Risman
limerick_list.text:
When you split, is annulment the way?
It can make some folks gossip you're gay.
Kenny Chesney, of course,
Should have sought a divorce
When he ended his ties to Renee.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
Though it's trivial, it's mildly ironic
That quinine is by nature cinchonic.
I could ponder that link,
But I'm sinking this drink —
Which I think is a pink gin and tonic.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
For conditions or qualities, Nancy,
Words are frequently ending in ancy,
For example there's vagrancy,
Pregnancy, flagrancy
And more. It's a snap—nothing fancy.

limerick_list.author: man from tashkent
SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The suffragist struggle: the prequel.
"The woman," we said, "is man's equal!"
So I cook and keep house
For my kids and my spouse,
While I hold down two jobs—that's the sequel.

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
Oh, the eventide's dusk dims towards night;
Its shadows steal sharpness from sight.
With Helios low,
The crepusculine glow…
Oh, just shut up and turn on a light!

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
My new song hit the charts labeled "pop"
Then crossed over, but stumbled as "'bop."
When it took off as "country,"
Some called it effront'ry,
Though it climbed almost clear to the top.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The comb-jellies live in the sea
And in waters more brackish (q.v.).
What do you proffer a
Beast in Ctenophora?
Prey. They don't go for debris.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
I think I'll go hence then come hither,
And thence I'm inclined to go thither.
So whither and whence?
I'll sit on the fence;
Without a direction, I'll dither.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When two features co-vary together,
Like two dray horses joined by a tether,
Students need not expect
They are cause and effect
(Like the pains in my neck—and wet weather).

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Caffeinic refreshments are  best,
And they help when I'm feeling depressed:
Drinks like coffee or tea
Or some Pepsi. Oh, whee!
I've had so much that now I can't rest.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Remember that money I lent?
Well, I haven't yet seen one red cent.
Seems you always evade
Every debt to be paid.
You're a deadbeat.  Our friendship is spent.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
What can you do for a lark?
Camp out in Yosemite Park!
You'll toss away cares
When you sleep among bears
And watch chipmunks dart out before dark.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Some ex-students decided to sue
Sketchy real estate college, Trump U.
"The Donald" flashed mettle—
"I never will settle!"
Now twenty-five million is due.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
This "professional" wrestling is junk!
And this "Good guy v. Bad guy"?  All bunk!
The "babyface" (sneer!)
Is the guy the fans cheer
While the "heel" is the guy who's the punk.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Demon rum was Dale's downfall — and mine.
We drank everything: liquor, beer, wine.
But now, thanks to AA,
We are dry and OK.
If we stay on the wagon, we're fine.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
A young botanist started to read
About cypselae, one kind of seed.
But he's hardly amused;
Seems the word's rarely used,
And it doesn't fill one human need.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai and Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
An alkoxy's an ether's one side
(Ethers being two chains by O tied).
That oxygenous heart
Lends its name to one part,
With the other left oxy-denied.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
The captain is having a fit,
For the ball's hit the splice, the bat's split!
But they're scrambling a run,
Is the match lost or won?
The return's smashed the stumps: direct hit.

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
If crim is a short form of criminal,
Then Jim may be taken for Jiminal.
And William St. Leger
(Analogy pledger)
Might derive from a lim the word liminal.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
A striving young woman named Gail
Eats her toenails and pees in a pail,
And takes showers of slime,
All in order to climb
The disreputability scale.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Cal  conked out as he studied each shell,
With a hope that the pictures would tell,
In the part called zoology
(Section, conchology),
Names of the shellfish, as well.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An anguis looks much like a snake;
It is easy to make a mistake.
It is also called slow
Worm and blindworm although
It has eyes (and a tail that can break).

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
A denotable entity's said
To have something, if properly read,
That would actually mean
The forementioned unseen:
Like that ring that would signal you're wed.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Young Miss Muffet, who clerked at the Hyatt,
Grew svelte on a cottage cheese diet.
A large garden spider
Yelled, "Yick, it's not cider!"
"Don't knock it," said she, "till you try it."

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
If electrical current should flow,
Then the Biot-Savart law will show
The magnetic field (B)
Is computed, you see,
With an integral. That's all I know.

limerick_list.author: jsolomon and Scott Campisi
limerick_list.text:
Whether soup or some peas that are canned,
Or some lotion that helps you look tanned,
I won't buy the cheaper
Generics. The steeper
Stuff's worth it because of the brand.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
It's not a big problem — no pain,
Having been diagnosed acrocran-
ic.  There's nothing to dread;
It means long in the head,
And it doesn't put strain on your brain.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Here's the gorge with the swift current splashing;
The narrows with rocks — waters crashing.
"It's the dalles. You'd be daft
To try this on your raft."
Well, he did. We took pictures — they're smashing.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Since a hit man was tracking him, Drew
Circuitously traversed the zoo.
Said the thug, held in check
By this roundabout trek,
"This guy Drew's too damned hard to pursue!"

limerick_list.author: Robert Schechter
limerick_list.text:
She couldn't stop sneezing and coughing.
She explained, "I don't mean to be scoffing,
But I'm highly allergic
To things dramaturgic.
There must be a play in the offing."
