limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
An Aussie may comment, "Fair dinkum!"
On a girl, or your house, or your income,
Or a book, or a show,
Or maybe a row
Of glasses of Foster's (then drink 'em).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An old algolagniac said,
"I'm for torturing women in bed!"
His name was de Sade,
And I thought him quite odd,
So I spoke of the weather instead.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Pass the cheese tray!" he bellowed. "Of course,"
She replied, "You eat just like a horse!"
"Horses never eat cheese.
You've got masters' degrees,
But you're dumb!" Now she wants a divorce.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
There's a flower acropetal—bound
To develop its buds from the ground.
They will bloom without stop
'Til they get to top
And the uppermost blossom is crowned.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Cenogamy: that's when society
Encourages sexual variety.
Still, I just have to say
Seven lovers each day
Could result in performance anxiety.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
As St Sniff's board of governors, we
Have decreed Tristan's in, for a fee.
We provide for the toff—
Let the proles bugger off
To where schools have no class, but they're free.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
See this drill hole? It's known as a bore,
And for oil it is used to explore.
When you're searching for oil,
Just drill holes neath the soil;
Check the core. Nothing there? Drill some more.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
"One: I felt that this Rolex was due me.
Two: I hired an artist, who drew me."
"Such frivolous spending!
When will it be ending?"
"Not ever! Don't like it? Then sue me!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In reform schools, the disciplinal creeds
Stress compliance above inmates' needs.
If a kid breaks a rule,
The reaction is cruel.
Guards will beat the poor fool till he bleeds.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The length of this Colchester st.
Is many Imperial ft.
If a Roman had put
His imperial ft.
On this st., we would call it jes' nt.

limerick_list.author: man from tashkent
limerick_list.text:
Some arm-twisting helps to convert
One whose mindset you want to divert,
  But no real arm's attacked
  With this lev'raging act,
So seldom is anyone hurt.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Warm the cockles, they say, of one's heart.
Mollusks?  No.  The ventricular part
(From corrupting the Latin
Term cochleae).  That, in
A snail shell, explains it.  Feel smart?

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Since my swordplay's not good, I admit,
I rely on my shield quite a bit.
On its center, a boss
Seven inches across
Will protect me, I hope, if I'm hit.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In the '30s, when theaters we'd pass,
A sign would read: "Offer—first class!
Come tonite—dishes free
With admission!" They'd be
Giving handouts—Depression-type glass.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
I'm a hungry and homeless man who
Had a life and a wife just like you.
Does she love you and kiss you?
Please buy a Big Issue —
I think it's the least you can do.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
In the hammer event, a guy's throw
Gave the fans a fine aerial show.
His wild screams rent the air
As it howled through his hair —
But the tosser just wouldn't let go.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
"Marching opposite ways!" I done thunk,
But I shouldn't write verse when I'm drunk.
Counter-drilling's applied
From the opposite side
And you hope the holes meet, or you're sunk.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
In the glow of the late summer sun,
Before winter's grey chill has begun,
In the woods, among weeds,
Gilded curly-heads' seeds
Gleam as brightly as gold that's been spun.

limerick_list.author: Jac
limerick_list.text:
There's a small chap who likes to play rugger,
And jostle the scrum, hugger-mugger.
He could well break his neck
But he thinks, "what the heck!"
He's a brave — or insane — little bugger.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In my darkroom, I process and print
Photo landscapes. I give them a tint
That combines realistic
With  mystic, artistic—
To judge them, the viewer must squint.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Her head's big enough for a group
And her curls swing around loop-de-loop.
Though she's just a cartoon
She made manly men swoon.
That's our Betty. She's boop-oop-a-doop.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Although fry plaice and braaivleis are rhymes,
In South Africa's summery climes,
You will not see much fish
On a barbecue dish —
Meatless braais are regarded as crimes.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
Mary
limerick_list.text:
Since he never begrudged me a dollar,
I tried to ignore all his choler,
Though I thought him a grump
Whom I wanted to dump
When vexations would cause him to holler.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
William Shakespeare wrote many a sonnet
About maids who abandoned the bonnet;
Tresses tossed in the breeze
Made him weak at the knees
With the urge, and the acting upon it.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I regard you so highly, it's true!
You deserve admiration, you do.
What a pity I saw
That you've got a slight flaw.
You're esteemable, sure, but we're through.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
On his good side you always should stay.
If you get on his bad side, you'll pay.
If you anger, annoy,
Or upset that strange boy,
To the cornfield he'll wish you away.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Made of plastic or wood and the size
Of two centre-spring-loaded French fries:
Known as clothes pegs, they clip,
In a crocodile grip,
To a clothesline where washing soon dries.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
It's at 440 cycles per second
That the modern "A" standard is reckoned.
It's been sharper and flatter;
We needed the matter
Resolved, and this round number beckoned.

limerick_list.author: Brian Cairns
limerick_list.text:
As we travelled the road to Beijing
(China's capital, once called Peking),
The roadsign displaying it
Gave no help in saying it—
A curious, picture-like thing.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I can see it in other folks' eyes:
My dysmorphism causes surprise.
My extreme deformation
Brings endless frustration—
Lord, make me just one of the guys!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When a girl is excessively chaste,
And disgracefully going to waste,
We should chasten her pacing,
To hasten unlacing
Of stays staying stubbornly laced!

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
Rodrigo Diaz de Vivar
Has a story that's slightly bizarre:
Fought both for and 'gainst Moors
In some various wars.
As El Cid, he was known near and far.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
We parted at Martha's insistence,
In spite of my lively resistance.
She finds our estrangement
A welcome arrangement;
I'd best, she insists, keep my distance.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
In our restaurant, a visiting lout
Found a rat and then waved it about.
This attracted the crew
And the manager too
And, for muscle, our stout chucker-out.

limerick_list.author: CruzerX
limerick_list.text:
The affliction anoia's extreme;
There's a mind that can't function or scheme.
Oh, the brain is still there,
But it works like it's air,
So there's nobody home, it would seem.

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
"There's a new store in town, Kitchen Copper,
Where I brought you a gleaming new chopper."
Anger stirred by that phrase
Made me say, eyes ablaze,
"I'll learn you to talk English proper!"

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
To Wisconsin, the lead-miners came,
Digging tons of galena, their aim.
And at night each lay snug
In a brock-house he'd dug.
So the Badger State came by its name.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
I've gulped Advils and such by the score,
But my purulent jaw still is sore.
I'll dispense with a sleuth
And deduce "abscessed tooth."
I need antibiotics — hard core.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Cramoisy — shade of the worm,
Like vermilion and crimson. The germ
Of the name is that dead
Kermes-bugs furnished red
For the Romans and Arabs, long-term.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Ted's writing was shameful, discreditable,
With smut that was not even editable.
Disappointed, I fired him,
Then inquired who had sired him—
Is immoral behavior hereditable?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Sir, you're reeking of vomit and wine.
Please step out of the car. Walk this line.
Touch the tip of your nose.
This exam clearly shows
You're not drunk. Your eupraxia's fine.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This insecticide, please understand,
Was approved; the result was unplanned.
First dieldrin was used,
But thereafter accused
Of toxicity. Then it was banned.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
What is chemical energy, say?
A potential one, given away
In reactions. We need
It so badly to feed,
And to fuel our cars, day by day.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
This sign on my shield is new-fangled;
The design's been repeatedly mangled.
They've pushed bits about
That they should have left out,
So what once was a line is now angled.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
What's a dictionary?  Golly, beats me.
Haven't heard of that word… could it be
In this reference book
That lists meanings? Let's look—
Goodness knows I've my doubts, but we'll see.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
When a diaphoretic makes sweat,
Could be fever, emotion, or threat,
Taking drugs, or the flu,
Or from exercise too —
But "hot flash" is the consummate wet.

limerick_list.author: Shelby Forrest
limerick_list.text:
A problem in many a nation
Is control of extreme procreation.
I pray that some day
They may think of a way
To promote population deflation.

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
If you look at my eyes there won't be
Any sign of the hole that's the key
To perceiving a view —
There's no pupil, just blue.
Acorea is why I can't see.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Leads Roy Rogers, Gene Autry, Tom Mix
All were stars of our matinee pics.
There our heroes were seen
Ten feet tall on the screen
Every week in our Saturday flicks.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
The bahut's medieval and French.
Small enough to slide under a bench,
It's a chest that would hold
Household objects of old,
Like the thimbles and threads of a wench.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
Of the animals here in the zoo,
I like bears, apes and elephants too.
The tigers are dear cats
And as for the meerkats,
They're cute, but my favourite is you!

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Armoured chlamyphores put up with hair,
But they'd tear it all out in despair
If they knew half the ways
People name them these days.
Armoured 'dillos like folks to be fair.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Noblesse may be present at birth—
Once called eugeny (trait of great worth).
Now that mankind is mobile,
Nobility's global,
Encountered all over the earth.

limerick_list.author: cauliflower
limerick_list.text:
A cluster should, logically, clust,
And bluster, as logically, blust.
But our words seldom play
By the rules, though they say,
At Li'l Bighorn, George Custer sure cussed.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Sean O'Reilly is set to forsake
Both his family and Ireland—he'll take
The next ship to the States,
Where a new life awaits.
So tonight's his American wake.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
It's a film that the critics find grating
And a bomb that the public is hating.
"It's a loser, a snooze,"
Say the news and reviews.
It's receiving a proper berating.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
There once was a Japanese jockey
Whose home was in Amagasaki,
But he found that his horse
Couldn't keep to the course,
"So perhaps," he declared, "I'll try hockey."

limerick_list.author: Brian Cairns
limerick_list.text:
The bar's set at two meters ten.
The athlete must clear it—and then—
If he's not too fatigued
(I can tell you're intrigued)
At two-twelve he must try it again!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"A calamitous outcome is near,"
Warns our leader, apocalypse seer.
No collapse of the skies
Will befall us; this guy's
Chicken Little, a merchant of fear.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
There's a view that's accepted today,
During radioactive decay,
High dose gamma rays can
Cause great damage to man,
Which is what the researchers all say.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Columbus was wrong in his quest:
The Indies weren't off to the west.
Later visitors learnt
That the Indians weren't,
And that Native American's best.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Irish writers? There's none with a voice
As distinctive as that of James Joyce.
Read his Dubliners tales;
Their allure never fails,
And among them, The Dead's my first choice.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
Their eyesight is far from precise,
But those three blindly run. And the price?
They get sliced at the tail,
Which leads them to wail,
"Oh, rats! Now we're wireless mice!"

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I'm in terror, in fear, sore effray.
The law gets its due on this day.
In a few minutes more
I shall pass through that door,
My short life to be taken away.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Against Odds my team Evens would play.
We lost always, till early today,
When we last-second scored,
Putting points on the board.
"Evens Beat the Odds Twice," headlines say.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I was carefree when young; now I ain't.
Looking back on my youth, it seems quaint.
Since acquiring a house
Full of kids and a spouse,
What I'm seeking is just carefree paint!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The butterfly stroke — shallow dive,
Push the water, thrust upward, and strive
Not to overextend
And go flat at the end.
For a ribbon, you have to survive.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The top of the ninth saw us grinning.
Things collapsed in that bottom half-inning.
Their lead batter walked,
And our pitcher then balked.
Of the end, that was just the beginning.

limerick_list.author: wzph
limerick_list.text:
Achiropody isn't so sweet,
As its victims are left incomplete.
But if, given the chance,
They show courage and dance,
Then at least there's no pair of left feet.

limerick_list.author: Taillefer and Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
I was fair-haired, until my new bloke
Said he favored brunettes—my heart broke.
So I dyed my hair brown.
When he saw me, his frown
Showed that clown had been making a joke!

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
"New kids on the block" "peg" the quote
To say "look at me", "heads up", "take note".
This "butt-brained" convention
To "suck" my attention
Is "phooey", and "that's all she wrote".

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Said my wife,  "There is something I've missed.
I have never, by Trump, been French-kissed!"
I replied, with a shriek,
"You'd be kissed by that freak?"
"No, 'twas said tongue in cheek. Don't get pissed."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The bullbat, each evening's a sight,
Eating insects it captures in flight—
Not a bull nor a bat,
But a bird (fancy that!),
Though a nighthawk's no hawk of the night.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Are my daughter's eyes brown? More like black,
As an iris, for her, is a lack.
Yes, from birth, my sweet Lydia
Has had aniridia:
No iris at Dad looking back.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
There's a fungus among us, they say,
And our fruit is now aecium's prey.
Its binucleate spores
Burrow into the cores.
Guess I won't have an apple today.

limerick_list.author: therese flanagan
limerick_list.text:
Aminopyrine was used to ease pain;
Several died when they tried this: no gain.
To cure or to kill,
It is all in this pill.
Gee, no thanks, I feel fine; I'll refrain.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
It made the new trumpeter quail
When the maestro addressed him, to rail:
"You stupid freeloader!
Da capo al coda
Means play from the head to the tail!"

limerick_list.author: Cuttlefish
limerick_list.text:
In a memory firm and unfaded,
I remember Bo Derek's hair, braided
Into cornrows, so tight.
Didn't like it?  You might
Be upbraided for being so jaded.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
I am sorry my news isn't cheerier:
You've hereditary coproporphyria.
The production of heme
In your blood, it would seem,
Is impaired. Too much sun. Try Siberia.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
"Let's invent a new language," some say,
"To bring order to this disarray.
Let's make Europe more open
By speaking Europan.
(And no funny accents, okay?)"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Same birthday? We're thus coetaneous.
Our existences? They're contemporaneous,
But I'd like you to know
That I'm happy to go
Through my life on my own—you're extraneous!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
We needed Beau Geste, but Bo Peep
Was our leader. Our foes, with one sweep,
Forced our utter dispersal.
That swingeing reversal
Disperpled us, shepherdless sheep.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The cowboy mustache ain't complex.
It is rugged, unkempt, and reflects
A life lived on the range.
On a wimp it looks strange,
But just right if your nickname is Tex.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Clem, we're fixin' to leave in a minute
For France, though I know yer agin it.
Maw's all ready to go,
And the pick-up's packed, so,
Consarn it, you better get in it!

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
With a glimmer of faith he has flirted,
Hates dogma that's crudely asserted.
An astronomer knows
That the faintest of glows
Can't be seen unless vision's averted.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
In the dirt under Damaraland,
Little mole rats will dig through the sand.
There they work in a "hive"
Where, like bees, they all thrive,
With their queen giving birth on demand.

limerick_list.author: Reia Light
limerick_list.text:
"Time to set off the bomb! I presume
That you've lit its long fuse? Then we'll zoom
Safely out of harm's way—
Wait, what's that that you say?
It was only six inches? Shi–" BOOM!

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
"Anyways," says the Cap'n, "Right now,
I'll be headin' some place 'round Macau.
Long as no-one objects,
We'll be goin' there next,
Anywheres, anywise, anyhow."

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster and SusanL
limerick_list.text:
No matter what country I'm in,
I always feel guilty as sin.
"Any goods to declare?"
Really gives me a scare—
Nosy customs guys. Why must they grin?

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
The ladies drank iced tea (and warmer tea)
And surveyed a display of disformity.
There were different-shaped wares:
Some with tapers, some flares;
Small and smooth or of knobbly enormity.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
A computer consultant named Grange
Said, "My network's behavior is strange.
Its packets aren't switching,
So everyone's bitching,
And soon it will crash the Exchange."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
What's a chaetopod? That is a term
That's applied to an annelid worm,
As its bristle, or seta,
Is known as a chaeta.
These beasties can make people squirm.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
He found many new things he could teach
There at Heidelberg where he could reach
Analytical heights
By new light-spectral  sights.
Bunsen's students paid heed to his speech.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
This audile sensation appears
To be worse since it now interferes
With my counting of sheep
As I'm trying to sleep.
There's a ringing that's deep in my ears.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Here's something that didn't just happen:
From lieutenant, my jump up to cap'n.
Likewise, major won't come
From the blue, packed in some
Shiny box with big bows and gift wrappin'.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Rick fell down on the job and was canned
And from further employment is banned.
"When performance is down,"
Said his buddy, a clown,
"Tightrope walkers aren't much in demand."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Our exiguous share of the crop
Didn't bring very much at the shop:
A rough tick for our bed,
Needed dry goods and thread,
And for Timmy, a store-bought'n top.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Far away by the Caspian shore,
I adored all the fabrics I wore.
And my astrakhan shawl,
Which I loved most of all,
Came from lambs that I kept on the floor.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
On the face of the letter, writ plain:
"Dear John, though it causes me pain,
I have tried to remain,
But you drive me insane,
So I've taken a lover in Spain."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I'm agnostic, i.e., noncommittal.
The concept of God is a riddle;
Same for heaven and hell.
Others' "truths" just don't jell.
I devoutly inhabit the middle.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
When younger, Miss Price was a looker.
Now "Jordan", she's more like a hooker.
She's done something drastic
With Botox and plastic.
She's D-list for sure. Wanna book her?

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Will the white-bearded colonel be killed?
The establishment formerly billed
As Kentucky Fried Chicken,
Health-consciousness-stricken,
Is kickin' the bucket, for "grilled".

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
Hotshot Hank and his friend Brash McPhee
Were as bumptious as any could be—
Cocksure and conceited;
Who knows why they needed
To swagger to such a degree.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Your wife's sister is luscious and sweet,
A delectable hunk of hot meat.
Though she's sexy as hell,
And quite willing as well,
Those aren't very good reasons to cheat.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
"Nelson's Victory, world-renowned boat,
At last, is about to re-float
After years in dry dock!"
This, to most, was a shock —
April fooled and, my, didn't I gloat!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"She's the Princess of Darkness," I say.
"That she won't become POTUS, let's pray!"
With her glowin'-red gleamin' eyes
Clinton I'll demonize:
She's the devil sends voters my way.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"On top's Church, not Queen," tightens the valve in
That boiler-room stoked by John Calvin.
"A pox on you! Renovate?
Knox, you just Genevate,
Leadin' to burnin', not salvin'."

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
For your greeting card, first coin a phrase
Such as "rainbow-love shines through the haze."
You'll join, through the prism
Of your neologism,
Lame clichés on displays — but it pays!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The aorta's the common location
For narrowing called coarctation
Which surgeons repair,
If they dare, with great care
In the kids with this strange aberration.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Joe the Farmer's extremely forlorn
As he watches his fields being shorn.
A pest European
Is what he is seein'
As corn borers chew through his corn.

limerick_list.author: Chavi Beck
limerick_list.text:
Did you hear about Jerry last night?
Got his left side cut off in a fight!
Lost a leg, lost an arm—
But no cause for alarm:
I've been told that by now he's all right.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Altitudinarians often have flights
Of fancy: their names up in lights.
They're the types who aspire
To climb ever higher.
Their goals are the highest of heights.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Little Todd (BFH) screams and cries,
Pokes his fingers deep into my eyes,
And then pukes on my suit.
Of course, Mom thinks he's cute.
She's a prime PFH (no surprise).

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A bucket's a pail.  Don't know why
We've two terms for one concept, say I.
If cliches you are seeking,
Metaphorically speaking,
It's something you kick when you die.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Don't hold back! Go all out for it. Yell,
"Up 'n' at 'em!" Spare nothing. Don't dwell
On 'save some for reserve'
(That spells 'losing your nerve').
Go for broke. No holds barred. Give 'em hell!

limerick_list.author: olwen
limerick_list.text:
If steak is the meal of the day,
Buy Aberdeen-Angus, I'd say.
To start with good cattle
Is most of the battle,
Then cook it in just the right way.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The word bibulous means "marked by drinking
Lots of alcohol." This set me thinking.
Antibibulousness then
Sets a goal for all men:
Their consumption of booze should be shrinking.

limerick_list.author: DBRHoffman
limerick_list.text:
The bassoonist succumbed to his greed.
There packed in the case with his reed
Was a heroin brick
He could sell mighty quick.
A contraband shipment, indeed!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
These 200-foot palms are immense,
But no bit of them's cambium. Hence,
These tall palm trees aren't trees.
Fronds a-sway in the breeze,
Arecaceae: monocots, gents.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
If captured at gunpoint you've got
To keep cool, oxymoron or not.
A point on a gun?
No, I've never seen one,
But don't argue the point — you'll get shot.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
The trouble is, when I converse,
I don't stick to the point. What is worse,
I don't try. I confess
That I tend to digress.
(Excuse me. I love to excurse.)

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Meet my butcher — my ham-handed crony;
Most times what he tells you is phony.
When he ventures his meat
Is the best ("Can't be beat!"),
Rest assured that he's full of baloney.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Are you ready?  Then start your ignition
For the autocross car competition.
We'll test drivers' skills,
But we don't expect spills
Like the derby that courts demolition.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Arethusa's an orchid that's pink,
And resembles—as some people think—
The mouth of a dragon.
"I do," Maggie's braggin',
"If I glance very quickly and blink!"

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Declaring they're raring to go,
Then parading along in a row,
Is a here-a-van, there-a-van,
Wind-in-the-hair-a-van,
Devil-may-caravan show.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Cute but snarky" these monsters are called.
Upon reading their strip, I'm appalled.
They're mean-spirited, snide,
With no kindness inside.
Into corners they ought to be hauled.

limerick_list.author: Peter Meyer
limerick_list.text:
A contributor, wielding my pen,
I write limericks, post them, and then,
When a workshopping ed
Makes suggestions I dread,
I can do it all over again.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If you're playing the role of a tough,
And your voice has to sound really rough,
This technique I can teach:
If you asperate speech,
Thinking Bogart, you'll make it sound gruff.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
If a princess one day in a bog
Leaned over and kissed a huge frog
And a prince then appeared,
She'd be suitably cheered,
But I would just stand there agog.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Rip Van Winkle, who lacked all ambition,
Supped a keg. In recumbent position,
He slept twenty years
And lost touch with his peers—
One result of this famous dormition.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Though the ABC islands seemed great
For a honeymoon, me and my mate,
Truly sick of Nebraska,
Ended up in Alaska.
Now for Omaha's warmth we can't wait.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie and Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
Defining the phrase angle bracket?
Here follows one way to attack it:
It formerly meant
Something metal and bent.
Now it's used in the web design racket.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Feeding logs to the fire, young Bob
Found the andirons weren't up to the job.
"Insufficiently pretty,"
He thought, "more's the pity."
A cobiron is topped with a knob.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Owls' ears are designed to perfection
For the subtlest rustle's detection,
As the shapes 'round their eyes,
Asymmetric in size,
Have evolved parabolic reflection.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
I've never been one to adore a
Salmonella — it's got that bad aura.
But I won't let them smear ya,
Sweet enterobacteria:
You're good germs (intestinal flora).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When the Cyperus grew near the Nile,
Hieroglyphics were turned out with style,
And scribes were desirous
Of high-grade papyrus
To make their exertions worthwhile.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
An egestuous gent is young Cuddy,
Ever desperate for funds from a buddy,
Who, though loath to indict,
Still might gently invite
Him to toil. Is he likely? Not bloody.

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles
limerick_list.text:
In the Cold War, the Soviet threat
Made the U.S. and Canada fret.
So, beaucoup radar stations
Were built by these nations.
No planes slipped by DEW line's tight net.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
What's a Culdee? An anchorite Celt.
Here's his spare, simple cell, where he dwelt.
Hermitically sealed,
His faith was his shield.
(But he seldom shampooed, and he smelt.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A large bonus, this year, wasn't earnable,
So a drop in my income's discernible,
And next April, I guess,
When I pay IRS,
I'll find less of my assets returnable.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
Jan Dodonna drew plans of defiance
That he shared with the Rebel Alliance.
Though his plans weren't exact,
Still the rebels attacked;
They relied on the Force more than science.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Aleatoricism: art based on chance.
It may not make much sense at first glance
(Or at second or third).
Though some call it absurd,
Chance Chants is a film I'd advance.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
Does it set off a skirt or a suit
For a look that is dashing or cute?
Be you lady or gent,
That is not what is meant
By the odd term accessory fruit.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Though my vision was bleared, far and nearer,
The giggle-fest reason got clearer.
While I slept, I'd been shaved
As I found when I laved
And distressfully looked in the mirror.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
"Don't tackle a wombat, you fool,"
Said my uncle, "My number one rule.
Those burrowin' badgers
Will aim for your nadgers,
And doublin' up groanin' ain't cool."

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
I'm composed, so I don't fluster easily;
I just sail through life's stresses quite breezily.
I don't yell or get sad.
Just one thing makes me mad:
That's when people act sneaky or weaselly.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Last night, in my garden I found
Some foot spoors (or tracks) in the ground.
These footsteps were flat
And not deep. Seems a cat,
Or perhaps a small dog was around.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
For each hospital patient, a chart
Is maintained on the ward, in a cart.
It records TPR,
But does not go as far
As reporting each burp and each fart.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson and Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My manhood had always impressed,
Till my threshhold for pain was assessed.
I wore a fixed grin
As the light burned my skin.
At two dols, though, I screamed, "Stop the test!"

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
So let's go into detail—the catch
On the stud's split-pin slot has to match
With the ball socket's joint,
And the swivel's hinged point
Needs the steel-tipped shaft's claw-peg to latch.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Then music is heard — how alarming!
But Caliban's calm, since it's charming.
The isle, he declares,
Full of sounds and sweet airs,
Isn't harmful, though sometimes disarming.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Things for Dan are, no doubt, breaking well,
Though he hasn't scrubbed up for a spell.
He's a hobo, and yet
He has just met Yvette
Who is rich, thinks he's great, and can't smell.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
You knew nothing at first.  Got that straight?
Now you boast and you brag that you're great.
What an ego!  You'd be
Still naïve without me.
You're the monster I helped to create.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
The salon's on-time rule was quite clear
And was meant for all patrons to hear.
"We haven't got ointments
For broken appointments."
So pay heed to the wry balm bard, dear.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
This craftsmaster's tops in his trade
And his road to success has been laid
By his own blood and sweat;
Which he'll never regret—
He takes pride in the treasures he's made.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
They ignore my white carpet appeals
Concerning our dining room meals.
Our houseguests refuse
To remove dirty shoes;
They get stubborn and dig in their heels.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
In a dram, sixty grains may be found,
And twelve ounces can stretch to a pound:
I don't scruple to state
That apothec'ries' weight
Is clearly not metrically sound.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Said particle physicist Marx,
"The cohesion of nucleons   harks
Back to color and forces
(Taught in  earlier courses).
The tough glue of the nucleus — quarks."

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
There was a young lady called Bunny,
Pursued by hot suitors with money.
Delectably charming,
With beauty disarming,
The buzz was she tasted like honey.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
What's your e-mail address? It's a fast
Way to message a friend. In the past,
I used snail mail with stamps;
That's now only for gramps—
But the backlog (whew!) leaves me aghast.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
In the Greek Diophantus we see
A great "father of algebra". He
Wrote some books all worth praising,
Their contents amazing,
But, sadly, they're all Greek to me!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
As a Yank now in York, I must pay
For a holiday goof, sad to say.
"Boxing Day!", said my boss,
So I threw a right cross,
And was fired that very same day.

limerick_list.author: Amergin
limerick_list.text:
Chance the Gardener, a clod, apeing piety,
By his blankness could calm high anxiety.
Being There is a joke
On impressionable folk
And the hole at the heart of society.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Dad insists that I do something big
With my voice.  If I get the right gig,
I'll be famous and rich.
Although Dad's got the itch—
Fame and fortune?  I don't care a fig.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
From the cradle, there's blue in my veins
And arrests — they just happen in chains:
Seven collars per week
When I'm hitting my peak,
And without even taxing my brains.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
An adventurous buddy named Earl
Dreams of someday becoming a girl
Like a true Southern belle.
I advise, "What the hell.
Why not go for it? Give it a whirl!"

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
I hung from an ancon, then after
I said this, was greeted with laughter:
"You swayed from a sheep
Just like Little Bo-peep?"
Not a sheep, but a crossbeam or rafter.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
I'm dotty and daft; I'm a div.
I'm deluded—my head's like a sieve.
Not for me your banality!
Should I check on reality?
Cloud cuckoo land—that's where I live.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Asked a nerd, "So what's in the confinity
Of your backwater town, Chocowinity?"
"Why, you're an odd bird —
Please define that strange word."
The nerd replied snidely, "Vicinity."

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Is slapstick your chosen career?
I advise you that laughter comes dear.
You will need a fresh shtick
For your number to click —
I suggest, "Be the best! Pioneer!"

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Our love for algology flaming,
To classify kelp we were aiming.
From Maine to Eugene,
Oh, the seaweed we've seen!
And each alga we'd see we'd be naming.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
For cragginess I would suggest
South Dakota's Black Hills are the best.
Narrow canyons, sharp walls—
Their rough loneliness calls
The world's heartiest souls to the test.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I'd been drifting a rather long while,
Then fetched up on my tropical isle,
Safely beached and ashore,
Fish and breadfruit galore.
What, me worry? I'm living in style.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A shark has a large dorsal fin.
When we see one approach, we begin
To head quickly for shore,
Yelling, "Shark! Shark!" and more,
So that swimmers are warned by the din.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Said a medical student named Eric:
"This bone that you call epipteric
Only some folks have got
In their skulls. I had thought.
That anatomy should be generic!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Captain Mott met his death on his yacht.
Did his crew see him die? They did not.
At post mortem we found,
In his heart (big and round),
A cerise currant jelly-type clot.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
In bygone times, masters and misses
Played at draw-gloves. The forfeit was kisses.
But did players contend
To unglove? To extend
Talking fingers? A mystery, this is.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Herman rang 999 for his bride:
"Her contractions come not apart wide!"
Emergencies smiled:
"Sir, is this her first child?"
"Nein, nein, nein! It's her husband," he cried.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Since driving while drunk takes a toll,
ABC plays a meaningful role.
All our packies refuse
To sell teenagers booze.
Here's to Alcohol Beverage Control!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Evil spirits are gone — hip-hooray!
Exsufflation once more saves the day.
Are there devils about?
Priests need only breathe out;
Exhalation blows demons away.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Near the mountain range named Appalachia,
McCoys know that Hatfields will hachia.
And the Hatfields, as well,
Know they're damned straight to Hell
By McCoys, 'cause it's just in their nachia.

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
In her kitchen, Chef Jane often tinkers.
She makes friedcakes, like donuts (called sinkers).
Shaped in rings, twists, or strips,
They do widen her hips.
So she's bought some tight girdles, as shrinkers.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Bittersweetly, my pleasure was met
With a tinge of both pain and regret.
With the good came the bad.
I felt happy and sad
When I won playing Russian roulette.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Forbidden fruit! Does that term ring a bell?
Serpent's ruse worked out ever so well.
Because Eve ate the apple
We all have to grapple
With pain, death, and going to Hell.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
You're intelligent, pleasant, and gentle;
Your talents are not incidental.
You deserve to be praised,
So don't be amazed
To receive these remarks complimental.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Maps show ethnic or vote distribution,
Or range or effects of pollution.
I use choropleth maps
In polemics, as traps
Created with deft execution.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
I once knew a corpsman named Sam,
Who had served as a medic in 'Nam.
Any guy who got shot,
If he liked it or not,
Would be given a rectal exam.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Though Joe by the circus was hired,
Of his flying fear they'd become tired.
Now the cannonball king
Has just had his last fling—
And this time, he's really been fired.

limerick_list.author: Cuttlefish
Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A cadaver thief's put on the spot
In a graveyard, about to be shot,
When he points to the stones
(Which say Marx) and intones,
"I've uncovered a communist plot!"

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
An ill-mannered suitor named Hunt
Wooed a girl, but was overly blunt.
He asked her to shack up,
But that got her back up:
It took her aback, this affront.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
When Albula (or bonefish) scales shimmer
And a breeze sets the water a-glimmer,
In the mangrove lagoons
They hide out from raccoons
And the equally hungry black skimmer.

limerick_list.author: Basingstoke
limerick_list.text:
Acceptilation lets debtors go free
Without any payment or fee.
With no obligation,
This debt cancellation
Will certainly fill them with glee.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Although small, it is not something minor;
The qualified wiring designer
Will certainly bush:
Put in place, with a push,
A good bushing to serve as a liner.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
For the most part, I'm not very brave,
But I entered the cavernous cave.
So when bats flew right past
In that cavern so vast,
I thought I'd explored my own grave.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
When you bushwhack, you pounce on your prey,
From a spot where you're hidden away.
I hear folks think it's funny—
I bushwhacked a bunny
That hopped me unconscious that day.

limerick_list.author: Virge
limerick_list.text:
Adjectival brands words that will do
As an adjective. Hey! It's one too!
An infrequently heard
Autological word...
But surely that's something you knew.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"The Bible, in Christian ontology,
Tells God's plan and reveals its chronology."
"There's no plan," says my wife.
"There's no purpose to life."
Her outlook's called dysteleology.

limerick_list.author: Ulfras
limerick_list.text:
You need rainfall the most when there's drought,
And certitude most when in doubt.
If your car's on the rack
You can bet that your ac-
cident insurance just now ran out.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It's a cognitive kind of devotion:
A concept, idea, or notion.
I'm in love with the thought
Of this guy, while I ought
To adore him, what's more, with emotion.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
In outlets, the current flows out.
But receptacles receive — not in doubt.
My semantical gripe?
The electrical type
Seems a lie; how did that come about?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"When you land, chock the wheels," yelled McBane,
"To ensure that your plane will remain.
Skip this step and I say
If your plane rolls away,
You'll have no frickin' right to complain."

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
Willem Kolff showed that dialyzation
Could replace failing renal filtration;
And he did it, what's more,
In the thick of the war,
While resisting the Reich's occupation.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
I've got coins in my pockets, so jingly,
And I love them in bunches and singly.
I like to canoodle
Big bundles of boodle,
And credit cards make me go tingly.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Becky banged in the side of my car
'Cause she thinks she's a ram—how bizarre!
I thought, "What should I do?"
Then she purred, "I love ewe."
(I'll put up with this only so far!)

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Mum's a cow who enjoyed a good yak.
Daddy left her and never looked back,
Like a wild bovid hobo.
But their son, a young dsobo,
Cannot follow, alas, in his track.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
Ruchiccio's sent you an e-card!
To view, press the link that reads "see card".
Canned music you'll hear
As the graphics appear—
Not the greatest, but hey, it's a free card.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In Las Vegas, my date was exclaiming,
"Playing poker takes skill, so it's gaming!
I'm not gambling like lots
Of those jerks at the slots!"
It's a subtle distinction she's naming.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm flat broke and for help I entreat.
In my kitchen there's nothing to eat.
I've no money to feed
My old dad; we're in need,
So I beg and I plead in the street.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Some actors respond to direction,
But others display an objection.
"Look luvvy," they say,
"Let me do it my way;
Died last night, but tonight — resurrection!"

limerick_list.author: lopey
limerick_list.text:
The philosophy called analytic
Looks at language while being a critic.
What do the words mean
That appear on my screen?
It's a puzzle; my brain's too arthritic.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Seems that ethanal's found in your bread.
Massive doses can render you dead.
You've been drinking some booze?
From your liver 'twill ooze,
Then breed hangovers, make your face red.

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
Our heroine followed the route
Of the water-park's slippery chute
But her top got untied
And then washed down the slide.
Thus bare-breasted, our Sue followed suit.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It's so droughty, so dry, that no doubt
All our seedlings are failing to sprout.
Just forget your boy-scoutiness;
We're trounced by this droughtiness.
Hope the government bails us all out!

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
This warehousing bill is so high,
But I can't ship the goods yet — and why?
The advising bank said it:
"That letter of credit
Seems just to be pie in the sky."

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
My beautiful mirror reflects
With zero unwanted effects,
For there isn't a trace
Of a flaw on its face,
And it's neither concave nor convex.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The critic had seemed altruistic
Till I read his report, dysphemistic.
"This smearer of paint
Shows," he wrote, "no restraint."
(Momma tells me my work is artistic.)

limerick_list.author: Kevin Dopart
limerick_list.text:
There's a theater that poultry endorse
Showing "Heloise: Peter's Remorse."
All the tickets aren't cheap,
But the roosters won't peep,
Since the capons get cast rates, of course.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
We'll be famed as the new South Sea Bubble;
We're losing our cash at the double.
We're doomed at a hurry
To fret and to worry,
Abnormal loss means we're in trouble.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Having drawn all the strength he could muster,
He threatened a long filibuster;
The chairman replied,
"If you try it, you're fried,
And I do not appreciate bluster."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
At the cabstand the taxicabs wait
Like young girls at a dance, tempting fate;
But for taxis it's fine
'Cause the front of the line
Will be chosen—not so with a date!

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
From his coffin does Dracula climb.
He's arisen — it's blood-sucking time.
Metamorphosis done
Till return of the sun,
He's a bat about town in his prime.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
Enumerative combinatorics
Date back to the first prehistorics
Who counted; relations
Like sets' permutations
To them were part cult, part folklorics.

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
Cole Porter's famed song with those "D"s
 ("It's De-Lovely") had words just like these:
It's delightful… delectable;
So the meaning detectable
Is delitable in the reprise.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
Sweeney Phelps, dentist extraordinaire—
Let him care for your teeth if you dare!
With his drill and his pick,
They'll be kept span and spick,
But extraction's his game, so BEWARE!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My boyfriend just bought us a chess board,
But for me it's a major distress board.
When he bellows out: "Checkmate,"
My life is a wreck, mate.
I'll complain to the Dating Redress Board.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Cyclometry majors, take heart!
Some call studying circles an art.
With diploma in hand,
You'll be much in demand.
They need baggers at Bob's Liquor Mart.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
To the east, there's the foundland that's New.
Further west there is Brunswick, New too.
Nova Scotia's not my land,
Nor is Prince Edward Island,
Nor "and Labrador." (Did it! Woo-Hoo!!)

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
Diamagnets, upon application
Of a magnet that pulls, cause formation
Of an opposite force
To the magnet.  Of course,
If it's strong, then you'll see levitation.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Take a jellyfish, then take another,
Then two more, maybe sister and brother.
Keep it up and then soon
The whole beach will be strewn
With a group of these things, called a fluther.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Fo' shizzle? The term means "for sure."
Rapper slang has, for me, no allure.
In my 60s and white,
It just wouldn't seem right,
Plus I doubt it will ever endure.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The teacher repeated my name.
"Earth to Kevin" I heard as I came
Out of daydreaming.  "Sorry,"
I said.  I had starry-
Eyed visions of Mary to blame.

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
Joseph Lister was on the right track:
To extinguish the germs that attack
When removing a spleen,
It is best to be clean —
Even more so when putting it back.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Where cells have, as some part of their role,
An absorption-of-molecules goal,
Then the way that this goes is
By endocytosis.
The cells simply swallow them whole!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The vagina may harbor a threat.
Cytological study will let
Women know — cell collection
Aids cancer detection
With help from a cytopipette.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"Cacafuego! You great bag of wind!"
She exclaimed, but the blowhard just grinned:
"Your fine word, should you wonder, meant
'Flame from the fundament.'
I fart fire?" The lass looked chagrinned.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
When embryo transfer takes place,
You should see the big smile on her face.
If everything's well
She will soon start to swell,
And in nine months — a babe, by God's grace!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Electricity flows through your line,
And it changes direction—a sign
That your current's AC,
Which ensures your TV
Powers up and your light bulbs all shine.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Andrew Carnegie, steel captain, lacked
Not a thing in his charities backed.
And I'm sure his success
Made the chicks acquiesce.
It's a fact that all magnates attract.

limerick_list.author: John Wellington Wells
limerick_list.text:
A man who I knew from Verdun
Walked into a bar with a pun.
"Give me all of your bling,
Or I might have to sting
You." "With what?" And the joke was bee gun.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
A collegium's led by no boss,
So the voters may be at a loss,
For committees of equals
Get bogged down in sequels:
No boss means they don't give a toss.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Dr. Pavlov first let his dogs smell
Yummy food till saliva ran well,
Then a stimulus he
Paired with food, and then (see?)
Soon the drooling would follow the bell.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
A dramaturge never I'll be.
In English my grade's a low C.
No great Bard will emerge
From my play-writing urge,
So I'll write for Faux News on TV.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
The appliance that's known as a popper
Has a vessel for corn, like a hopper.
Oil's heated (or air)
To pop popcorn. Take care
To add butter and salt, to be proper.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The name Coca-Cola's well known
In each corner of Earth, it's been shown.
In fact, it's alleged
On that list this term's edged
By just one word and one word alone.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
The allure of colure he extols:
"Picture circles that cross at the poles:
Two lines, artificial,
Equinoctial, solstitial.
This will help with your sky-charting goals."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My handsome young dentist named Keith
Made an offer while fixing my teeth.
With my mouth packed and numb,
I agreed, "Yeth, I'll come
To thuh pardy and bring my thweet nieth."

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
Having whupped the Amalekites, Saul
Smashed up most of their swag — but not all.
"Spurn God's charge?" raged a Prophet.
"That's His throne. Get off it!":
Saul's Pyrrhic Amalekite brawl.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
God, my prayer's still unanswered.  My yen
Is to date gals who rate a strong ten.
Let it be.  Make it so.
Work your magic.  Hello?
Are you there?  Can I get an amen?

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
The lack of a domical vault
Could be classed as a comical fault.
Look at Christchurch: the cloister
Leaves undergrads moister
From climate's untimely assault.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The strip Boondocks, by some, was construed
As just raves of one little black dude.
Huey Freeman explained
His life's views unrestrained,
Controversial, sharp-witted, and rude.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Neighbors needing supplies and our charity,
Sharpie altered storm's path and severity.
Would such baseless sillery
Have been spawned under Hillary?
Track the eye, and enjoy the hilarity.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Kinetics, if  chemical, tell
Us how long it will take till we smell—
Using noses as testers—
The products, like esters,
Once acid and booze are mixed well.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
This large-flowered vine is quite new;
Its name's quite a funny one, too,
As I'm sure you'll agree.
It is: butterfly pea.
(And those dots are p'rhaps butterfly poo.)

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Milking roughly can wound a cow's udder,
Then mastitis will make Bossy shudder.
Gently wash down each teat,
Salve with bag balm, repeat.
Soon she'll heal and glad feelings will flood 'er.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
In his eyes burns a fiery soul.
This effect (in his most tragic role)
Was to playgoers lost
When the lighting got crossed —
He was standing inside a black hole.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
You want Basque liberation? I'll pass, Una.
Your "Homeland and Freedom"? A farce, Una.
We won't all be better
By fighting for ETA,
So, fooey, Euskadi Ta Askatasuna.

limerick_list.author: Comicoffee
limerick_list.text:
I'm sorry to say I'm the burier
Of Jerry, my Kerry Blue terrier.
He's deep in the ground
Where he won't make a sound
'Cause he's dead from his head to his derrier.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
I aspire to a life somewhat bigger
Than waking up hungry: the trigger
That made me say "Yes!"
To a dude, I confess,
I don't love. Of his gold, I'm a digger!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The arachnid sits down right beside her
In hopes she'll allow him to guide her.
Will this slick cobweb weaver
Seduce and deceive her?
Who knows? He's a comb-footed spider!

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
He's a chain smoker—three packs a day.
Like a chimney he smokes, so they say.
He's addicted, that fellow,
With teeth splotchy yellow.
Share an office with him? Hell, no way!

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
I once asked of my publishing rep,
"Why is changing my name the next step?"
And he said, "We agree
We can live with 'J. E.',
But your ananym will be 'Tittep'."

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Diamond wedding (their second) means five-
and-seventy years! They arrive
With the same spouse they wed.
And, yes, this should be said —
Both the parties must still be alive.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn and John Wellington Wells
limerick_list.text:
Atlantis sank under the sea,
But I've just staked a claim by decree.
With delusions of grand-
eur, I've annexed that land:
To discover it, pay me a fee.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
When dissenters and RCs hold hands
With, say, Anglicans from many lands,
Then ecumenism rules,
(And unites stubborn fools):
This each church leader p'raps understands.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
All summer, young Kate would berate
Her own self: "It's these freckles I hate!
I'm so light complected
I just feel rejected.
With this face, who'd want me for a date?"

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
On Broadway, the lights hang from battens;
In bars, too much alcohol flattens.
In London, a bar
Is where instruments are,
And a pub's where you look for Manhattans.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Our forested neighborhood park
Can at times become misty and dark.
These caliginous days
Bring a sort of a haze
In which contrasts are vague and not stark.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Our consulting firm's favoured solution,
To address market share diminution,
Is my instant removal.
I fear Board approval
And indecently swift execution.

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
I've been on a fortnight-long bender
In bars full of opulent splendour:
Pints of beer, rows of shots,
Case of wine, champagne—lots.
Now my head feels all fuzzy and tender.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
With a feint I have made me acquaint;
It turns into a foin sans restraint.
But he parries that thrust,
Knocks my sword to the dust,
And withal pinks my doublet. I faint.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Here's my grouse: it's those birds I hear daily
In the Highlands in spring — capercaillie.
There's a loud mating flock
(Which is known as a "tok")
Where the cocks like to lek (show off, malely).

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I'm in pain every month without fail,
And I'm leaving a bloody red trail;
I just don't wanna see ya
With dysmenorrhœia.
Next week you can get some more tail.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
There is yoga for doggies, I swear—
Caught a canine-filled class on the air;
Watched the owners and pets
Stretch and pose in their sweats—
Cosmic moolah they must have to spare.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
To bash your wife's wrong, yes? Er, no,
According at least to James Vaux.
To wit, his reflection:
"It's just for correction..."
(Vaux's blowen knows Vaux's pose is faux).

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
What a brash and self-confident bragger!
A big talker, he walks with a swagger.
His cumbersome ego
Leaves no room, so we go—
Such cockiness figures to stagger.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Some parsley had garnished my plate.
Such embellishment doesn't create
An enhanced taste sensation.
It's just decoration.
I pushed it aside and I ate.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Your noodle, I think you have rocks in.
This test tube is filled with a toxin
Called curarine—power
To kill, in an hour,
Six bulls, twenty calves, and two oxen.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My spitz gets a case of the fits
When his canine hysteria hits.
He has spasms, convulsions,
And sudden compulsions
To roll in his Kibbles 'n Bits.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Dressed in black, there was clearly no doubt
That the doomsman would not muck about.
Deadly serious, he
Passed his judgment on me:
"Stee-rike three!" he asserted. "Yer out!"

limerick_list.author: Egbert
limerick_list.text:
It's a chloroform pad, for chrissakes!
Lets a man do his worst — 'til she wakes.
Your glass of cold milk
Is just not of that ilk.
That's the difference, my friend, that it makes.

limerick_list.author: Quickbeam
limerick_list.text:
"I christen this ship C of E!"
Thus proclaimed Rowan Williams with glee;
Now he paddles around
Trying not to get drowned
On his archiepiscopal see.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
"You both left your command? Oh, for shame!
Who's at fault?" Fingers pointing the blame,
The guilty defectors'
Antiparallel vectors
Lined up, but they differed in aim.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I'm chagrined.  What I thought was a breeze
Has, in fact, caused me mental unease.
I was met with disgrace
'Cause I figured to ace
All my midterms, but got only D's.

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
Took a charter to France, at great cost;
And my will power quickly was lost.
Béchamel and Béarnaise —
Why, for seven whole days
I spent all of my time getting sauced.

limerick_list.author: PdeG
limerick_list.text:
On a barrow they cart him away,
But it's under the barrow he'll lay.
His white bones may be found
In his own grassy mound.
Rest in peace for a very long day.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
At times I'm so mad that I'm hopping.
My angriness sets my veins popping.
I moan and I curse,
With swear-words diverse,
But my wife does much worse: she goes shopping.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Acrocyanosis is when
I'm exposed to cold weather, and then
Toes and fingers turn blue
And start tingling too...
Oh my God! Now it's happened again!

limerick_list.author: Amergin
limerick_list.text:
Though the Dáil's Constitutional drafter,
Like Madison, Éamon ruled after —
Revolutionary President,
In our 'White House' twice resident,
Loved as leader, and hated as shafter.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Here's a medal for physicist Kevin,
Whose meddling mettle's in heaven.
That metal that glowed
In the dark was a load
Of actinium-227.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
Do you need a mechanical part?
Cyberneticists study the art
Of connecting your mind
To machines, so go find
One for cyborg-style legs, arms, and heart.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Ever think of the dressing you toss
(On a salad), or ice cream, or sauce?
They all use carrageenan
To thicken. It's keen, 'n'
It comes from a plant, Irish moss.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In billiards, four balklines divide
The full table—the spaces outside
Of the center are known
As the balks. They're the zones
Where restrictions on shots are applied.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Dandy Don was an exquisite, clearly.
He loved clothes (and his looking-glass) dearly.
When he said, "Who needs health?
My good looks are my wealth,"
You could tell that he meant it sincerely.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Since destroyed things are much to my liking,
In a firing range I am hiking.
Today it is Sunday;
"No shooting till Monday,"
They said, but is that a shell str—

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Dissociation, I'm sorry to say,
Is what Kathy insists on today.
She has made it quite clear
That she won't have me near:
"Just get lost! Take a hike! Go away!"

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
"What's your problem?" Vic grumbled and cursed
At his date as she daintily nursed
A small, warm glass of beer.
Sue responded in fear,
"It's adipsia — absence of thirst."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
With a woman you've made a connection,
And you're sensing a bedroom direction.
First things first.  Pay a call
To the store.  Above all,
It's important to buy some protection.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Flying Delta, I've been to Green Bay,
Santa Ana, Savannah, L.A.,
Also Austin, Liberia,
Boston, Nigeria,
Spain, Maine, Ukraine, and Taipei.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I traveled by donkey to bring
All my produce to market last spring,
But we ran out of luck
And were hit by a truck;
I came home with my ass in a sling.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Fifteen years, and today I got fired.
Cheaper labour? Yes, that's what they hired.
And so now I'll compete
In a shop down the street.
My buoyancy must be admired.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
I stare at the shelves in confusion,
Wond'ring why there is such a profusion
Of sizes and styles.
Choices litter the aisles.
Is the simple life just an illusion?

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
Bring the club; hold the mayo, but wait—
No tomatoes or greens; those I hate.
Oh, and keep the forsaken
Toast, chicken, and bacon;
Just serve me the toothpicks and plate.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
What's discoverable? That can be found
In the process of looking around—
In an organized search,
Or a glance from your perch.
Nature's gifts, although hidden, abound.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Though I'm supine, I'm not acting lazily.
I'm adverbializing, like, crazily,
Turning all parts of speech
Into adverbs. Please reach
Sloe gin fizzward; I'll rise upsidaisily.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Though cucumber sarnies are posh,
Much less so the pumpkin and squash.
While marrows are edible,
Some are incredible
Decorative gourds — oh my gosh!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A djereed's a blunt javelin used
To keep army troops fit and amused.
With this spear, when you're hot,
You are hot; when you're not,
You are not. (Do not get them confused.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
He swings by his tail from a tree—
The monkey who's known as titi.
He is called callicebus;
T T? That's his rebus.
For a lifetime he'll mate with his she.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The blogosphere's surely a blessing—
The world a mixed bag, coalescing.
One hemisphere shows
Our democracy's foes,
While the next?  Pretty ladies undressing.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Remember that favor you owe—
When your palms were well greased with my dough?
Well, I'm here to collect
On your word.  Don't neglect
Tit for tat.  I expect quid pro quo.

limerick_list.author: C. H. Carpenter
limerick_list.text:
I assumed an aggressive new stance
When my pal asked my date, "Shall we dance?"
I bristled with rage.
How dare he upstage
My clumsy first stabs at romance!

limerick_list.author: WordWeaver
limerick_list.text:
A dhampir has a pedigree dire:
Mortal mom and a vampire sire.
If a villager dies
And then tries to arise,
Call this vampire-killer-for-hire.

limerick_list.author: rusty
Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Debts of honour aren't settled in court.
That's morality's province. In short,
Being honest and true
Guarantees "IOU"
To a settlement's closure is brought.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
A gossip reporter named Amos
Was often so lame he'd inflame us.
Blind items he printed
Unhelpfully hinted
That someone unnamed was unfamous.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As I've not kept up payments, God knows,
On my mortgage, I'm led to suppose
That neglect has a cost:
Yes, my house may be lost
If the bankers decide to foreclose.

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
Amadelphous is, per Dr. Deming,
Women sewing in bees, deftly hemming,
Or the folk of a tribe.
It can also describe
Lemming loyally following lemming.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Your belittling words break my heart.
You tell me I'm not very smart.
You make me feel small
With, "You're no use at all!"
You've got scornfulness down to an art.

limerick_list.author: Carlos M and Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
To avoid using words in excess,
We will often find ways to say less.
For example, he has
Or he is shortens as
Simply he's with apostrophe S.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
Here's a tale a true golfer might tell:
"A long hike in the country is hell,
But when faced by such toil,
I would never recoil
If my golf clubs were coming as well."

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
In Brooklyn, I played da celesta,
And I soitenly musta impresseda.
Dat heavenly sound
From da keyboard's renowned.
(An' dose dexterous fingers undresseda.)

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
I am Meg.  I'm the world's cutest pup.
My worldview is happy and up.
My tail wags like crazy,
I sleep when I'm lazy,
And if offered a bone, I say "Yup!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Chapter seven created the sense
Of anxiety—swift and intense.
Never boring or pale
Is this cliff-hanging tale;
It is thrilling and filled with suspense.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Tom, Jeff, Eric, and one other fella
Are the band that they call Cinderella.
With a definite flair
For Night Songs and big hair,
They fall under the "glam rock" umbrella.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Ferrous water imparts a foul flavor,
So if that's what you're offered, don't waver.
Chalybeate springs are, of course,
An "iron water" source,
With a taste that few drinkers would favor.

limerick_list.author: Colin Salter
limerick_list.text:
Gliding high above snow-covered trees,
Swaying gently, like sails in a breeze ...
On this chairlift, our skis
Weigh a lot on our knees,
And our chins are beginning to freeze.

limerick_list.author: Jantine Bootsman
limerick_list.text:
When you're out manufacturing glue
Or plastics or paint-thinner, you
Need buckets of this.
Yes, acetol's bliss—
Oh, and perfect for cleaning stuff too.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
So it's Christmas, and what have I done?
Not completed my card list, for one,
Or bought tinsel, or food,
Or some gifts for my brood...
I could get away clean if I run.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
At my age, young man, snoozing's sensible;
My afternoon nap's indispensable.
But if nurse suggests bed,
I may yet raise my head
And say something a tad reprehensible.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Took no time — made a hasty decision!
Now our child could receive much derision.
Do, please, tell me you've not
Rashly registered Spot
As our baby's name. That needs revision.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
On a road trip, our Dad knew that when
We would reach for the tape deck and then
Put in ours, he should scramble
For gentle Glen Campbell:
The right tone's a cowboy, for men.

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
'Twas in London, eighteen twenty-eight,
Robert Peel had the mind to create
Metropolitan Police,
Noble keepers of peace:
Yes, the bobbies, who stand tall and straight.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
In utero, nourished and warm,
Each branchial arch can transform.
In a fish, it fulfills
Its destiny: gills.
In a human, that isn't the norm.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I perform acrobatics on high.
Loop the loop through the air, how I fly!
With the greatest of ease,
I can do as I please
On the rope and trapeze—even die.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Fifth of May found Sy's spouse very miffed.
She had pressed for a holiday gift.
Then a mink-oh from Sy-oh
On Cinco de Mayo
Brought wifey a fur bidden lift.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
There are liquids for waking me up.
There are liquids I sip when I sup.
When my stomach has troubles,
I drown them in bubbles—
That's 7-Up fizz in my cup.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Through the water cnidarians wend
Using organelles—arms that extend
From their mouths, in a ring,
And deliver a sting.
What is safe? Their abactinal end!

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
In Cardinal Richelieu one sees,
With church and state, someone at ease;
Père Joseph, a friar
Who wore grey attire,
Was known as his éminence grise.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The trouble with things bureaucratic
Is how one encounters a static
Response to requests:
A reliable test's
When the refund you're owed is dramatic.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
If a person's away with the birds,
It is likely he's one of those nerds
Who, as some tend to feel,
Live a life quite surreal.
(Please forgive me my blunt unkind words.)

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
My teacher, she wasn't impressed.
I got everything wrong on the test.
Yeah, I flunked the exam
Cuz I am what I am.
I'm a lazy-ass jerk, so I guessed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It is true that I hadn't a clue
Why McHugh was lethargic and blue.
He was feverish, too;
My anxiety grew
Till I learned he'd come down with the flu.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Like Aeneas, I strew purple blooms
And sweet lilies, by handsful, on tombs.
A perp dashes past,
Then police. In a blast,
My bouquets are disperpled by zooms.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle and Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
South Dakota's a state where coyote
Catch many a hare by the throat-ee.
Mount Rushmore's a sight,
The Black Hills a delight,
And its plains are worth many a photie.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In our workshops, some critics are stressing
Arcana, instead of finessing.
When you're working on mine
Stay inside of the line
Twixt BSing and WSing.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Guess the chances that I ever shall
Date that eye-popping beautiful gal,
And share some real fun,
Are ten thousand to one.
I sure wish I could make her my pal.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
If two parts of your mouth are held near
As you phonate, the sound that you hear
Is no vowel, but its kin—
Half a beat lies therein;
Your approximant lands on my ear.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
"These old maps are completely outdated.
Look, Virginia is grossly inflated!
The folks in the west
Thought the Union was best.
They split off!  They split off!", Tom restated.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Europeanize every last native!"
The reason? They're too procreative:
"It's that day-and-night screwing
That impedes wealth-accruing!"
The economist's words were probative.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Bert was hurt in last Thursday's insurgency.
We transported the victim with urgency
To the casualty ward.
No, he wasn't ignored
By the ward that is labelled emergency.

limerick_list.author: Bob Colonna
limerick_list.text:
Theda Bara was known as "The Vamp,"
Which was silent-screen lingo for "tramp."
She leered and she wriggled,
She shook and she jiggled,
Till cinema seats were quite damp.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In Chicago, there once was a school
Of construction.  With steel, as a rule,
Used to build structures high,
They invented the sky-
scraper. Thirteen floors? Man, that was cool!

limerick_list.author: SusanL and Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
Chim chiminey, life sure looks grand
For us sweeps, glancing over the land
From the rooftops up high,
Like black crows in the sky;
We are crocky, a soot-covered band.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
This fimbriate charge on my shield
Is a cross (blue) upon a green field.
The cross's white border
Keeps them nicely in order
And easy to see.  Do you yield?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My friend Smitty's our new music critic.
His approach is intense, analytic,
And his prose is seductive,
But he's always constructive,
And his wit—for a Brit—not acidic.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Is this visit to borrow some fire,
Or to set, which would match my desire?
If it's briefly you're here,
I'll remain in good cheer,
Be it flour or fire you'd acquire.

limerick_list.author: Morimando
limerick_list.text:
I can't help it, I must disagree
With the way that you treat her! 'Cause she
Is a beauty and I
Will protect her. So bye
And away with you, brute — leave her be!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When I'm making up poetry, fashion'll
Often govern the form, although passion'll
Take over my pen;
So I've got to quit when
What I'm writing becomes antirational.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Consider this trematode worm.
What? His cirrhus is showing? I'm firm!
I'll accuse him by name:
"James, for shame! You're to blame!
Your indecent display makes me squirm!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Say it "FIRST-string" or say it "first-STRING,"
They're the tops, and each player's a king.
If the first string they're in,
Most games they begin,
And they're known from New York to Beijing.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
If blue angels and devils now leap
Through blue heavens and over blue sheep,
And the sedative you
Took sedately was blue,
Amobarbital's sent you to sleep.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Exanthema's best treatment's Mom's theme:
"While some rashes take anti-itch cream,
Antihistamines ease
Widespread rash (swallow, please),
Such as yours, from disease. They're supreme."

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
In the contest to make the best chilli,
The loser's forgetful old Billy.
No frijoles — this means
There's an absence of beans.
Poor Billy; he really feels silly.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
"Yes, sir, officer (hic) it is true
That I'm drunk, but my dear man in blue,
I am pleading the fifth,
And the pint that it's with,
Not be poured on the ground—I'm not through."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Are you sure that this thing is a bedpan?
I have used it all day as a bread pan!
'This fresh bread really rocks!'
Said the Greek god of flocks
When he ate some," said Tom, in full deadpan.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
To crochet, all you need is a hook
And some yarn, and then maybe a book
That will indicate which
Place and manner to stitch,
With a picture of how it should look.
