limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
A conveyancer: someone whose deeds
Will fulfil all one's property needs.
Whether buying or selling,
He'll transfer your dwelling
In a language no layperson reads.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
When you're baiting a colleague for larks,
Take care with astringent remarks:
The danger at work
Is resentment can lurk
And the minnows will turn into sharks.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
My hard drive has just called it quits,
And its innards are now on the fritz.
So I'll stuff some C-4
In the CD-ROM drawer
And I'll blow that computer to bits.

limerick_list.author: FunkyTuba
limerick_list.text:
A brown mare trotted up and said, "You
Are a blacksmith. Can you fix my shoe?"
I had nothing to ask,
So I bent to the task.
All was well till she thanked me with "Moo."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
No excuses — you're plastered, don't lie again.
We're all sick of you saying you'll try again.
If you fail to dry out,
I'm beginning to doubt
That we'll care enough even to cry again.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
My bed's an old door set on blocks
With a mattress stuffed firmly with flocks —
Fiber tufts, even trash
From the mill. Hides my cash,
And it's better than blankets on rocks.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
A cove called a gloak or a gill
Is a bloke with particular skill.
So, a toby-gill robs
And a cutting-gloak's job's
Good for folk with an edge for a kill.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
After criminal action at night,
Comes a curfew, imposed, wrong or right.
Now the city goes still
'Neath this law-enforced chill.
Life resumes with the dawn's early light.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
It's a weasel that looks like a bear,
With gorgeous, thick, frost-shedding hair.
It's the glutton — I mean
The big mean wolverine.
Gulo gulo is gorging. Beware!

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Kids like me were so easy to please.
Food was fun in a world more at ease.
Mashed potatoes were hills;
Gravy: seas fraught with spills.
Peas were balls, sprigs of broccoli, trees.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
Long ago, when I visited Florence,
The rain fell in buckets and torrents—
A flood so complete
It submerged every street,
As we watched in dismay and abhorrence.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
The book is devoid of a plot;
As for structure and theme, it's got squat.
And reviewers all claim
Every chapter's the same —
But his name means that sales are red hot.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Miranda, who lives in Uganda,
Grows rubber plants known as ecanda.
Production's near nil
From the tubers, but still
They look cute on her north-east veranda.

limerick_list.author: OldFitzer
limerick_list.text:
They asked me to write a blockbuster
With the widest appeal I could muster.
But my muse was on strike
So I said, "Take a hike,"
To my publishers, Lacken 'n' Luster.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
When "A View to a Kill" hit the top
Of the singles charts labelled as Pop,
'Twas the only Bond theme
To have reached that extreme.
It was clearly the cream of the crop.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
It's as plain as the nose on your face:
You'll need crew cabs, with oodles of space.
With these pickups—extended,
Versatility's splendid.
A contractor's got to keep pace.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
My client exemplifies why
You should show him some mercy. This guy
Was a model to all
Whom he met, till last fall
When he hijacked that plane. (He was high.)

limerick_list.author: equinox
limerick_list.text:
A languid and gloomy romantic
Wished to learn what it meant to be frantic.
He procured from some thugs
A consignment of drugs,
Whose effects made him quite corybantic.

limerick_list.author: Will Lowry
limerick_list.text:
In a shop in south England I strayed
And suddenly found myself sprayed.
Once-liquid perfume
Had soon filled up the room—
Atomisers in tandem air raid.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
Paddy's sister, the fragrant Fionnula
Slices ice into cubes with a ruler.
Not alone among Phelps,
She believes neatness helps
To ensure that her gin will be cooler.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Steve eagerly ran to the kitchen.
Full of vigor, he said: "Let me pitch in."
But when leftover food was
All eaten, his mood was
Less helpful. He loitered there, bitchin'.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
A digital nomad, that's me—
I'm a mess, barely dressed—and I'm free.
Life's a working vacation;
Wi-Fi flies from taxation.
Seeking know-how online? Pay my fee.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Hey babe, help me out with a study;
My knowledge of women is cruddy.
This experimenter's new,
And my lab rat is you,
To be trained as my hot bosom buddy.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Yes, I wanted to get to first base;
My behavior was such a disgrace.
Your reaction was devitable —
Wasn't inevitable,
Throwing a pie in my face.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
To glint or to suddenly glare,
Intermittently flicker or flare,
Or to open one's clothes
As to boldly expose
That one's body is otherwise bare.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
As a paid debauchee, Miss Michelle
Would attend to elite clientele.
Every man was assured
She'd divulge not a word:
They were all "clien-no-tell" as well.

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
ReMARKable Mark FIGHTS 4 YOU
'Cause a fight for your aid's overdue.
As the Liberal Chief Whip
His demands never dip,
But his FIGHTS are embraced by his crew.

limerick_list.author: bestswanbird
limerick_list.text:
This benign paroxysmal condition
Is vertigo—call a clinician.
You're dizzy and ill,
But it helps to lie still,
Since it's influenced by your position.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A waiter in China, Pu Lee,
Now awaits by his postbox with three
Little letters to mail,
But he's destined to fail,
Since Pu Lee's missed the postman, you see.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
At a hurricane's centre, the eye
Is quite calm, free of wind, clear of sky.
But close by, the eye wall
Band of clouds holds a squall,
Heavy rain, fiercest winds; danger's high.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
My decimal keeps on repeating
Its digits while meeting and greeting
Its smaller divisions
Of 1—those incisions
Keep shrinking but aren't self-defeating.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
Sometimes women give birth when they're old.
Sixty-seven's the record, I'm told.
Why they do it, I wonder.
'Twould tear me asunder.
So childbearing seniors? Not sold!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If one acts like a bonehead, one may
Behave just like a jerk: one may say
Things that injure, embarrass,
Disparage, or harass,
In a rock-headed, blockheaded way.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In Montgomery County, the council
Is pulling its weight—every ounce'll
Be used to enact
Legislation we've lacked
To eradicate weeds like the groundsel.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My bedroom set (oak) wuz too plain,
So's I hired dis Danish guy, Blaine,
To go tinge it all red.
"Yer a moron," he said.
He distained it, dis Dane, wid disdain.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm writing a graduate thesis
On techniques for a celiocentesis.
I will drain, without gravity,
The abdominal cavity,
Using powers of psychokinesis.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
"My stocks are all traveling south,"
Said a frustrated trader named Routh.
"I'm bled white by my broker,
This joker, Bram Stoker,
And I'm feeling real down in the mouth."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
A note that is off just a cent
Arouses in me discontent.
.01 of a half
Tone is nothing to laugh
At; to me it's a tragic event.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Last night, growing weary and sleepy,
I chanced to look up at Praesepe.
Though the Cradle's a cluster
With ancient Greek luster,
A Beehive with Cancer is creepy.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
The senator fired all his pages;
Well he tried, but his ways were ambagious.
He was too indirect
So they didn't suspect—
Some believed that he'd raised all their wages.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I took cackleberries out of the carton,
Boiled, and peeled 'em.  Egg salad I'm startin'
With mayo and relish.
It's swell, but what's hellish?
The smells that come later from fartin'.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
That asylum my neighbor abuts
Has a staff with no shortage of guts.
D'you believe it??? What nerve!
All the coffee they serve
To their inmates is chock-full of nuts.

limerick_list.author: Beverley Sharp
limerick_list.text:
Crafting limericks takes cogitation
(That means "thinking") and metric frustration.
To get out of this jam,
I think, therefore, iamb!
Won't these anapests take a vacation?

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
The waiter made quite an assumption.
I think it was quite a presumption.
It's just as I'd feared:
My plate has been cleared.
He sure had a whole lot of gumption!

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
This old word for destroy seems like hooey.
How to say it destroys me: "des-TRUE-ee"?
Might it be "des-true-EYE"?
(And if so, baby, why?)
Or is it "des-TRWEE"? Dunno. Phooey.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
When finishing up at the chapel,
Michaelangelo surely did grapple
With one last detail,
Without which he'd fail:
Pertaining to Eve and the apple.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
Half awake, I first whimpered, then cried:
"What a headache! I wished I had died!
I had far too much gin!"
But I then heard the din
From the pub, yelling "Come back inside!"

limerick_list.author: VERaLOE
limerick_list.text:
Cyberbullying: that's when one gets
(Through the internet) slurs and/or threats.
Such as, "Rotten gay guy!
You should curl up and die!"
The receiver it surely upsets.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
All the Russians who live in Rostov
Eye an anthracite statue and scoff.
It's a piece of fine art,
But the mayor is smart,
So he's hauling the coal thing right off.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Many envelope stuffers are in
With my statements each month.  It's a sin
That the folks at the billers
Include mucho fillers.
These ads just get tossed in the bin.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
For years cops had searched for McWhorter,
And it seems they have finally caught her.
Charged with blackmail, Mac was,
But, on bail, fled the fuzz.
She is now a convicted extorter.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
Said the cut-throat, 'A cloak is no cape;
It's enfolding — a cape would just gape.
And it covers so well
It can smother the yell,
And its shadow can help you escape.'

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
You say chandlers made candles? Do tell!
They were once highly praised personnel?
Since this product's now made
By machine, I'm afraid
To this job we must bid a farewell.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
Sometimes UMD students who hurtle
To their tests pass a diamond-back turtle.
The bronze terrapin's nose,
Rubbed for luck, always glows,
To encourage young minds that are fertile.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
I am so disillusioned now, sonny.
Are you joking? I'm poor? It's not funny…
How can all this be real?
How could that nice man steal?
That crook, Bernie, made off with my money!

limerick_list.author: LMAK
limerick_list.text:
A nucleotide base potpourri
Is genetic diversity's key.
When chromosomes dance,
Genes shuffle by chance.
It's adaptive potential, set free.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Some will use a conventional grip;
Other bowlers place only the tip
Of each finger inside—
Such a grip will provide
The potential to give it more flip.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Ancient Egypt had sites full of tombs.
Abydos came first, one presumes,
With hundreds of mummies
(Some rolled on their tummies)
In dozens of underground rooms.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
I will make this thing work, if I'm able:
I will add a room onto my gable.
If it doesn't work out,
I will scream and I'll pout,
Then get back to the old drawing table.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There's a diner painstakingly staffed
With a crew who feel slang is a craft.
The thing I like most
Is two poached eggs on toast,
Which is Adam and Eve on a raft.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
From desolate, bare Patagonia
To the jungles of wild Amazonia,
The native reliever
Of high, spiking fever
Is cinchona bark, source of cinchonia.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
Find a doorknocker fixed to a door,
Perhaps four or five feet from the floor.
Now, by hand you may flap
The device. Hear the rap.
Then repeat polite thumps as before!

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Despite being quartered palatially,
MPs, when they vote, do it glacially.
Directions oppose
Of the ayes and the noes,
As they troop through the lobbies, bifacially.

limerick_list.author: otherwisefine
limerick_list.text:
In the writings of Babbage he mused
That he couldn't believe how confused
Are two folks who consult:
"Do right answers result
From machines when wrong figures are used?"

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Well-versed lexicographical glory!
I've both rhymed and defined flatty-gory:
"An honest man who
You (a cheat) plan to screw".
(Yes, that bang's self-congratulatory.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Watching babies (my kids were all droolers)
Made me think of evaporative coolers.
Now one's cooling our house
And a joy to my spouse,
And it's cheaper than gifts from the jeweler's.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I was slain by a knight who that day
Chopped my limbs off, a gory display.
To my widow, I'm told,
He gave silver and gold,
Saying, "Here—his disseverance pay."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
These bananas have reddish-brown rot,
And their leaves seem to wilt on the spot.
In the Celebes, plantain
Is far from enchantin'
When blood disease ruins the lot.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Want to speak to a friend on a trip
When the trip's taking place on a ship?
For a seaboard hello,
Dial 870—
Shore-to-ship will connect in a zip.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
Kitty woke to a sound in the night;
It grew louder and so did her fright.
So she snatched up her bat,
Swiftly sniffed out the rat,
And then clubbed him. Oh my! What a sight.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Got an overweight rocket? That's bad.
To help it lift off from the pad,
Add a booster or two—
When it streaks for the blue,
You can bet that makes astronauts glad.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
She stands quiet, aloft and aloof,
Both courageous and desperate for proof.
Behind peeling white rails,
She peers out for his sails
From the captain's walk crowning her roof.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
The presence of black scurf disease
On potato is sure to displease.
This complaint parasitic,
Although ectophytic
(External), demands expertise.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
To the chrysalis, Mummy said, "Kate,
Now sleep deeply, but don't wake too late,
Lest your time as a butterfly
Quickly should flutter by:
Pupate and then find a good mate."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I once owned a mini dispatch box,
No bigger than, say, a large matchbox.
Couldn't fit long dispatches,
Plus lacked locks and catches —
Worked great as a cockroach egg hatch box.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
In a musical spoof of the King,
The producers tweaked one little thing:
Conrad "Birdie," not "Twitty,"
Was considered more witty.
Those two rivals could both really sing.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A fixable stamp, when it tears,
Isn't broken beyond all repairs.
But when moistened and damp,
An affixable stamp
Can attach when I'm quite unawares.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
John passed on, as we'd feared all along.
And, with dark epicedian song,
We soon laid him to rest:
He'd been one of the best.
Then the memoirs… we'd read the bum wrong.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Tied a fly, it was late on the Sunday.
Caught a fish, that was early on Monday.
How'd I snag that big trout?
In my mind there's no doubt,
You should try that dry fly: cockabundy.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Our departure should cause you no dread:
The centumvirate rules in our stead.
The Crown's Hundred right hands
Guard the wealth of our lands.
Mind this mandate, else look to your head.

limerick_list.author: Brian Cairns
limerick_list.text:
As we traversed the desert, our jeep
Hit a pyramid, stony and steep.
Thus our progress was checked,
For our lorry was wrecked.
Our driver had fallen asleep!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
At this college, I've suffered frustration.
Now I'm taking a key examination
In my chemistry class.
It's a test I must pass;
If I don't, I'll be placed on probation.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
John's new bride's the best lover he's had,
But, as well, certifiably mad.
I have heard him bemoan,
"My predicament's known
As accepting the good with the bad."

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Dated concepts require eschewing —
In Victorian days, Geysir's spewing,
Twigged an Ulster distiller
To buy land 'round this thriller.
His idea: "Admission accruing".

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Mayor Wilson, we've heard that you're gay."
"I believe that we all must obey
What our hearts say is right.
No more questions. Good night."
(Well, he danced around that one, I'd say!)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A fine-featured fellow from France
Fell for Fifi (a floozie). Her glance
Made his fancy take flight,
But each fortnight they'd fight.
Could fair Fifi be faithful? Fat chance!

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
A dactyl's no hand nor a paw;
It's the terminal part of a claw,
Or a limb, that is jointed—
All angled and pointed.
If you hear one go click, just withdraw.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Mom and Dad say my boyfriend is hirable:
"At his labors, he's nearly untirable,
And his smile gets five stars.
It's a help selling cars.
As a salesman your guy is desirable."

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
You give me no pleasure, you louse!
I'm a malcontent petulant spouse.
My displacency shows —
Now it's anything goes.
I'm so troubled I'm trashing the house.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
When a spiffy new weapon of war
Was the flintlock, a fusilier corps
Was assigned this new gear.
Now the name is still here,
But they don't use those guns any more.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
I said to my grocer this morn,
"Rising prices have made me forlorn.
You're a pirate, old codger.
Hoist up Jolly Roger.
Buccaneer! You charge too much for corn."

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
I collect action figures—so what?
I've got Anakin, Jabba the Hut,
Han Solo, Darth Vader
And Leia (won't trade her—
The one that's dressed up like a slut!).

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Who cares if it's quarter to three
In the morning.  Ahypnia?  Me?
Sleepless nights now and then
Are compulsory when
You become the OEDILF EiC.

limerick_list.author: willupanek
limerick_list.text:
She resembled an A-frame in stature,
And scared him, for he had to catch her.
She went down the slide,
But her girth slowed her ride,
And the metal chute couldn't dispatch her.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Salt-and-vinegar crisps, by the packet;
Cheese-and-onion? My colleagues can't hack it
When I make a loud crunch
Masticating my lunch,
And the bag, which I scrunch, makes a racket.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
"Ah, fair damsel, thou seemest quiescent.
Are thy vigor and vim evanescent?
Pray divulge all thine ills—
Art thou green at the gills?"
"Are you daft? I'm a fish that's virescent."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A boomer's a wave no one rides,
Since the craziest surfer confides:
"Those huge bonecrushers can
Just devour you, man,
Leaving sea gulls to munch your insides!"

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
The Blazhko effect subtly mars
The pulsations of pulsating stars,
While the physicist's brain
That is tasked to explain
Suffers angst and emotional scars.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Be they king of the realm or some bumpkin,
A coach is a place you can dump kin
In horse-drawn sedans,
Nineteenth century vans
Made of wood or, in one case, a pumpkin.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I signed on as a pirate's apprentice,
But soon getting lost would torment us.
"You do not have a head
For the mapwork," they said.
"You're a clear case of non compass mentis."

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
It ignites with a bang and a flash.
Leaves a big cloud of smoke, but no ash.
It's been used to take pics,
And may people transfix
When in fireworks, brilliant and brash.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
While team batting was thought to be grave,
Their defense stirs the fans: "Do the wave!"
Their closer has fanned
Every foe in the land
Of the "D" and the home of the save.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
He was clipping along at a pace,
Moving on, with a smile on his face,
And I couldn't keep up
With that boy and his pup,
As they raced down the Cumberland Trace.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Though it's stringy and merrily yellery,
Sticklike and verily smellery,
There's more on the scenery:
All of this greenery
Ain't necessarily celery.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The state has agreed that deterrence
Is needed for countertransference.
They lock up a shrink
For the things that he'll think,
Which has helped to reduce its occurrence.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
I have cravings for gherkins, ice cream,
Macadamia nuts, and I seem
To have never enough.
I must be up the duff!
How I retch with this wretched regime.

limerick_list.author: OldFitzer
limerick_list.text:
Concurrency's tekkie talk for
Simultaneously processing more
Than just one application;
It gives us salvation
From simple batch systems of yore.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
Go ahead, do what you want to do.
Don't let my thoughts start biasing you.
 If I laugh with derision
 At your bad decision,
That course, still feel free to pursue.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
There are editors savage as bears,
So fierce that their workshopping scares;
My versified witticisms
Attract pungent criticisms—
But at least I can criticise theirs!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This Empire belonged to Egyptians.
Can you read their symbolic inscriptions?
These arcane hieroglyphics
Detail the specifics:
Its spread gave the ancients conniptions.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Said Bubba to Jim Bob, "Hey, hey! Be
More careful when touching my baby!
I've washed her and waxed her;
It's time ta make tracks ter
The auto show.  Come with me, JB."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It's the Yiddischer Comedy Club,
Where the kibitzers kvetch at each flub.
Stand-up comics? They're nuts!
Tonight's warm-up's a putz
And the headliner acts like a schlub.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The paternity test that I had
Made it clear I'm a two-timing cad.
The result may appear
In the papers, I fear.
(Will that make me a classified dad?)

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Use a crush spread when trading in soybeans
(Matters not if you hate or enjoy beans):
Concurrently buying
And selling, defying
The trends—a fine way to employ beans.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
With a tabula rasa I start
Out again, with a light, happy heart.
I was sent to the clinker,
My term was a stinker—
Ten years! Just for forging some art!

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
Why, you dolt, that's the annuals bed!
Take the deutzia back to the shed.
I said pansies in tubs,
Not hydrangea-like shrubs
That were named for a Dutchman long dead.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
As a gallowglass armed with my claymore,
I'm refusing to fight, maim or slay more
(A samurai Scot,
Here in Erin's my lot) —
Not unless and until chieftains pay more.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
Although you and your kids often feud,
Still, what have you gained when you've stewed?
Though it's good you're concerned,
It is time that you've learned
Not to brood 'bout your rude brood's crude mood.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Then I lectured my spouse, "That is that!
True, you've kicked out the grouse, deer and bat.
But with bison evicted,
It's as I predicted —
Our home's STILL full of antelope scat."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I play saxophone (after a fashion),
Though my work all the critics are trashin'.
Still they have to admire
That I play with great fire:
Intensity, vigor, and passion.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
When Chef Nathan prepares chiffonade,
He stacks greens, forms a tightly rolled wad,
Then cuts ribbon-like strips;
His sharp knife never slips
As he fashions this garnish.  Applaud!

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Charles Coulomb, French Engineers' Corps,
Invented and used—to explore
Unknown forces—a balance
That's torque-based. His talents
Set his flag for long at the fore.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
On the hunt in the bars of East Yonkers,
Drunken ladies Pete sweet-talks and conquers.
Says Pete, "What is grand
Is a hot one-night stand!"
He goes crazy with lust — he goes bonkers.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn and Nan
limerick_list.text:
It doesn't take much erudition
To know that entree, in addition
To Yes, I confess,
Is a way to express
A meaning implied by admission.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Let us strive for egality, brothers.
None shall have greater powers than others.
Those wishing to fight us
Are simply detritus—
We'll give a "fair shake" to these mothers!

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
Thought the geek plucked from telecom's dregs:
"Wow! This client has gorgiful legs.
All her signals are mixed,
But her box will get fixed,
Yes, descrambled (if only she begs)."

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
At our spa, there's a visit we hate:
When the State comes to check out the state
Of our rooms and our charts
And our food-service carts—
If they're all in compliance, it's great!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
To eat cheese is my present intent.
In my diet, it makes a big dent.
I choose French double creams;
Sweet and dreamlike each seems.
How much fat? At least 60%!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Loaves of bread, jugs of vino, and thou
Are the only things needed, I vow.
We will enter that place,
An abandoned disgrace,
And move in, if the ghosts will allow.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
In the court folks were forced to agree
That the land now belonged just to me.
The deforciant? Fined!
And the concord's now signed
So my use of that land's trouble free.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
She had driven her ducks, it was said,
To a mighty poor market instead
Of her marrying well.
She'd been living in hell
Till she butchered the bully in bed.

limerick_list.author: Nitelaf
limerick_list.text:
He'd get slapped by each woman he kissed,
And you'd think he'd have gotten the gist.
But his ways went unchanged
'Til the ladies arranged
For an order of cease and desist.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The service you offer is dental,
And you promise your staff will be gentle.
Your hygienist arrives
With her hooks and her knives—
And that teeth-cleaning sadist goes mental!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
His cornice complete, John called Mabel.
"Kane done with that damn corbel table?"
Said Mabel, Kane's mother,
"John, unlahk his brother
Kane cain't work alone — he ain't Abel!"

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
Four minutes' worth, here on the page,
Of silence, supplied by John Cage:
.
.
(Yes, sometimes it seems like an age.)

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
Your cantankerousness drives me insane!
All your ranting, again and again,
Just drives me berserk,
You insufferable jerk.
Why can't you write English, like, plain?

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
At a brewpub, supply is a snap.
You can locate the source with no map.
They have plenty of beer
'Cause they make it right here.
And they'll serve it to you from a tap.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I'M AWAY FROM MY DESK FOR THE DAY.
The boss put this sign up to say
That you'd best disappear.
Well, he's really still here
But won't see you — it's such a cliché!

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
There were days once when speed would be reckoned
By the characters copied per second
To a printer or screen—
That's the cps seen
Long ago ... then today's future beckoned.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
He was trained to be fearless, though dread
Floods his body at what lies ahead;
He will need to be brave,
But he fears, as a slave
Chained to oars, very soon he'll be dead.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Errol's instincts can verge on the feral,
Which is likely to land him in peril
With his current lass Pearl,
Who's one gem of a girl—
Though she's not a choice morsel like Beryl!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Uncle Gustav talked nature with ease,
Like the Latinate labels for trees:
"That's a beech," he'd say, "Fagus."
"Sure, whatever you say, Gus.
Let's move on to the birds and the bees."

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles
limerick_list.text:
Near the Black Sea, a tourist cried, "Eew!
Why, this river smells worse than a loo.
Johann Strauss notwithstanding,
It's truth I'm demanding.
The Danube is brownish—not blue!"

limerick_list.author: Mr E S
limerick_list.text:
My mother-in-law likes to quip.
By way of example, a trip:
If you take the long way,
She'll most certainly say
That you went there by way of Jipip.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
The contract discussions were dead.
To the bottlers, management said
In the tersest of phrases:
"We're not giving raises,
But just Pepsi COLA instead."

limerick_list.author: Rudi
limerick_list.text:
When Bill made the doctrine of Billiasm,
He changed the key thing about chiliasm:
"My praises I sing—
The thousand-year king
Won't be Jesus, but me, in this -iliasm."

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Prepositionally, agitation
Needs at in a subsequent station.
In the Bard's "fleer and scorn at,"
Or "grievously mourn at,"
It supplements loss or frustration.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
In a book shop, I'm stunned, brought to tears,
When a fabulous relic appears:
A pristine Ainsworth Psalter.
"However," I falter,
"Has it lasted these four hundred years?"

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Both our hearts beat like galloping hooves
Though we now live apart, and this proves
We're coseismal: our loci
Relate to deep foci
Where somewhere between, the earth moves.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I'm a fish with a most slimy skin, oh!
Fresh water is what I swim in, oh!
Do I taste second rate?
You can join the debate.
I'm a fallfish, a big suckin' minnow!

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
When the weather's too hot to wear hose,
In short shorts, her bare legs she'll expose.
Bareleggedly running,
Beachgoing and sunning,
She's ogled for shortage of clothes.

limerick_list.author: alkahuna
limerick_list.text:
"In my library job, I've a preference
For patrons who'll treat me with deference,"
A girl bibliothecal
Said. "Often, some geek'll
Check me out, although I'm in Reference."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
jojo
limerick_list.text:
Uncle Clarence climbed up on a wall,
Then got dizzy and suffered a fall.
Though he fell from aloft,
His landing was soft
'Cause Aunt Bea took the brunt of it all.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
On vacation, we learned the merengue,
But were bitten—infected with dengue.
Yes, mosquitoes transmit
This disease that won't quit.
From a bat, though, cows get derriengue.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"I'm ecstatic we closed this big deal.
Let's shake hands.  How the heck do you  feel?"
"Yes, this contract, in fact,
Is a lucrative pact!"
 Yeah, for me — not for you. What a steal!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Tonight there's a lunar eclipse.
The kids beg to stay up — postponed kips
Wouldn't hurt at a pinch,
But Dad won't give an inch:
"Past their bedtime!" He purses his lips.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere and Val
limerick_list.text:
I'm dead bored, but the snow is still blowing;
I'll change off from my knitting to sewing.
Either one's not much fun.
Oh, for days full of sun—
And lumbago from hoeing and mowing!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I'm afraid of my shadow; I hold
Onto worry and fear, and I fold.
Even harmless events
Make me nervous and tense.
It's a good thing my shadow is bold.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
It's not that without me he blows;
I've been trying to capture my nose.
Just Google on Gogol —
My mad to-and-fro' goal:
To follow wherever he goes.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"You're a globe-trotter, travel extensively,
Go first class, so you journey expensively.
You travel so widely,
Isn't life wasted idly?"
"I deny that," he countered defensively.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Meds are futile, and most should be banned;
Now your ailment is way out of hand.
Herbal magick can cure you,
It's true; I assure you,
As cunning folk well understand.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
When your home is on fire, just shout
For the firemen; they will, no doubt,
Seeing flames in your house,
Quickly firehose (douse)
Them with water, till all have gone out.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Though with 95 years he's been blessed,
Oscar Brand still sings folk songs with zest:
Patriotic or joyous,
For young girls and boyous
(Though I like the bawdy ones best).

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
In the days of the serf and the lord,
Did the justices ever get bored?
Rotulorum custodes
No doubt had their slow days
With not many crimes to record.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Dr. Casey? The interns all say she's
Not glamorous.  Far and away, she's
Got the homeliest face.
When describing a case
In her class, they don't look at her facies.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
With the mouthpiece and earpiece as one
(If today's high-tech cell phones you shun),
The French telephone serves,
And great credit deserves.
Something old, I'd say, under the sun.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Her diminutive size will appear
A surprise, if her voice you should hear.
A critique comes a cropper;
Short legs will not stop her —
"They both touch the ground, never fear!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Say a patient's harassing the staff
And is far too annoying by half,
Don't do anything rash
When you deal with this trash.
Call Code Zebra and have the last laugh.

limerick_list.author: Claire Miller
limerick_list.text:
"I'm pleased with my strong anal fin,"
Said a butterflyfish with a grin.
"That appendage below
Keeps me balanced, you know,
And it's great when I go for a spin."

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
House of Mirrors — the place that I'm at.
Anamorphic — the medium that,
With a mirror or lens,
Will elongate your friends
Or will make them appear short and fat.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A dogtrot's a quick easy gait,
Like a mutt on a stroll with its mate.
And it's also a breezeway
'Tween cabins, an easeway
That's roofed to keep sun off your pate.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
Now you might think that this is just bad o' me,
But for years I've been at this academy.
To study's to shirk,
So here I will lurk,
Since working will make something sad o' me.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes and Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
On a Cambrian-era vacation,
Biologists skip recreation.
They're earning their spurs
When explosion occurs
And all phyla commence radiation.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Dulcamara's a plant you don't eat
(It is meet that it's called bittersweet),
And in opera's the name
Of a quack of great fame—
Donizetti's agreeable cheat.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Buy in China? The firm's comprador
Is a guy you ought not to ignore,
As his role is creative.
He's an agent, and native,
So be sure to develop rapport.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Who is next on the Trump pardon list?
Charles Guiteau? John Wilkes Booth? Get the gist?
All their crimes are forgiven
By a man who is driven.
Al Capone? James Earl Ray? Who've we missed?

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Aberration that's stellar is daft
And confuses the star-watchers' craft:
When a star's in our sight,
Due to orbital flight
Its direction is shifted to aft!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The sides above deck on a ship
Are the bulwarks, which offer a grip
For the tipplers on board
Who are out of their gourd
On the rum that was stored for the trip.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle and Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
What's the top-selling pop? It's a Coke.
What's a rip-roaring quip? It's a joke.
So quickly, I beg:
What's the white of an egg?
It's albumen. (I bet you said yolk.)

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
To look like those models, I buy
All that stuff in those ads. I could die
Just to look like they do,
But I don't. Oh, boo hoo!
Yet I dream: I still buy, and I try.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
The highest cathedral (so pretty!)
You'll find in Amiens, fine French city.
One (later Saint) Martin
Here cleft his cloak, partin'
To clothe a cold beggar in pity.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A duad's a couple, a pair—
Man and wife. Should he have an affair,
No more duad; now three is
A triangle. He is
Unfair, and his wife must beware.

limerick_list.author: Mayra
limerick_list.text:
The equity market is fun
If you're careful to not be outdone.
If you're slow, costs are steep,
But I'm fast, so it's cheap.
That is what we call beating the gun.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Cephaloridine ain't a narcotic,
But a broad-spectrum antibiotic.
It works like a snap
For a case of the clap
And for maladies rare and exotic.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Psychoanalysts often confirm
Strange behaviour by using this term;
The ideas you suppress
May result in distress—
With a complex, you'll struggle and squirm.

limerick_list.author: johng
limerick_list.text:
Old acquaintance should not be forgot,
Especially if you are a Scot.
Auld lang syne, you may know,
Stands for "times long ago"
Whether sung by a Scotsman or not.

limerick_list.author: timon
Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
He's an afternoon farmer, it's clear:
Sleeping late, goofing off, drinking beer.
My judgment empirical?
It'll be a damn miracle
If crops on his farm should appear.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
We'll commiserate, feeling much sorrow,
At the commissary meeting tomorrow,
Since there's nothing to eat
For the Army's retreat
In defeat down Mount Kilimanjaro.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I'm pleased with our latest au pair.
Her demeanor's a breath of fresh air.
Before her, Miss Grumpy
Was peevish and frumpy.
Let's face it, she didn't compare.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
If an atom decays every second,
The amount of your sample is reckoned
A single becquerel,
And each immature cell
Should be wary of samples more fecund.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Abdullah ruled Jordan, a nation
That would lead an immense federation
Of Arabs. This plan
Died before it began
With the king's premature termination.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The term callithump means "a parade
Where, discordantly, noises are made"
With tin horns, for example;
The partying's ample.
It's, too, a burlesque serenade.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Cyclohexanol phthalate can soften
The hardest of plastics, but often
Its ultimate ending
Becomes gender-bending
As boys become baffled by boffin'.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
I turn right as I enter the plane.
All the hostesses sneer—what disdain
For us cattle class folk,
Huddled, hassled and broke.
Were I able to breathe, I'd complain!

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
Frying sunbathers (no longer peach)
Passed out naked then baked on the beach
'Cause no bottles of lotion
Were brought to the ocean.
(But bottles of schnapps? Within reach.)

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Eat your hearts out, you fools! This one's mine.
Just one look, then I must draw the line.
I'm a reprobate sinner,
But, then, I can slide in her:
My Bugatti. Back off there, you swine!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The CPI raise? It protects
His retirement, so Hector expects
It's his country's intention
To beef up his pension
And Social Security checks.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker and SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
After sit-ups my tum needs a rub
And a soak in a hot water tub—
Not quite to a boil—
And then wintergreen oil
Besmears all my aches to a stub.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Bremer
limerick_list.text:
I'm achier now that I'm done,
With a 26.2 mile run.
A marathon's price:
Lots of aspirin and ice.
And a wish that I had not begun.

limerick_list.author: Gravely
limerick_list.text:
Dear Suzanne, when I spoke of the thrill
I felt kissing you, Granny got ill.
Our connection was hidden;
This love is forbidden.
Constrainedly yours... Cousin Bill.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Re-reading a book by Bruce Schneier,
I must laugh, and my spirits grow higher.
Simple Alice sends Bob
Something Eve wants to rob,
So she codes what she sends through the wire.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Control variables? Constant — don't change!
Used in testing, these creatures are strange.
They're kept locked in a box
While the rest of the flock's
Permitted to roam in a range.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I have chickens and geese everywhere,
So with fowl every room I must share.
Though they run through the darn lot
That's known as my barn lot,
Their eggs are so good, I don't care.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
There is nothing at all I won't do
To exhibit my fervor for you.
As I pledged from the start,
I'll now give you my heart.
Ho boy — does that smart! Fond adieu.

limerick_list.author: BobfromThirsk
limerick_list.text:
She is loud like an unruly youth
With her language, both coarse and uncouth.
There's more yap from her gob
Than a whole bloody mob.
She's a bell hung on every tooth.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
In a silvery-tinctured facade
On a shield or a piece for your cod,
I'd bet argent's at play;
Even more so, I'd say,
With a moth-eaten Zombie named Rod.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My new Range Rover bucks in and out
Of the potholes and ruts on my route.
It's too bumpy a ride
Since the shocks don't provide
What (with pride!) those commercials all tout.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret and Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
An acquittal implies we acquit,
Though another noun once was legit.
I doubt OJ'd have walked
If Cochran had squawked,
"Vote acquitment: the glove doesn't fit!"

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
Though I seem to be laid back and chilled,
When I look at the poster I'm thrilled.
There's my name in the cast;
I've achieved fame at last —
It's as "Cow (the back end)" I am billed.

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
An astable multivibrator:
A basic and fun oscillator.
Whichever its state,
It's the state it will hate,
Always thinking the other is greater.

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
Achtung! Alles Lookens und Peepers
Muss Fingers und Mittens off keepers!
Computermachine
Musst nicht touchen, just seen!
Watch the Blinkenlights, hearen the Beepers.

limerick_list.author: Kirk Zurell
limerick_list.text:
The flowers are blooming in May.
But so does leaf mould, in its way.
And a tanker truck leaks;
That spill blooms in the creeks.
It's bloomin' depressing, I'd say.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Two innkeeper-artists emblazon
Faux-heraldic designs, here at Days Inn,
On our walls — best of all,
What a herald might call
"Purpure puppy relievin', leg raisin'."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Anaclitic describes Virge and me.
His programming skills are the key
To our website's success,
I am quick to confess.
Without him, just where would we be?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
As a chef, I work hard for my pay.
Before noon, I set out the buffet—
Twenty dishes (that's lots!)—
Then scrubbed thirty-eight pots.
That's enough; I should call it a day.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
The teacher was calling the roll:
"Allen." "Here!" "Davis." "Here." "Mr. Dole?"
"Over here." "Miss Labeau?"
"She's out sick." "Sanchez." "Yo!"
"Scott." "That's me." "Miss Smith." "Here, Mrs. Stoll."

limerick_list.author: eris8x6
limerick_list.text:
A convict of manner audacious
Escaped, but a trail alliaceous
Allowed a good hound
To run him to ground
(Eating shallots, he'd been too voracious).

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
The coffeehouse, fabled in story,
From Turkey to England, claims glory
As a place folks could meet
To drink coffee and eat
And hatch plots (thought King Charles) that were gory.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
They go bolving (that's belling) for deer
On Exmoor. The contest is clear:
People holler and roar,
But what price their high score
If a stag butts them hard in the rear?

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
Near the base of Dakota's Black Hills
There's a spot where those cold winter chills
Can be kept well at bay.
A "banana belt."  Hey—
If it's warmth that you crave, this place thrills!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
To a soldier named Greg from L.A.,
I had gotten engaged late last May.
But then I, learning Greg
Had a peg for a leg,
Broke it off  by the end of the day.

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
Emprosthotonos marks a disease
In which muscles contract.  So, your knees
Or your feet meet your head
In a spasm.  What dread
If in such position you'd freeze!

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
When dad's back ached (which caused him to grouse),
Embrocation my mother would douse
And rub in. It eased pain
But we all felt the strain
Through his moans—and the pong in the house!

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
All these jabbering blabbermouths, deans
Of trouble and spilling of beans—
They just can't shut their traps
And they often, perhaps,
Must take heat for some really bad scenes.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A convenience that Hank highly ranks:
Drive-up windows in neighborhood banks.
It's less trouble by far
To remain in his car
While the teller gives service and thanks.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
A biaryl has two aryl groups,
And the aryls have resonant loops.
Her motif goes beyond
What makes pharmacists fond,
For she'll conquer the rest when she stoops.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Raised wood boardwalks (in many ways grand)
Keep bare feet free from hot seaside sand.
In the sun, up above,
Is a place most folks love;
Making love underneath? That act's banned.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
I heard that Emile owed a mil
To the mob and they sent him a bill.
Borrowed time he was on
Till he paid back the don…
His poor widow's now reading his will.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In Horatio Alger's dime novels
The heroes may come from poor hovels—
Poor but dignified, yes,
And hard work through duress
Brings success. Ragged Dick never grovels.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
As she stretched her long legs on the beach,
All the lads thought her balance a peach,
But not one had the nerve
To touch her forward curve,
And her asset was quite out of reach.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Folks in Iowa tend to hate spice,
And garlic they think is "not nice."
For those in that land,
The bland leading the bland,
Salt and pepper are thought to suffice.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Collared peccaries near the cantina
Bore the southwestern name javelina.
Not expecting a boar,
My bar buddies all swore
I should slop those wild hogs with farina.

limerick_list.author: Michael Daws
limerick_list.text:
My bunny has bad cacidrosis —
A result of her great adiposis.
It's hard to inhabit
A house with that rabbit;
Thank goodness for myxomatosis.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Here's a bird that's obsessed with a quest:
Needs to build a high-altitude nest.
Never quite high enough
For this bold alpine chough.
(I expect other birds are impressed.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In this painting of Mary, who mourns,
Jesus' head wears the dread crown of thorns.
Not the sea star, and not
The tall plant in your pot—
As a symbol of scorn, it adorns.

limerick_list.author: Virge
limerick_list.text:
There once was a boy with amentia
Who found every day an adventia.
Said his ma, "He's not mad,
Just a typical lad—
Lights are on, but his brain's in absentia."

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
At botany, Steve was the master,
Discovering flowers much faster
Than others could label;
They lay on the table,
Their interim name: adelaster.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
When you dig way down deep, you may find
Many layers beneath a soft rind.
What's that gross, wriggly mess?
Ugly lies you profess—
Base canards are what come to my mind.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
It grows happily under your feet?
When it's roasted, it's pleasant to eat?
Yes and yes? Yet you said
That the tuber ain't red?
But then how can this veggie be beet?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My employees have grown disobedient.
Their removal would be most expedient.
I'll serve them all donuts
One day when I go nuts,
With arsenic the active ingredient.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott and JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Chemosterilants don't affect mating,
But they do keep the nursery waiting—
Not just for a while,
But Miss Havisham style.
Are they safe? Well, that's up for debating.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Adrift in the waves on the beach
Was a beachball  I couldn't quite reach.
Each time that I tried,
A wave swept me aside
And my toddler let out a sharp screech.

limerick_list.author: Duncan Stevens
limerick_list.text:
A young student held views that were hawkish.
His social skills? Awfully mawkish.
"Golly, let's hatch a plan
For invading Iran!"
His Harvard rep: "Dude's kinda dawkish."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Their digs? An old shanty, a shack-house,
But it's crowded all night. Not a snack-house,
It's for smoking cocaine,
So a profit they gain.
All the neighbors complain it's a crack house.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
"We refuse to serve ropes in this spot!"
But a clever young cord hatched a plot.
So he got himself tangled;
His cut end he mangled.
"Hey, aren't you that rope?" "Afraid not!"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Nothing happens by accident, Kevin.
Your time hadn't come to see Heaven."
But in mishaps some die,
And I have to ask, "Why
Is it my roll came up lucky seven?"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"What are drag queens?" I asked all my pals.
"They are guys," ventured Cal, "dressed as gals.
Each Lolita or doxie
Is a female-by-proxy.
Hals and Als thus become Sals and Vals."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
You moved in — I thought, "Art: how refined.
He can rest here, away from the grind."
But your comings and goings,
Exhibits and showings
Are driving me out of my mind.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A vowel with marks dieretic
May seem, when in English, synthetic,
But you'd better believe
That a word like naïve
Said "nie-EEV" and not "NAYV" sounds poetic.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
I say denominationalism
Is a mad celebration of schism.
Every group thinks they're right
So they bicker and fight.
They should all take a breath and join PRISM.

limerick_list.author: paulthompson
limerick_list.text:
As a goalkeeper, based in Algiers,
He lost them a match — say his peers.
When asked of this, he
Claimed sincerely to be
"Philosophical".  (Drum roll, please.  Cheers.)

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
I was trying to sleep on the plane.
Got a crick in my neck (what a pain)—
Put my hip out of whack,
But the day I got back,
My fine bone cracker took out the strain.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Now the school board's banned music! Those fools
Have afflicted us all with their rules.
The decision was made
'Cause the school board's afraid
Of some violins and sax in our schools.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
A limerick starts out with rhyme A,
And the next line must end the same way.
But the next two you see
Beget new end-rhyme B,
And the punch line has A again — yay!

limerick_list.author: Harris Risman
limerick_list.text:
Snobbish Darcy was so in a tizzy
As he sneered and looked down on poor Lizzy.
Oh such Prejudiced Pride!
How the ladies all sighed!
Seeking husbands—at that task they're busy.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"It's so cold out today." "No, it's hot."
"It's 12:10." "No, it's noon on the dot."
"Jill's a babe." "She's a cow."
"I just can't believe how
Disputatious you are." "No, I'm not!"

limerick_list.author: TrossL and Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Tolkien's books are about Middle Earth,
And I love 'em (whatever that's worth),
Though his characters are,
By near and by far,
Mostly male. But of females? A dearth!

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
You're hungry, of food you've a lack.
Now is time for a light meal or snack—
Yes, a chack's what you need
So sit down, have a feed
And your fast with great speed now we'll crack.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Talking price means you cannot afford
That new pad that your wife has adored.
But if you've got the rent,
Tell the world what you've spent
So your status your friends can record.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Watch reactions of most dads and moms
When confronted with baskets or palms.
When they're faced with a tithe,
Women give while men writhe.
Gals respond to each new call to alms.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
If the smell that emits from your pits
Clearly gives all those close to you fits,
There's a way you can cope
If you run out of soap:
Use some Right Guard — just give it a spritz.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When I finished my cheating-and-prank check
He offered to pay with a blank check
For the work we'd discussed,
But I still didn't trust;
I insisted on having a bank check.

limerick_list.author: Tristan
limerick_list.text:
My eyes, seeing Rocky appear,
Once brimmed over—shed many a tear.
Has my heart now grown cold?
Nah, Stallone's just too old.
It's time to retire, my dear.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If a gallstone is stubbornly tucked
In your gall bladder's sole cystic duct,
It will back up the bile,
And the surgeons will smile,
As they love to find stones that obstruct.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
A new leader signs callous decrees,
While apologists seek to appease.
As conditions get tougher,
Minorities suffer,
And fascism comes by degrees.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The big hat's always present, of course,
And the "Code of the West" he'd enforce
(So he says), but it's true
Drugstore cowboys like Lou
Never come within miles of a horse.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
From the loftiest lodgings of Lhasa
To humble abodes in Mombasa
And streets in Seville,
Every family will
Need a residence, dwelling, or casa.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
A curvature, twisting the spine
To one side, can disable; the sign,
As the vertebrae strain
Causing terrible pain,
Is a hump where you're bent out of line.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
As the Christians are put to the test
By the lions, the Senators rest
Near the Emperor's seat.
For the Roman elite,
The Caesarian section is best.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Politicians may seem antitax,
Campaigning, "Give taxes the ax!"
Yet once they're elected,
As might be expected,
New taxes start breaking our backs.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Lexicographers (goodness!) are gooses:
Distillation, in essence, reduces.
The word extillation's
Repeated citation's
"Exudation of petrifying juices".

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
In an advert we see a girl cry
'Cause her doggy is ill and must die.
This ad's heavy-duty,
Great pathos—a beauty.
The product? Who cares! You must buy.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Lyon
limerick_list.text:
A therapist's highest ambition,
Which would better the client's condition:
Insert and embed
In the Asperger's head
The value of social cognition.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
A weasel with WiFi once mused,
"Is confusion the noun mostly used
For my group? I'll just google:"
(*Tap, tap, tap*) "Oh, it's boogle,
And gang, also pack... I'm confused!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Their attitude always offends.
They use tricks that will help gain their ends.
With a sharp closeup lens
They'll invade your new Benz—
Paparazzi are never your friends!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
About 38 weeks from creation
Of life until birth is gestation;
And some people like you
Can live all their lives through
And yet never achieve separation.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Joe's skin has a dark olive hue,
While his wife is a redhead named Sue.
So when Susan gave birth,
We exclaimed, "What on earth?"
She is mom to a baby who's blue.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
In the gas station's self-service lane
Came a pilot, who's pushing his plane:
"Hey, kid! If you have gas,
Then gimme some  avgas."
Lad answered him: "Go take a train."

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
A bee sees the E: "Effin' gee!"
Age I, Jay? 'Kay Ell, Em! An'... Oh, pee!
Queue 'r' us. Tea — you/we?
Double, you axed: "Why, Zee?"
That's the alphabet. Use it, it's free!

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
It comes after 'a', before 'c',
And is always a comfort to me.
Times of trouble and pain —
Mother Mary's insane!
Words of wisdom for all: "Letter b."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When business fell off, I was fired.
I am young, so I can't say "retired."
With no cash, no enjoyment,
I'm antiunemployment—
I'm hoping I'll soon be rehired.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Without slaves, ancient Romans relate,
A colonus would work your estate.
He was "free" but a serf
Who was tied to the turf,
And paid rent — a solution first-rate.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
A person who's said to be active
Is different from one who's inactive:
This latter will shirk
Any effort or work,
An attitude most unattractive.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
Types of drip pans? I know only two.
Some drippings have value to you.
Meat drippings make sauce,
But the foul drips we toss—
From a crankcase, a fridge, or a zoo.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Fair punishment's always a show
When our classroom behavior goes low.
The teacher says candidly,
"I'll evenhandedly
Slap all your butts in a row."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I was fishing sans license one day
When the sheriff said, "Boy, you will pay!"
With his powers confiscatory
All my gear piscatory
Quickly was taken away.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
On a ladder don't step on a crack
Or else bad luck is bound to attack.
And a sidewalk don't let
Cross your path—better yet—
Don't walk under a cat if it's black.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Ideally when stealing a kiss
From a miss, she'll find nothing amiss.
Is there passion? A trace.
Then a longer embrace.
I could dally for days, just like this.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
It's a falsehood, I say! It's a lie!
I did not hit that ball in the sky!
I don't bat — I keep wicket
When playing at cricket!
He smashed in your window, not I!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Darby Theatre's both dark and well lit,
An odd turn of events, I'll admit.
But the lighting's no use
(Turn it off—save the juice!)
Since the actors got lit up and quit.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
To abort means cut short, which is why
For a fetus or plan, it means die.
 But if that's what you see
 As you curse your PC,
It most likely precedes "Fail, Retry?"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When he's out with Melissa, he necks.
"Are we there? Are you ready?" he checks.
But she stops with a kiss,
Says, "No farther than this.
I will not have consensual sex!"

limerick_list.author: Judah
limerick_list.text:
The plate-crowder's message is terse:
"Pitch inside, an' I'm goin' to firs'!"
A brushback, chin-high,
Sends the hardball reply,
"Back off or you go in a hearse!"

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
"I've made thousands, and still can't escape
Cutting holiday snowflakes from crepe."
"Well, you'll think cheating's cheesy,
But die-cut is easy —
Mechanically stamping a shape."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I like ten-dollar words, I confess,
Like dentalgia for "oral distress."
I'm not feeling all right,
But at least I sound bright.
(It means "toothache," no more and no less.)

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The maiden whose suitor was neuter
Replied that he simply won't suit her,
And refused to engage.
So, abused, in a rage,
He shot back that his aim's now to shoot her.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
"Tell me, how do I know that you're you?"
"Lamb chops stink."  Words that should get him through.
It's his sign, said with ease.
"What's the countersign, please?"
I don't want him to shoot.  "Yes, they do."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"I make biodiverse realms sustainable,"
Claimed Gray. Is his statement explainable?
His ecobabble squall
Sends us all up the wall.
Priest of balderdash? Gray is ordainable!

limerick_list.author: sigg
limerick_list.text:
It's an injury hurting the knee
And it's frequent for people who ski.
They need to beware
Of an ACL tear.
It makes skiing less stable, you see.

limerick_list.author: danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
The employment agreement you signed
Has low wages, no pension — and, mind,
Your inventions are ours;
You concede all your powers.
You're just "labor" — consigned and maligned.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
There are movies to rent and much more
At my Hollywood Video store.
Even box office flops
Are now licking their chops
For this market—there's money galore!

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Who'd sing hymns when I die? Why, the choir would.
And who'd light my pyre? The friar would,
In sackcloth and sandals,
With two tallow candles
Applied to a pile of pine firewood.

limerick_list.author: Shelby Forrest
limerick_list.text:
Antecedents alone can stand free,
But with pronouns they have to agree.
"Each boy knows their name"
Can't be said without shame,
As the purist will readily see.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Every four-flusher dreams he'll die rich,
But Big Louie's a son-of-a-bitch.
Use that freakin' cold deck?
You'd be risking your neck.
If it's spotted, you'll die in a ditch.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Both his arms hang down well past his knees
And he'll offer to groom you for fleas.
While this apishness is
A prime drawback of his,
He's unequaled at climbing in trees.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
'We seek to reform the whole polity:
 Our object is perfect equality!'
 When I asked, 'That implies
 We'll be all the same size?'
 They accused me of facile frivolity.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
It's Day Zero: a countdown to doom
Or to goal has arrived. With a boom
Or a whimper or glory,
Comes the end of a story.
(And a new tale begins. We resume.)

limerick_list.author: Carole Lyons
limerick_list.text:
Affriended, made friends, like befriended,
Has meaning which can be amended,
As when friends had a spat
And made up after that.
They affriended; their friendship was mended.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle and timon
limerick_list.text:
If this Scot knew his goodwife was loose,
Then he wouldn't be crawing so crouse.
He philanders, of course;
Should we tell him that sauce
For the gander is sauce for the goose?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Coke Zero's the beverage for me—
No more alcohol, coffee, or tea.
With its jolts of caffeine,
I stay peppy and lean.
It's nutrition- and calorie-free!

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
She's the queen of the land, I'm the spouse,
So I'm consort—a man or a mouse?
It's a right royal pain
That it isn't my reign,
But I grin as I grumble and grouse.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
With a carvel-built ship, there's no rush:
Make the planks, at their seams, neatly flush.
Though such care with the boat
Should ensure it will float,
Still a leak can make shipbuilders blush.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If I name a particular date,
Calendarial seems like a straight-
forward way to express it.
Calendric? I guess it
Will do; it's confusion I hate!

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
There's a beauty I crave but, oh lumme,
I can't tell her; I'm really a dummy.
I have a great quote
But words stick in my throat,
And butterflies lurk in my tummy.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
When I went to the races today,
I bet all that I had on a bay.
Old Stewball, the horse,
Came in first, so of course
For the bayard the bookies must pay.

limerick_list.author: Blind Pig
limerick_list.text:
Banks's goat proved a creature of worth
On the two famous ships it had berth.
To supply milk for tea,
She had sailed on the sea,
Making two complete trips 'round the Earth.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Kids love Cracker Jack, cheer like a claque
For that popcorny caramel snack,
But each girl and each boy
First will look for the toy
That is hidden inside of each pack.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Cubage units are neat and concrete.
They include cubic yards, cubic feet,
And, of course, cubic meters
(Each one thousand liters),
But the list on this sheet's incomplete.

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
Don't be caught in that New England trap
And think getting a milkshake's a snap.
With that term, what they'll stir up
Is frothed milk and syrup.
If there's ice cream involved, it's a frappe.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
Yes, he's taken 'compassionate leave',
But he's not here to rest or to grieve.
No, he's managed to pounce
On some girl from Accounts,
And it's passion they've come to achieve.

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
With his eye on the ultimate prize,
Andy Murray contestingly tries
To outdo Roger Federer,
Who only gets bederer
And triumphs (to no-one's surprise).

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
A butcher shop's where you buy meat,
Where a carcass turns into a treat.
There they'll chop up a cow,
Make a ham from a sow,
Or hang ducks to be seen from the street.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
You got bitten by Rover? Don't curse,
For a snakebite's considerably worse.
(With regard to compassion,
These lines' stingy ration
Is considerably low, for a verse.)

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
One more hole in my belt—how unkind.
It's a cinch that I'm now in a bind.
Every food I must taste;
It's so true that a waist
Is a terribly tough thing to mind.

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
"An abhuman, as here you can read,
Is a man with the head of a steed,
Or a werewolf, they say,
Also vampire. Okay!
It's a part-human creature." "Indeed!"

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
So raise up your glasses and cheer
For the wonderful drink that is beer.
Just ignore wine's false voice —
Beer's the real people's choice
And it's beer that we all should revere.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
A disorder that dentists have named
As dental fluorosis is blamed
On fluoride ingestion
At levels they question.
Result? Changed appearance, they claimed.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When a cappable jar's getting capped,
Whether apt to be screw-on or snapped,
Then it's capable of
Being closed from above,
So its captives get safely entrapped.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
A carnivorous cove called O'Keefe,
Was devoted to pork, lamb and beef.
He pursued any food
That once oinked, baaed, or mooed,
But eschewed every species of leaf.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
Canine heartworm:  Dog lovers despair
When mosquitoes invade their pet's hair.
Dawtie never was fitter
But, bit by a critter,
Now she coughs and just sits in her chair.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My first meeting with Rita, at which
I fell madly in love—got the itch
To run after, pursue  her—
Made me burning to woo her,
And I did, at red-hot fever pitch.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai and Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
"Dearest Son, now that man's been restored
From sin's wages, turn now heaven-toward:
Forty days since you rose
From your earthly repose,
It's Ascension Day": thus saith the Lord.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Walt is gentlemanlike in his ways;
Correctly behaved is a phrase
That describes him. He treats
Every person he meets
With great courtesy. Walt deserves praise.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
On the day a hot album's released,
Fans are drooling: the ways have been greased.
Long before the disc drops,
A good manager's props
Have been earned, and it's on to the feast.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Percy Faith had three hits reach the top.
The baton was this bandleader's prop.
He did show tunes and themes
And, as strange as it seems,
Led orchestral arrangements of pop.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
I was harvesting wheat in this field—
Then my combine broke down; and the yield
Fell way short, due to rain.
What a waste of good grain!
When the thresher quit, my fate was sealed.

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
You required of me total immersion
In the tale of your recent conversion
And ambitions monastic.
Yes, thanks, that's fantastic.
(I hope you'll become a Cistercian.)

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
To crush 'til it's wrinkled is crumple.
To make the sheets wrinkled is rumple.
But who would have thought
(Because novel it's not)
That to fold, perhaps wrinkle, is dumple?

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
The allure of no husband entices:
She claims that no lover suffices.
"Even if he is skilled?
Will you be unfulfilled?"
"Oh, just leave me to my own devices."

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
My docility makes me sedate,
Like the doormat he sought for a mate.
But on days when he's rough
I'm not feisty enough.
Many marriages carry such freight.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Different single-celled creatures cohere,
And adhere to a surface; they smear
And expand, forming slime —
Think of drains choked with grime.
That's a biofilm process in gear.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Here's a subject we ought to discuss:
Is a "bus line" a queue for a bus?
Or a route? Or a fleet?
If my list's incomplete,
Then my editor's likely to fuss.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A bricole is a shot by a bloke
Playing billiards—a roundabout poke
Hitting ball-cushion-ball
For a carom; to all
Who are new it's a masterful stroke.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
"The next service? They won't have to cancel,"
Said a maintenance fellow named Hansel.
"The wax should be dry.
Let the minister try,
Without falling, to climb to the chancel."

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
"You've established the maximum stress.
Now it's cracked, just like me. I confess
The fatigue limit's found,"
Said his mum, as she frowned,
"So please clean up this terrible mess."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
They claimed they could fly supersonically,
And their statements were not made ironically.
They arrived from afar
And appeared quite bizarre—
As their skulls and their heads were shaped conically.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
He announced, "I'm Abigeus Bob!"
It was true. He was named for his job:
Rustling cattle away.
He was lynched one fine day
By a notably erudite mob.

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
This aardvark walks into a bar—
Needs a cure for a cold with catarrh.
He thinks it might suit
To snort brandied fruit
And drowns with his snoot in the jar.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
While regarding her footwear with scorn,
She's been trying to ease a large corn
Gently into a boot
That's been clearly the root
Of the problem since first it was worn.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The new acolyte shows us his aptness
To follow our guru with raptness.
He's joined ashrams before;
Is this, well, just one more?
He fits in with a pleasing adaptness.

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
To batten means simply to fatten.
It's your bod?  Well, at least take a statin.
But a greater offense?
Wealth at others' expense.
(Yet, I do love my sheets of rich satin.)

limerick_list.author: EdRush
limerick_list.text:
If angels can dance on a pin
While feeling no pain on their skin,
Acmaesthesia's the word
For their feelings, I've heard,
But me? I do that with sloe gin.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
For this difficult task I prepare.
The expression, or game face, I wear
Shows the focus I need,
With resolve, to succeed.
The sad truth is I don't stand a prayer.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Shakespeare's language is often called deathless,
Deemed eternal in tones that are breathless.
Right! He'd still be revered
Without Falstaff, un-Leared,
Were we sans Juliet, or Macbethless.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
For the factory price, take a trip
To our warehouse for pickup and skip
Wasting time in a store
Where you're sure to pay more.
At our gate, we don't handle or ship.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
I was angling one day from a barge,
When I caught a fish, fleshy and large.
When I questioned, "What's that?"
Captain said, "Channel cat!
Now let's fry it to eat, free of charge."

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Silly baas fill the swamp, far and near,
But no woolies. Can sheep disappear?
In the leaf-litter, loads
Of small narrowmouth toads
Shout the lovesongs and odes that you hear.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
See this cross-staff I bear?  It's no chore
As I carry it proudly before
The archbishop.  The prelate
Likes joking, "They sell it
On down at the crociary store."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Stop whinging and whining, you fool,
With your "Don't want to go in to school!"
Course the teachers don't hate you!
Come on, now — you're late: you
Are still the headmaster — be cool!

limerick_list.author: lopey
limerick_list.text:
The gory and holy rocks sat
Somewhat homey and cozy and flat.
My lorry went by
As the Gobi drew nigh:
Assonantal italicized scat.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Back house weight is the force that's required
For your rock to arrive, as desired,
In the back of the house.
(We're entitled to grouse
If in front of the house it is mired.)

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
In England it's called the Dakota,
That 'plane with the Double Wasp motor.
It's the old DC3,
A bird we'll agree
That gave rather more than its quota.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"Clean up—we tee off in an hour.
Use the ball washer, dude…why so sour?"
"I don't want to sound rude,
But a ball-washer dude?
Makes me squeamish. I think I'll just shower."

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
In reflection, an object, we find,
May be twinned, of identical kind;
But you're needing to know
That when that isn't so
They're enantiomorphously designed.

limerick_list.author: nevadaace
limerick_list.text:
To our bar, one fine morn late last year,
Came a ham and some eggs wanting beer.
