It's an old "Wild West" scene,
Quite the best there has been,
In a film I watch time and again.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Watch that icy-cold, crystal-packed heap:
Drifts of snow are deceptively deep.
But for deepness that warms,
There's the snugness that forms
In your mind, as you drift off to sleep.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
This inept violinist is sad;
My double stops sound really bad.
Playing two notes at once
Ain't the best of my stunts —
Wretched harmony's driving me mad.

limerick_list.author: GaZoom
limerick_list.text:
Ginny's exigent: always intent
On demanding that others assent
To each whim she'd invent.
Soon she'll double this bent—
She's to marry an exigent gent.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
The government wants me deported
To my motherland. This will be thwarted—
I'll avoid any trial
Through my natural guile
And the due legal process, contorted.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
Said the nun to the priest, "Don't be lewd!
You will not say a mass in the nude!
Get up off that hassock
And put on your cassock.
Who cares if you're not in the mood?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
This canine inhabits the wild
In Australia—it's deadly when riled.
Forget about rabies—
Hold on to your babies:
A dingo once chewed on a child!

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
If Fender's the name on the label,
Your ax is a weapon of fable.
The Esquires, Broadcasters
And Teles were blasters,
But Strats were the tops from that stable.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"Catch our new girl: the never-says-nyet one."
"A duke's mixture, if ever I met one."
"She's Russian-Hawaiian
And her name is O'Brien."
"I'm in love! Where the heck can I get one?"

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
If your Yuletide's not looking so jolly,
Foothill leaves can bedeck it, by golly.
Don't hole up in the gray;
Spend a gathering day.
Green things up with bright galax and holly.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
He's been searching all over the place
'Cause I've hidden his cigarette case.
Emphysema's no joke;
He's not getting a smoke—
He can beg till he's blue in the face.

limerick_list.author: C. H. Carpenter
limerick_list.text:
An achievement test claims it can show
What you've learned and may still need to know:
A proficiency test
With which you're assessed
For the standards you've fallen below.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A fossa, or pit, in an ossicle
Might be aptly described as a "fossicle".
That's a rhyme, I'll admit,
That is hardly legit,
But a good one is sadly impossicle.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Unannounced, in their usual way,
Thoughts of death interrupted my day.
I know everyone dies,
But it seems my demise
Comes to mind more and more as I gray.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev and Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
If I'm looking for Christian TV,
CBN is the channel for me.
This broadcasting network
Does far-flung, wide-set work:
Its impact goes over the sea.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I have bias; you'll never remove it.
My conclusions are right in the groove; it
Might give your brain calluses,
But my fancy analysis
Assures that my data will prove it.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Is your knowledge of tapirs as scant as
Mine was? At their plight will you rant as
They clear Brazil's trees?
Do you speak Portuguese?
There are always more questions than antas.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Dry Tortugas in summer are hot
For a brown or black noddy to spot;
You can sail from Key West
To an Anous nest:
Short-tailed swoop-fishers roost on this dot.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
The meeting had gone on for hours;
We were wilting, and so were the flowers.
The last item—at last!
"AOB?" Say "No!" fast,
Even though your boss looks up and glowers.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
When acridine orange fluoresces,
Cell nucleotides it assesses:
One-stranded glows green,
And two strands, orange sheen—
No need to resort to mere guesses.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Kimmie's Klips" is a place you should shun.
You'll be bankrupt before you are done
When you shell out to Kim
Fifty bucks for a trim.
It's a clip joint in more ways than one.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
That spark in your eyes: there by chance?
No, those lights were emplaced in advance
So the surface reflection
In camera's direction
Made catchlights that shine in your glance.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Let's face it, I know I'm a lush,
Getting red in the face as I rush
To imbibe every day
Three carafes of rosé.
Like the vino I drink, I'm ablush.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
This dumb tool, you damn fool, has you stuck.
Then my dad took a look, and said, "Buck?
You never will tighten
That drill bit you're fightin'
If you don't find the key for the chuck."

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
I was gonna make muffins, when "Ooh!"
I had run out of fiber; I flew
To the shop, whereupon
All the "good stuff" was gone —
So the store bran would just have to do.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
Your demeanor (when push comes to shove)
Reminds me of elders I love.
If you act like an uncle,
I say, prithee, nuncle,
Avuncular fits like a glove.

limerick_list.author: dwalker
limerick_list.text:
A playwright who wrote with facility
Began showing signs of senility.
His final construction,
A role-less production,
Was clearly without actability.

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
With this lady I felt a connection.
A soft, spicy tide of affection
Enveloped my heart,
But my world fell apart
When advances were met with rejection.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Staying home makes me feel like a jerk.
I think it's dishonest to shirk.
Hadn't done this before—
I was weak, at death's door—
Sick as hell. But I'll finish your work.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Was that Jane on the seat of the train
Doubled over? The posture was plain.
(I decided thereafter:
She was scrunched up with laughter
Or displaying the strain of great pain.)

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Academic administrators rule
At a uni or college or school.
Being viewed by some teachers
As meddlesome creatures,
They're frequently played for the fool.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I'll step out for a while — please don't mind me.
Bearing down on the can's where you'll find me.
Love bananas and rice?
Help yourself; pay the price,
But I'll leave them behind, 'cause they bind me.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
A syringe with detachable spout —
Put it in and then shpritz; take it out.
You can call it a douche bag —
It's not for your bouche (gag) —
A vaginal shower, no doubt.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
There once was a sculptor named Marvin
Who couldn't sell heads he was carvin',
As he always made noses
Projecting like hoses;
God knows—that's why Marvin was starvin'.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
'The Dog in the Manger' was fun;
And the tale of 'The Wind and the Sun':
Greek slave Aesop was able
To tell a fine fable:
A story and moral in one.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I have stopped paying bills. Now the label
Of "bum" will be used, and the cable
(That's bringing me free
What I see on TV)
My provider will soon disenable.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The girls act bizarrely and quirkily,
Embracing left causes while perkily
Kissing police
As they're marching for peace
In the People's Republic of Berkeley.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
It's a Greek word—this isn't Ebonics—
The genus is called Acinonyx.
Those cheetahs are rare
In the wild, but I swear
That their speeds can approach supersonics.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Angry folks will aggress, damn the hurt.
Real adults will have learned to assert
Their true selves and succeed
In a ploy or a deed
To react perhaps sweetly, yet curt.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Does a cricketer need to be dressed
In a suitable way? Yes, you've guessed,
In the sun and the heat
Nothing else can compete—
Cricket whites are the best for the test.

limerick_list.author: Nitelaf
limerick_list.text:
The cuckolded husband insisted
In claiming her falseness persisted.
Her affair-ridden past
He'd brought up, first to last —
All her sins, antecedently listed.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Boating's wicked here; muscles feel dead,
But there's flatwater, thank God, ahead —
Where it's placid, like glass
(Better times for my ass),
Where these aches can drift gently to bed.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Snail's climbing the gable end wall
Of our house. Sticking tight, he won't fall
Or dangerously dangle.
I'd judge the triangle
He'll reach in three weeks — if at all.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
There's a man in my mouth who is drilling,
'Cause for years I've been flat-out unwilling
To brush, so attack
From this foul dental plaque
Has left holes in my teeth that need filling.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
A one-time acquaintance of mine
Helped me get through a whole lot of wine.
On my own, I find boozing
Not half as amusing.
I think I should drop him a line.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Ma, I'm begging: quit busting my balls!
Your nagging of me really galls.
My greatest frustration?
Unkind botheration.
I refuse, Ma, to wear those pink shawls!

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
A smart way to enjoy food t'day
Earns a cheer: hip, hooray, crudités!
They're so simple to fix
(Just cut veggies like sticks)
For the vegan or hungry gourmet.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB and mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
She feared he would sprint from her, since her
Right hand was a cheliform pincer.
But the prince, as she saw,
Didn't wince or withdraw,
But took hold of her claw, to convince her.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Our studies are never intrusive,
And we try to make sure they're conducive
To cementing alliances.
Environmental science is
Of multiple subjects inclusive.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Cook some sugar-cane juice in a still —
What comes out is the pride of Brazil.
All the people's demands
For the 4000 brands
Of cachaça, distillers fulfill.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Let's rejoice, Aussies all, 'cos we're girt
(That's encircled) by sea. Rip the shirt
Off your back, and lie down
On the beach 'til you're brown
(Though some 50+ sunscreen won't hurt).

limerick_list.author: TrossL and mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Plan was good, but I couldn't quite pitch it.
Said my boss, "That's a great carriwitchet!
It's a damned funny joke!"
So I tried not to choke,
And replied, "Never mind, I'll just ditch it."

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
As the wheel of a wagon goes 'round,
A gymnast can spin 'cross the ground.
Limbs fully extended,
A cartwheel is splendid
(With none of the cart's squeaky sound).

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
People say that impeccable breeding
Is revealed in a chin that's receding.
But those same people figure
My top jaw is bigger—
Epignathous. I say it's misleading.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
I'm a maven of fashion design,
So my tops are the top of the line.
 This one shapes to entice.
 As for yours, corset's nice,
Bodice not as revealing as mine.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Our bombastic Brit billionaire Blomm backs
A scheme to "get peasants off Pom backs".
To fulfil farming needs,
He's now shipping them seeds
Of the silk-cotton tree, the bold bombax.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
You're in for a hell of a battle,
But a winner don't quit or skedaddle.
Keep ridin' her hard—
If you're thrown and get jarred,
Cowboy up and get back in the saddle.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Prepositions show role, link in space.
In some languages, what takes their place
Is, say, how a word ends.
To translate "Dine with friends",
Put your friends in the comitative case.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A slash is a handy device
Meaning "over" (divided by). Nice,
But is "12/10"
Perhaps asinine when
"To the left of" would seem more precise?

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
It's a process one has to admire:
The oak appears dead after fire.
Yet beneath mature bark,
Epicormic buds spark
Latent stems. No, the tree won't expire.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
The traffic's now busy, now light.
It fluctuates daily — by night,
Fewer cars on the roads,
Fewer lorries with loads —
But the volume each noon's at its height.

limerick_list.author: pkwooster
limerick_list.text:
Black medic's a clover-like weed.
Its flowers are yellow; the seed
Is small, black, and round.
It grows close to the ground.
Though no doctor, it helps your soil feed.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
A museum, some paintings, a start:
So for culture he's doing his part.
Don't be looking askance
When he pulls down his pants —
He's exposing himself to some art!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"In this chamber, we'll now decompress,
From a weightier pressure to less.
We will not get the bends,"
Mentioned Ben to his friends,
"So I hope this relieves your distress."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My cowl muscles, under attack,
Are disfigured and way out of whack.
A triangular pair
Near my shoulders, they're where
I've been patting myself on the back.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Here's a fossil—the aegyptopithecus.
Though this primate (pre-Paleolithic) is
Quite clearly extinct,
Once he puckered and winked
At his pals before planting a mythic kiss.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
View the southerly heavens with care;
You'll find Norma and Circinus there.
Seems like heavenly fools
Have abandoned their tools—
They're the architect's Compass and Square.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Blood corpuscles, white ones and red,
Are the cells in the blood that you've shed.
If you don't stop that bleeding,
Your limit exceeding,
You'll end up a corpse, and be dead!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Jeans and tee shirt? You do look a mess!
And they won't let you in — it's full dress.
Evening suit, smart and formal,
Tonight will look normal.
I'll just give your tie a quick press.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
Some say W stands for the Worst;
Name another that's worse if you durst.
Eight long years, way too much
Of that evil gang's touch —
May we never again be so curst!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The waitress at Rosie's Cafe
Calls, "Two burgers, to go, all the way!"
While wondering whether
They'll mate well together,
I smile to myself as I pay.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Jeanne Calment would say, "Merci beaucoup,"
To a cigarette. Later, "Adieu,"
To a life that was brimming
With fencing and swimming
At the ripe age of six score and two.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Diastalsis: intestinal action
That brings me intense satisfaction.
Moving food through my gut
Needs some squeeze-action, but
Inhibition precedes the contraction.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
If you don't know the dope or the skinny
Insiders will think you a ninny.
What's the buzz?  What's the poop?
Can you dish us the scoop?
Are you hopelessly out or an innie?

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
One night the inspired Mr. Argand
Requested a glowing cigar and
Then lit the round wick
He'd designed. What a trick!
It shone bright as the Milky Way star band!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Between mortal and god was the daimon
To the Greeks, and they often were sly men.
I'd expect them to be males,
But were some of them  females?
If so, were they born with a hymen?

limerick_list.author: Jim Macaulay
limerick_list.text:
While in Amsterdam, Chef Paul C. Mays
Serves his fine lemon sauce as a glaze.
He's enjoyed his time there
And prepped food with such flair,
He has relished his rich Holland days.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
If you claim to support benefaction,
Then your boasting is just a distraction.
 There's no "Charity Show";
 Just go donate some dough,
For a word's not as loud as an action.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Spicer thought we should best play it safe, eh?
(Covert intel was leaked by El Jefe)
"Constant negative press"?
We can clean up that mess
With a weapon Vlad calls the covfefe.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Two old hobos out riding the rails
On the Rock Island Line to Versailles,
Having hopped an express,
Found a deal of distress:
That fast rattler restructured their tails.

limerick_list.author: Robert Hatfield
limerick_list.text:
A young anarchist, code name "Black Tom",
Threw a bomb with a certain aplomb.
But it failed to explode;
It just lay in the road.
You could say Tommy's bomb was a bomb.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Asteroidea (starfish) aren't fleet,
But can smell through their small, sticky feet.
Their first stomachs extrude
To engulf largish food;
At their top, they've a hole to excrete.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In kitchens, where chefs often toil,
They prefer to see smudges and soil.
If cookware is spotless,
The water stays hotless—
Since pots that get washed never boil.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Antelucan means "held before light,"
Before dawn and the sun growing bright.
Early Christians met then
For their prayers; that was when
Persecution in Rome reached its height.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
This new plan is the first of its line.
Dreams to paper, I draft and refine.
For, by starting from scratch,
There is nothing to match
This formation: a clean-sheet design.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Talking smooth, looking trim, nipped and tucked,
Fielding questions (the tough ones he's ducked),
Till one evening, when he
Right on prime-time TV
Drops the F-bomb. Man, auto-destruct!

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
With my details on Friends Reunited,
I waited for answers, excited
That I'd catch up with mates.
(Also maybe get dates
With those girls where lust went unrequited.)

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
This Dalek, this creature of hate,
Will conquer or kill; that's our fate.
Our people are fleeing
This "Superior Being"
And its battle cry: "EX-TER-MIN-ATE!"

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
I once knew a man who was poor
Who used to sell dogs door to door.
If you asked, "Is this legal?"
He'd slip you a beagle,
Saying, "Gift for your wife — say no more!"

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
This old airplane is tricky to fly
On my benzodiazepine high.
All those Valium pills
Really mess with my skills:
Where I should see the ground, I see sky.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
What are ethics? They're principles, rules
Of good conduct. We use them as tools
That help culture stay strong,
Choosing right over wrong,
So we act more like angels than fools.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
Agricultural science: a field
Which aspires to improve a crop's yield.
If with Greek you're enthralled,
Geoponics, it's called.
And without it, our fate would be sealed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This capo—of crimes he's a shaper
 As he writes out a plan for each caper,
 With each detail complete;
 All obsessively neat,
 In straight lines on his pad's feint-ruled paper.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The lion was limping, looked bad,
Couldn't eat all his meat; that was sad.
Said the vet, "It's no joke,
As it might be a stroke."
Would a CAT scan reveal what he had?

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Fuzzy floccules polluting the lake
Mean the plant site's a sorry mistake.
Unforeseen or intended,
Whatever's suspended
Must be ended—and quick—for God's sake.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
A reader of Marx and Voltaire,
While doubtingly starting a prayer,
Said, with heavenly glance,
"I must look, Lord, askance—
Your existence is up in the air!"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"That degreed education of yours,"
Said my father, "will open most doors.
Opportunity knocks.
You won't find many locks."
"Dad, hold on.  Not through mopping these floors."

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
Is congenialness really your goal?
Then temper the way that you roll.
A couple of traits
That will help you win mates
Are agreement and niceness of soul.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I've been standing all day in the heat
Guarding aircraft on solid concrete.
When my shift is all through
I know just what I'll do:
Get some sack time to ease my poor feet.

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
I'm a red-blooded Yank through and through,
But a bit of an Anglophile, too.
I've a strange predilection
For this Brit interjection:
Instead of "gee whiz" I say, "coo".

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
On TV, these accounts of the war
Are becoming a snap to ignore.
They seem sure that the gore
In the stories will bore,
So they're shorter than ever before.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My yacht is regrettably crewed
By a crew that is crude, rude, and lewd.
They've accrued a majority
Because of seniority—
The rules of their union—I'm screwed!

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Sparing breath, on a rare verbal fast,
I'm reviving the long-gone devast.
Thus I slash by a third
A great waste of a word
Which I greedily "ate" in the past.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Colonitis? I've got it, alas,
And my buddies berate me en masse.
In the chatrooms they post
That I'm self-diagnosed
Since my head's firmly stuck up my ass.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
A new Jewish convert I am,
And I'm happy I passed their exam.
I just love their strict diet
(I hope you all try it),
But, damn, ma'am, I do miss my ham.

limerick_list.author: The IRON(ing) Knight
limerick_list.text:
Are you noticing old age advances?
And you don't want to take any chances?
Christian socialism's the  way
That the rational pray,
And your life-after-death it enhances.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Berlusconi, premier with much loot—
Bunga Bunga soirées were a hoot—
Was as cool as they get,
Left his country in debt,
So Italia  gave this heel the boot.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
While learning of things continental
I get so confused I go mental.
I say to myself,
"If we're knocked off our shelf,
I just hope that the slope will be gentle."

limerick_list.author: Harris Risman
limerick_list.text:
The  melodramatic Glenn Beck
On his talk show spouts drivel and dreck.
Alex Zaitchik's bold book
Takes a critical look
At the lies that no truth holds in check.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
The carpool lane speeds our commute
While reducing the trend to pollute.
It's more pleasant by far
To have two in the car:
My blowup doll passenger's cute!

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"Me, emotive? You just make me puke!
So you claim you're objective, you kook?
Here is my cool analysis:
Baby, you're callous. Is
That cool enough?" (My rebuke.)

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
On occasion, I bleeping-well swear,
Though to utter some words, I don't dare,
So I substitute bleeping;
It's better than keeping
On making some bleeping folk stare.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
As an artist, I tried to deduce
Why, when blending magnolia with puce,
Or with colours like green,
The results looked obscene.
In the end I gave up — what's the use?

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The Navy meant faraway places—
Exotic the sounds and the faces,
Djibouti to Nome…
Now Mom's welcomed me home
With a hug and, "Son, do up your laces."

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Apiculturists seldom just die.
When the Grim Reaper calls, they reply:
"Don't be funny, it's sunny
And honey makes money.
Just buzz off yourself, bearded guy!"

limerick_list.author: Brian Cairns
limerick_list.text:
My card's swallowed up by the cashpoint!
Bank computers have too low a crash-point.
I can't get my money,
I don't find it funny,
My temper is reaching its flashpoint...

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Are you tired of being compliant?
Do you long to stand up—be defiant?
To fight City Hall?
The best tactic of all:
Choose a giant to be your alliant!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle and Mary
limerick_list.text:
Think of dinosaurs dying en masse,
Radar, leprosy, writing with class
By a doctor of fame.
Yes, the Alvarez name
Was, in science, one few could surpass.

limerick_list.author: Irene Weber
limerick_list.text:
He was filled with a terrible malice
When he learned of the murder of Alice.
Avenging her death,
He did in the foul Beth
With the poison he put in her chalice.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
I once ate a bad abalone,
Which made me as sick as a pony.
That's something like hoarse,
Only lower (of course)…
Sometimes, tales fall on ground that is stony.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
Your proportions are wrong — that's the issue:
You're dieting always and wish you
Were skinny.  Your plight:
You're in need of more height
To disguise all your adipose tissue.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
As of now, I can safely attest
That to live on this planet is blessed.
Since our species began,
It's been perfect for Man:
Of the options, it's clearly the best.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"We're God's people, so let us rejoice,"
Said a Jew.  "They can't silence our voice.
It's revealed that when all's
Said and done and Earth falls,
We'll be saved.  The good Lord's made His choice."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A big-name performer like me
Is in films and on stage and TV.
I'm well known, so you know
I might act in your show
For big bucks. You won't get me for free.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
If your software's expensive, you may
Need a dongle before you can play
With each feature or section.
Plug-in copy protection
Thwarts people who don't want to pay.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
It's a curb roof — two slopes on each side.
There are two that are common world-wide.
One's named gambrel, one mansard;
I hope that I've answered
Your roofing inquiry. I tried.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Escolar is a fish. Why a "scholar"?
Coz, like specs, 'round each eye's a dark collar.
This oily snake mackerel
(Though it looks blacker)'ll
Sell as "white tuna": top dollar.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Our center, a lummox named Kline,
Has been yanked (he's now riding the pine.)
He can block shots, rebound,
But his shooting's not sound,
And he chokes  at the charity line.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The farewells of one atheist guy
Eschew bye-bye. "That's pie-in-the-sky
Old religion, you know.
Oh, you don't? Long ago,
God be with ye turned into good-bye."

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
I'm truly a longtime admirer
Of historian William L. Shirer.
The Reich rose and fell
As the facts he did tell,
In prose to which I'm an aspirer.

limerick_list.author: Egbert
limerick_list.text:
Pity wee Cabassous unicinctus,
As he cries out in pain for some linctus.
"My tongue hurts," he pants.
"It's this diet of ants."
Heaven knows what it does to his sphincters.

limerick_list.author: Dick C. Erd
limerick_list.text:
Seems my agonies grow by degrees;
I've been bitten from toes to my knees.
This miserable pup
Has been chewing me up!
Won't you help? I can't speak Pekinese.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A stripper, who danced with a bubble,
With the management now is in trouble.
Her bubble dance flaws
(And the cause for applause):
Sloppy shaving and very sharp stubble.

limerick_list.author: SusanL and Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
I'm a sniper—don't ask me my name,
But beware my dead accurate aim.
I can snuff out a mark
In the daylight or dark;
I will kill, not just hurt, wound or maim.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Your manuscript's gotten rejected,
Since your blunders were never corrected.
The reviewers concluded
You must be deluded
To think that they'd go undetected.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Will the heroine, bound on a peak,
Be grabbed by a giant bird's beak?
We won't know if it's gory—
This serial's story—
Till the episode showing next week.

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
Said the judge, "I am shocked that you dare
Commit battery; I shall take care
That this circuit is short."
An electrified court
Heard the judge say, "On this charge — the chair!"

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Should I moisturise more? Desquamation
Sends my skin to a scaly ablation.
But I don't think I'll scruff,
Because scratching that stuff
Has a subtle but rich fascination.

limerick_list.author: AronKuppersmith
limerick_list.text:
At the stock market's trading day's end,
My poor broker just can't comprehend
Why the closing price of
All my stocks are above
The investments that he'd recommend!

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
A proud papa is Fred the defrauder
As his daughter relates what he taught her:
"Common crooks of our ilk
Live to cheat, steal and bilk,
And the trustful are sheep to our slaughter!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
This corythosaur's skull, with a crest
And a bill like a duck's, may suggest,
In its fossilized state,
That one dinosaur's fate—
A blind alley in nature—was best.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Take a trip in a bus or a car,
And before you have gotten too far,
A comfort stop's what
You will not have forgot.
You will need one, whoever you are.

limerick_list.author: Julia
limerick_list.text:
For male Jewish babies, a bris
Is a time to remove some of this
Unsanctified foreskin.
Some wish they had more skin,
But it shouldn't affect how they piss.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Circumscriptively circling the cliff,
Caveman Dana was thinking,  "What if
There's a dinosaur fossil
To round out my wassail—
Waft Lucy a brisk spiffy whiff?"

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
My widget got stuck. In a panic
I summoned a nanomechanic.
"I can fix it, of course.
It's your Casimir force."
His bill wasn't small, but titanic.

limerick_list.author: Virge
limerick_list.text:
I'm an amberjack. Yes, I'm okay.
I can swim all the night and the day.
I'll politely decline
If you feed me a line,
And those fishnets are far too risqué.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My psychiatrist won't let me be.
I feel useless; she doesn't agree.
While I'm autocritical,
She's analytical
And claims I am too hard on me.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
I endamaged my car to the max.
Now it's dented and riddled with cracks.
But my beat-up Accord
You can surely afford:
She'll be twenty-nine bucks after tax.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"To build the Colossus of Rhodes,"
Said the king, "stone is carried in loads.
I am proud to be funder
Of the world's greatest wonder!"
(Too bad that it later explodes.)

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
The guy looked like a beanpole—so thin!
So I'm all like, "Dude! Where've you been?
In some place where crops failed,
Or in stir—were you jailed?"
Dude says "chemo" to my great chagrin.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Let the king cast largesse to the crowd;
He has gold and to spare. Ass, you're proud
That you stood every round
That your hangers-on downed.
That's fool-largess, daft waste. And you're plowed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A volcanic basalt we call dhu-stone
Is sometimes, in England, called Jew-stone.
In its own special way
It is pretty—dark gray
Or pitch-black—and to me, it's a new stone.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Lord, the lengths to which parents have gone!
For their two-year-old daughter, named Dawn,
Tom and Tess, to impress,
Bought a babyhouse! Yes!
What I wonder is, who mows the lawn?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
"The conductive adhesive I chose
Is the kind having current that flows
In a single direction.
I'd call my selection,
Well, anisotropic!" he crows.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
"Cool beans!" is the phrase of the day
When the message I want to convey
Is: it's all fine by me;
Count me in; I agree!
(Although some folks may find it passé.)

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
My neighbour's an excellent cook;
Likes his carp charcoal-grilled "off the hook."
So nine platinum blondes
(In a line past his ponds)
Made a barbecue down by the brook.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev and Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
The snow had charged in like a beast
(It had blown for a week from the east).
I was housebound, I found,
Drifted in all around.
Then came stillness—the wild winds had ceased.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Said an overweight man from St. Kitts,
"Buying clothes off the rack is the pits!
Every coat is too tight
And no trousers hang right.
I can never find clothing that fits!"

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Flattish, circular masses of dung,
When excreted by cows, could be hung
By a string when they're dry
Where they'd challenge a fly
Who'd find cowpats hard work with its tongue.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
On parole, now I've got a clean slate,
And my actions will forge a clean fate.
I'll appreciate what
Through my labors I've got—
After eating, I'll leave a clean plate.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
For thirty-nine years, Côte d'Ivoire
Was at peace, with no warring to mar
Their republic.  Alas,
In the next years to pass,
Brutal conflicts and coups became par.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
I think colourfast means that it's slow—
And I'll bet that you think I don't know,
But you see, here's the fun;
It's the dye that won't run
In the wash. There you go: told you so!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A fig is a fruit that is sweet.
Round the world it's a food people eat.
Taste it fresh or first dry it.
Either way, once you try it,
You'll find it a heavenly treat.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
A cycle's a series of songs
Or of poems, where each one belongs
To a wordsmith's own theme,
Who, to set out the scheme,
Needs his tongue, but no hammer and tongs.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
I dared a pole-vaulter from Malta
To vault o'er the Rock of Gibraltar.
Attempting to clear it,
He cried out, "I fear it
Will not have a pleasant result... AAAAAAaaaaaa!!"

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Over airwaves the sounds get relayed—
Maybe miles, across continents—made
To arrive in my ear
To allow me to hear
Aural wonders with radio's aid.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Carthaginians' Punic campaign
Was a product of Hannibal's brain.
He just didn't play nice:
He enveloped them twice,
And the Romans at Cannae were slain.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
It had served us quite well for so long,
But this theory was shown to be wrong
By formal disproval.
For its e-text removal,
Buy an app to emend, for a song.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
A domestic's devoid of all bliss.
Hear Hank  holler and Harriet hiss.
Both the kids close their ears
When the hurricane nears
(But it usually ends with a kiss).

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"This new lover of yours, Angelique,
Tell me, how would you rate his technique?"
"Only good, I would say,
Though he's 80 today—
Not too bad for a creaky antique."

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
"The guy's gotta be wasted", snarled Pete.
"Screw the law—leave him dead in the street!"
Fulfilling his wish'll
Be extrajudicial,
But butchers like me need fresh meat.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Bible-thumpers are short in supply.
"Trust the old-time religion!" they cry.
"Renounce sex, lust and sin!"
(But before I begin,
To be fair, I should give them a try!)

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Get your tissues and organs to freeze
At some very low temp in degrees,
Cryogenically stored,
'Til your docs have explored
How to treat for your fatal disease.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
What's eversible (it would appear),
And smells, so they say, pretty queer?
I guess there are few men
Who know it's a crumen:
The lacrimal gland of a deer.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
Reddish-brown with a white-spotted coat,
With large antlers and white on its throat,
The axis deer's home's
In Sri Lanka—it roams
Too on ranches in Texas, please note.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Bored in bed by by the Duke ("such a ponce!"),
The Duchess employs an alphonse.
She giggles, "We wiggle — oh!
Jig-a-jig, gigolo!
Pleasure me, boy — for the nonce."

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
When the flies were all buzzing today,
I distinctly heard one blowfly say,
"I've been mated and so
Now I'll zoom down below
And in beasts' open wounds ova lay."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A plate broke and so Richard proposes
To replace it, but Grandma discloses
The source of that plate:
A gift to Great-great-
Great-great-great-great-great-great-
Great-great-great-great-great-great-
Great-great-great-great-great-great-
Great-great-great-great-great-great-
Great-great-great-great-great-great-
Great-great-great-great-great-great-
Great-great-great-great-great-great-
Great-great-great-great-great-great-
Great-great-great-great-great-great-
Great-great-great-great-great-great-
Great-great-great-great-great-great-
Great-great-great-great-great-great-
Great-great-great-great-great-great-
Great-great-great-great-great-great-
Great-great-great-Grandpa Micah from Moses.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Many nations will use their great seal
To mark documents, sealing a deal
That's important — hence "great".
But not one single state
Has a walrus, though that great seal's real.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
You say you're delirious, so
Just keep talking, because I don't know
If you're dizzy with joy
Like a boy with a toy,
Or near dead 'cause your head took a blow.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Patty's practice has one major flaw:
Lack of guidelines on which she might draw.
There are no regulations,
No specifications.
Extralegal, it's outside the law.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
That's your cover, recruit, not your "hat,"
As your weapon is never your "gat."
A marine's in the game
Once he's learned a thing's name.
A damn hat's for a Doctor Seuss cat.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
In my culpableness, I'm to blame;
My traducement of grammar's my shame.
Someone shouted, "Who's free?"
And I answered, "That's me."
But admit it: you'd say just the same.

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
In a desperate quest to stay young,
I applied a thin layer of dung
To my face, ears, and neck,
'Cause I looked like a wreck.
Anti-ageing dung's charms are unsung.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I've finally figured it out,
And I'm positive—free of all doubt.
It's a certainty that
In old age I'll be fat,
So I'm ordering stout with the trout.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Budgie-smuggling, he shows off his pecs.
And for Lent he says, "I'll give up sex."
Abbott, T.,  look at me:
Have a nice cup of tea
And a lie-down (and, yes, take a Bex).

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
From Limburg I hail. I was born
In what's called "The White Village" (that's Thorn).
All its houses are white
(An unusual sight),
And my father, a farmer, grows corn.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Fool's gold, iron pyrite: a rock,
Iron sulfide. That gives you a shock?
Did you think you had gold?
Oh, this fable's so old —
Dreams of riches that turn into shlock.

limerick_list.author: BobfromThirsk
limerick_list.text:
There's a bang, then a buzzing and thud,
A howl and a scream; dripping blood.
It's a message of hate
From a weapon of state,
A baton round: up to no good.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A divining rod, wielded real quick,
Is the dowser's most typical pick.
He can make an appraisal
With a branch made of hazel.
Is there water?  He'll ask a forked stick.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
All the mayors in Spanish domains,
In the mountainous chains and on plains:
Alcalde's their title,
Their jobs are quite vital.
Once Moorish, the name still remains.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
I'll survive, because down I will hunker,
Holed up in my nuclear bunker.
When bombs rain I'll stay dry
And stay sane draining rye.
(Might not die, but will live somewhat drunker.)

limerick_list.author: rbalexx
limerick_list.text:
Past the Pecos, the legends report,
His saloon came to serve as the court.
With his gun and one book,
No debate would he brook.
Judge Roy Bean brought 'em peace, of a sort.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Raise your voices in praise of ear candy —
Diluted sweet froth, like a shandy.
It's lollipop music,
(Don't say it makes you sick!)
Strauss (Johann and son) to Shaw (Sandie).

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A blessing upon thee, young squirt.
Once barefoot and tan-cheek'd thou wert.
But as Whittier wrote,
Thou hast grown up to vote
For The Man, and become a stuffed shirt.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
This bushwhacker seems in a rush;
With his sickle he's clearing the brush.
His plan for the land
Is more hurried than grand:
Just a can with one hole and no flush.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The cystometer readings are clear:
Bladder function's improved since last year.
Though your pressure's so-so
And capacity's low,
On the whole, Flo, you've little to fear.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Just creating two camps is enough
To turn innocent children all rough.
They are "them", we are "us";
That's the source of the fuss
And the reason we want to seem tough.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Is the candidate red? Purple? Green?
Or some alternate shade in between?
Should his private-life blues
Make the six o'clock news —
His true colors? He'll have to come clean.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I'm still young, yet my spine's out of whack.
My damn duty belt's killing my back.
It holds gear that I need
On the job to succeed,
Right at hand if the bad guys attack.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
If only he'd done what I said —
Not light farts but light candles instead —
He'd be much better off, in
Fact not in this coffin.
Yes, he'd surely have come out ahead.

limerick_list.author: nevadaace
limerick_list.text:
A stunning young barber named Beth
(If you see her you might lose your breath)
Is a klutz with a razor,
But that doesn't faze her.
Her shaving: a close brush with death.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The estate agent selling our house
Behaved like an odious louse.
She both charged a large fee
And, from what I could see,
Had a torrid affair with my spouse.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Bioanalysts find their way round
Biological systems. They're sound
At examining where
(Say, blood, urine or hair)
And what proteins or drugs might be found.

limerick_list.author: Ulfras
limerick_list.text:
It's a feminine form of high treason,
Betraying ourselves beyond reason,
As we twist and we squirm
(Am I thin, am I firm?),
And we dive into bathing suit season.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Sacré bleu, Monsieur Edgar Degas,
What a difficult figure you are!
Your artworks were great,
But irrational hate
Cut across your old age like a scar.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The depth of a man's animosity
Can extend all the way to ferocity.
Compared to the love
That he's capable of,
His ill will is, in short, an atrocity.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
Yummy dumplings I find quite a treat,
Made from cornmeal, potatoes or wheat.
In hot water they boil.
Topped with garlic and oil,
Give me gnocchi, delicious to eat!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
To be nice and sarcastic at once,
Say "God love you!" or other affronts
Such as this one: "My, my,
Aren't you special!" or try
"Bless your heart!"  They all mean You're a dunce.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
To close out is a good thing to do
When the clock says a quarter to two
In the morning. A bird
Might wake up if it heard,
So I'll tiptoe to bed now — adieu!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If we work as a team, our collectiveness
Will be sure to improve our effectiveness,
So don't be subjective,
Or worse—introspective.
Group thinking displays our connectiveness.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
The MP has complacently fed
Us the super-sized junk in his head:
His lies on inflation
And kids' education
Allied as he lies on his bed.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Said the girl I was dating (now ex),
"I want more, and you're not that complex.
You've not left adolescence.
Reduced to your essence,
All you really boil down to is sex."

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
'There's a feature defined as "dikaryon"
In these fungi compartments,' said Marion.
'Two parents supplied
These bits here inside;
The nuclei . . . want me to carry on?'

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Pollination of edible figs
Using blossoming caprifig twigs
Is called caprification.
Its utilization
Incenses censorious prigs.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
We repent all the money we spent
Attempting to make you a gent.
In all aspects you fail;
You are still a crude male —
We shall not leave to Yale a red cent!

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
At the back of the chapel, the beadle
Could be heard as he started to wheedle
A blushing young beauty
For ushering duty
With talk of "the eye of a needle."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In the broadcasting business, they say,
The executives daypart the day.
Yes, they break it in bits
To determine the blitz
Of promotions and hits they will play.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
The CKS Airport, Taiwan,
(Short for Chiang Kai-Shek, leader, now gone)
Changed its name in '06—
Makes it hard for the hicks:
"Taxi, take me to Taiwan Taoyuan."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Scrimp and save.  It will pay in the end,"
Said my dad.  "Frugal living's your friend.
The less buying exceeds
Just your day-to-day needs,
The less time caught in want you will spend."

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
"The Municipal Band's undermanned.
Out of tune.  Out of sync," critics panned.
"They just can't play a lick,
And they sound like 'mu-sick'.
Change their name to Municipal Banned."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Our brave pilot was quick to deliver
When an engine failed.  He, with no sliver
Of hesitance, stayed
Very focused and made
A forced landing right onto a river.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
This competitive bidding is fun!
I love auctions. What's that? Gosh, I've won!
And I'm now the proud owner
Of—three gross of toner?
I cannot believe what I've done!

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
There's a knot (daisy chain) you can tie.
You can drop, daisy chained, from the sky.
It's a fisherman's lure,
A girl's garland so pure,
And a group sex technique — shall we try?

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Rock 'n' roll, R&B, and soul, too—
What's the glue that connects them?  They drew
From the churches way back
That were Southern and Black.
You can take that as gospel—it's true.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
The check girl had taken my coat
At this fancy soiree, on a boat.
When I got the coat back,
It was all out of whack,
'Cause a goat had my coat by the throat!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When involved in a circular flow
That proceeds to the right, down below,
Then continues above
To the leftward thereof,
Counterclockwise is how you should go.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Baloney (one o), goodness knows,
Means so phony and fake that it shows;
But although it seems strange,
I will switch, for a change
To boloney—that's spelled with two o's.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In a land that depends on agronomy,
A boycott can wreck the economy.
The old captain won't rise
To devise its demise—
The word boycott's a case of eponymy.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Let me note counterstrategists' goals:
They examine your game plans for holes,
And intend to undo 'em
By drivin' right through 'em
In up-armored Hummers and Rolls.

limerick_list.author: DenmarK
limerick_list.text:
Gothic spires accuse clouds flying by.
Round the towers, the rooks sail and cry.
Ramparts, gargoyled and bleak
Match the croak of a beak,
Throwing caws to the wind, cold and dry.

limerick_list.author: abbeycadabra
limerick_list.text:
Most beings who eat other things
Must do it to get carbon strings.
But for some that's not true:
Chemoautotrophs do
Fix all their own carbon, like kings.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
When I call my Colombian connection,
He supplies my espresso selection.
I know just where to go
When my bean bin is low;
Thanks to him, I can brew true perfection.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Black grama's American grass
That is eaten by cattle.  Alas,
They produce milk and meat,
But these cattle excrete
A destructive intestinal gas.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
A blabber-lipped fellow named Pete
Possessed lips that were swollen, replete
With a cluster of cold sores
(They must have been old sores,
Since blabber-lipped's now obsolete).

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Last night my wife chafed me in bed,
Yes, she scolded me, face turning red.
"On this we agree:
You don't listen to me!"
(At least, that's what I think that she said.)

limerick_list.author: mino
limerick_list.text:
Acephalism — having no head —
Is a plight which, by rights, leaves you dead.
	But should you not die,
	You're in luck: You can buy
A kiddie-size three-quarter bed!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My sister's pet bird is a mynah.
She bought it in South Carolina.
I felt for its chest
To find out if its breast-
bone was carinate (with a carina).

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
"Carpe diem!" you'd carp, for good measure,
Interrupting the leisure I treasure.
Now I daily get seizures
Of guilt when my leisure's
The subject of all your displeasure.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
A Knight of the Realm holds the same
Rank and status as that of a dame;
And, bestowed by the Queen,
These high honours are seen
As awards of the highest acclaim.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Though this dog meat is food fit for mutts
(Butchers' floor scrapings, entrails and guts),
You feed Fido filet
And top sirloin all day,
But serve me Canine Nibbles & Cuts!?

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle and speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
I live on a cold asteroid
Reading Skinner, Vygotsky, and Freud.
I circle in space
In this fragmented place—
Psychologically speaking, a void.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Grand Admiral — that'll be me,
And of what? Of the wide Ocean Sea.
But Columbian fame
Reaches Harlem: my name
Is the same that adorns your degree.

limerick_list.author: Rose
limerick_list.text:
"It's Balsamic, this vinegar? Good!
How'd you make it?" some ask (as they should).
I reply, "How I wish
I'd used grapes in the dish!
It's not easy to stomp balsa wood."

limerick_list.author: Amergin
limerick_list.text:
Man's connatural instinct to gibber
Evolved to a spiel so much glibber.
It delivered a pair
Who work scams at the fair:
Al's a con; Bert, a natural fibber.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If you travel the globe, you may, one day,
Be journeying east on a Monday.
Pass over the date line—
That crazy-but-great line—
You'll find that it's suddenly Sunday!

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
For the bounty bestowed by our Maker
And the skills of the cook and the baker,
We give thanks here today
And with gratitude pray:
May God bless every giver and taker.

limerick_list.author: Lawrence A. Herman
Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
It seemed right, at the time, that I thank her;
But as it turned out, I should spank her.
In a coupla days more
I developed a sore —
Said the doc, "That's a pretty mean canker."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Baby Snooks had a voice that was cloying,
Fake-childish, and highly annoying.
In the '40s, however,
Folks all found her clever;
Her shows they were always enjoying.

limerick_list.author: Basingstoke
limerick_list.text:
When your milk missed your cup the first try
And you need the whole floor to be dry,
Absorbent's the wipe
That will clean in one swipe:
You'll no longer have reason to cry.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
I think that I've blown it with Jake
Coz he knows that my loving's been fake.
He was there in the place,
There was joy on my face,
Then I cried out, "Oh, Jack!" by mistake.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
I really don't think you should eat
The black fungus that's grown on that wheat.
It is ergot and it
Can cause seizure and fit —
Ergotism — (and gangrenous feet!)

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
A couple, while out one fine day,
Took a rest in a field full of hay.
One thing led to another
And now she's a mother,
And he's wishing rain had stopped play.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When she dies, I am hoping dear Gramma
Will leave me her coat—a Blackglama.
It's a beautiful mink
And I'll wear it, I think,
Though I'm living in south Alabama.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
On a hillside, some grass said he saw
A red tail in my foxhound's red maw.
The police said, "That's banned;
But no charges are planned."
Well, so much for my brush with the law.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Ariadne auf Naxos, by Strauss
Is an opera that brings down the house.
Left alone on an isle
By a cad with a smile,
Ariadne's told, "Find a new spouse!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Chuck's not cheerful or upbeat like us.
At his smallest misfortunes he'll cuss:
"Life's the pits, you can see,
For poor put-upon me."
All agree he's a real gloomy gus.

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
An acid (alloxanic), while dating,
Met a base and combined in a mating.
Through nobody's fault,
They gave birth to a salt—
An alloxanate well worth the waiting.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Your blackguardly deeds mark you out.
Philanthropical fairness you flout.
With your dastardly crew,
You're the villain we boo —
Quite a coup, for a prizewinning Scout.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
The addressograph's now obsolete.
We have digitized labels (how neat!)
That come from a printer
In summer and winter;
Old technology cannot compete.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There's a bowyer, a real gloomy Gus,
Who does not see his job as a plus.
"It's just bows I make here.
For the rest of your gear,
May I recommend Arrows R Us."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In theory, a solid has mass
That, when shrunk to a point, can still pass
Equilibrium tests,
Since the body now rests
At its center—ain't physics a gas?

limerick_list.author: CruzerX
limerick_list.text:
When his biopic critics are makin'
In the future, some shots will be taken:
"His style was a sham."
"An inveterate ham."
"William Shatner:  Canadian bacon."

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
I've turned yellow; I'm now so chlorotic—
Photosynthesize?  Can't!  Idiotic!
Iron won't help in time
For the plant show that I'm
Bred to win. So . . . can plants feel neurotic?

limerick_list.author: Margaret Ford
limerick_list.text:
Jelly doughnut, my tum hath a growl.
Yea, though sugar and starch run afoul
Of yon dieting rule,
Mine own mouth it doth drool;
How I yearn for thy carbs in my bowel.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Chocolate pudding's a nine-year-old's dream,
Sure to give satisfaction supreme:
Thick and smooth as you wish
In a four-inch deep dish,
And on top, half a foot of whipped cream!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
My fish tale — I thought people bought
It hook, line, and sinker.  Distraught,
I came to find out
That they knew all about
My big lie; it was I who was caught.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
He's a cereal killer, they say—
That dread villain they call "Special K."
He scrunched Cap'n Crunch
As he sat down to brunch
At a family breakfast buffet.

limerick_list.author: Shelby Forrest and JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Politicians' pretend dialectic
(All pre-scripted) might seem to be hectic,
But we know each good deed
Is just masking their greed,
So I'm bursting with rage — apoplectic.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
They are poisonous mushrooms for sure,
Death angels. You eat them? The cure
Is a liver transplant.
Though they taste good, I grant
That you'll quickly regret their allure.

limerick_list.author: David Vestal
limerick_list.text:
A sinner, a thief, a hard case
By barratry bettered his place.
He paid some religions
(And played them like pigeons).
Now he's Reverend Saint Rabbi, His Grace.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Of that country, I now see the bourne —
The edge. Shall I cross it? I'm torn.
What might travellers learn?
Will they ever return?
I'm unable to choose, and forlorn.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A chuckwalla lizard like Donna,
Keeping cool as a lizard could wanna,
Has a proneness to pant—
Lots of other ones can't.
What a clever old desert iguana!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A clam is a mollusk of sorts,
And a claim is asserted in courts,
While a chlamys, or cape,
Ancient Greeks liked to drape
Round the shoulders of boys playing sports.

limerick_list.author: Gravely
limerick_list.text:
O Shakti, with thee I am falling
In love, though one detail is galling.
Those arms down each side —
It's a lot to abide.
Thy distichous form is appalling!

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Listing points that I thought needed mention,
I'd made slides for the Bobsled Convention.
But the overhead's focus
Twists words, hocus-pocus —
Distorts them beyond comprehension.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Why are robots in films always men?
Fighting, killing, unthinking, and when
Sometimes fembots are seen
On the silvery screen,
They're just sex objects, time and again.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Chenopodium album? Do tell.
I confess I don't know it that well.
But no matter how great,
Let me tell you here straight:
It's a dud next to Bat Out of Hell.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Sure as taxes it came: early June
Saw the onset, the burst of monsoon.
Soon the lanes were in flood
And the drains bubbled mud.
Inconvenient? Most called it a boon.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
Prince Arjuna's pluck was defective—
He couldn't work up the invective
To fight his relations.
The transfigurations
Of Krishna restored his perspective.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Ecce homo: in art, a depiction
Of a thorny-crowned Christ post conviction
(From biblical text).
We all know what came next
For the man: meeting fate (crucifixion).

limerick_list.author: cauliflower
limerick_list.text:
Sydney Smith, were he here, might have said
Blair and Bush are to honesty dead.
Mere words never would,
Only surgery could
Get the truth into either man's head.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
When we talk about having the blues,
Depression's the very big news.
But in life as in art,
Blue gives joy to the heart,
When looked at in terms of its hues.

limerick_list.author: EdRush
limerick_list.text:
What Sherman did warn't deplantation;
He burnt a big path through our nation!
Naw, this is when gard'ners,
With diggers as pardners,
Denude beds of flow'rs — depredation!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
A bullbat eats insects that fly;
Like a namesake, it sups while on high.
Though a nighthawk's no bat
(Or a bull, come to that),
It booms as it zooms through the sky.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Aunty Acid's a senior who's sassy.
Her cynical tone can be brassy.
"I don't care who you are.
Say a person's a car—
It's the motor that counts, not the chassis."

limerick_list.author: OxfordVictor
limerick_list.text:
To a casuist waiter from Crewe,
I complained of a mouse in my stew.
I said, "Don't bring a bill!"
He replied, "I still will,
For that isn't a mouse—it's a shrew!"

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
At the brothel, they think I'm arthritic,
And my skills in the sack, paralytic.
All the hookers in town
Have been talking me down,
For it's true: every bawd is a critic.

limerick_list.author: Gravely
limerick_list.text:
I can't deal with that waiter's fatuity.
Can't he see that the long term annuity
Which I offered to sell
Him, at cost, would be swell?
Stupid dolt — he just wants his gratuity.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
Walter Brown, Jimmy Rushing, Big Joe,
Eddie "Cleanhead" (hoo, boy, could he blow!)...
They were blues shouters all
Who could fill the whole hall
With their voices (no amps!) for the show.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"Things look promising: truly auspicious.
That gal likes me; she's young and delicious.
She admires my brain
And my marvelous mane."
"Fool, you're hair-brained, and over-ambitious!"

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Azarenka's as tough as they get
At the baseline or close to the net.
"Maria, it's ova!"
She told Sharapova.
Six-zip was the score—final set.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Though its brute artificiality strikes
This old angler as not what he likes,
All the merits of cotton
Or wool are forgotten;
It's nylon that reels in the pikes.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
On the bagpipes I often expound:
"These are drone pipes; each makes a low sound
While my chanter I play—
Airs and reels, sad or gay—
As do pipers (for pay) the world 'round."

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
Some people say pollack for coalfish,
But that doesn't mean it's the sole fish
Of that name in the sea.
Let's have pollock for tea:
They're big, so we won't need a whole fish.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The bandaging wrapped round the head
Of the monster inspired me with dread.
When we touched it, she screamed;
Dr. Frankenstein beamed!
Fifteen minutes ago she was dead.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Our new firm seeks acclaim—that's our aim;
All we need is a company name.
We're considering lots,
Because "Lipschitz and Plotz"
Doesn't seem to proclaim world class fame.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
A security checker named Dunn
Said, "These pat-downs are jolly good fun.
My libido is smokin'
While I'm gropin' and pokin' —
And I like that cute tat on your bun."

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
My full-blooded (vigorous) whack
Sent the cricket ball rocketing back
Past the big-head who'd bowled.
What a joy to behold,
When his jaw became suddenly slack.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
Sew a hood on that long cloak or coat —
You've provided yourself a capote.
Don't pronounce it "Capote"
Or we'll think peyote
Got into your sassafras float.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Reproduce without sex (that's monogony),
Or with ova and sperm (gametogony);
If the offspring you raise
Has an embryo phase,
Call the start of its life embryogony.

limerick_list.author: Ellla B.
limerick_list.text:
The Beltie is Galloway's news:
White band with black jacket and trews.
As a worm is to silk,
Some can even make milk—
An Oreo cookie that moos!

limerick_list.author: Basingstoke
limerick_list.text:
Abiogenist designates one
Claiming life is from nothing begun
In bad meat or foul hay,
But he won't get his way:
Omne vivum e vivo, my son.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Budget busting is Congress's game.
Now we've deficits no one can tame.
All their spending on end
Is an ongoing trend,
And it puts drunken sailors to shame.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
We got snookered before with that damn
Bill of goods that you sold, Uncle Sam!
You've eroded our trust!
What you promise is just
A complete load of crap!  What a sham!

limerick_list.author: otherwisefine
limerick_list.text:
Balclutha? It's south from Dunedin.
To leave Invercargill, you're needin'
To head mostly east,
To the Clutha, at least
(Where the road from Dunedin was leadin').

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Out the back, in her donga, where gran
Sits and knits the best mittens she can,
Dropping stitches uncountable
In that demountable,
Dotage unravels poor Nan.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When Aries the Ram has connected
With our nannies the ram has selected,
Then your goats and my goats
Contribute their zygotes,
But "kids" would be most unexpected.

limerick_list.author: Carole Lyons
limerick_list.text:
The word calender, when it is seen,
Should refer to a pressing machine
With rollers and plates,
Not a listing of dates.
Now why can't we spell what we meen?

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
To Corinthians, Paul wrote each letter
That tells us how we can live  better.
As we share faith and love,
We are blessed from above,
If we choose to throw off sin's dark fetter.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
I just blurted it out when I said,
"Oh good grief, what is that on your head?
It can't be your new hat.
It looks like a dead rat."
Turned out 'twas his toupee instead.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
I ordered a blintz filled with jelly,
And some matzoh ball soup at this deli.
It was all so delicious,
I added knishes,
Judiciously filling my belly.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
When an enemy enters the fray,
Don't engage him in muddled mêlée;
To really convulse him,
You need to depulse him:
To thrust him and drive him away.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The argala or adjutant-bird?
For its diet, dead fish are preferred.
It's an Indian stork
That's as big as New York!
(No? Well, maybe I'm off by a third.)

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Got a note via post this past week:
Foreign letters, a message oblique.
They're Cyrillic, I bet —
Looks like Russian — and yet,
From the postmark, it ought to be Greek.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A cat-o'-nine-tails, the pirates all say,
Helps a captain keep mutinies at bay.
They have found, in rough clashes,
A whip with nine lashes
More effective than docking one's pay.

limerick_list.author: Virge
limerick_list.text:
This amylum (starch that's in fruits,
And in seeds, tubers, stem pith and roots)
Is a part of your food,
But has come to be viewed
As a crime by the Atkins recruits.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
If a flower could take college form,
An androecium would be its men's dorm.
Pollination of Flowers
Would earn credit hours,
With labs in its pistil the norm.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Was a boothman the guy who showed porn
In dark booths (long before you were born)
That were smelly and hot,
At a quarter a shot?
No, a boothman's a guy who sold corn.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
What's booming? Find snow on a mountain,
Then dam it; it melts; you've a fountain.
New seams are revealed
When the levee's unsealed:
It's a hundred-fold yield, and still countin'!

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Miss Chloride's objective? To prise
A spare proton of medium size
From an alkali metal
Like sodium, settle,
And bind, as a crystal, on fries.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Two great movies they're showing today
At the Bijou — let's go right away!
"Double Feature — One Buck!"
OMG, we're in luck:
Lusty Ladies and Virgins at Play.

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
Your conduct has cast disrespect
On this firm, and we wholly object.
Our pact? Null and void;
You're no longer employed.
The defeasance has taken effect.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
If a fabric you value is fringy,
It's its edge that you wouldn't want dingy.
Be it patterned or plain
A good fringe, like Champagne,
Adds some class and it shouldn't be stingy.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Though a deep-discount bond pays a pittance
(Not enough for a black sheep's remittance),
For the cents that you pay
You'll get dollars, some day,
If the issuer's there to make quittance.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
He espied the jeweled chain neath her snoot.
That he'd steal it was not in dispute.
Though in elegant taste,
All the stones were mere paste;
What he grabbed was just faux hanging loot.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Auto-Tune? That's a hymn to your car?
Or the way that you tune your guitar?
No! It makes your recording
Much better, affording
A shot at becoming a star.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
There once was a gnome and a gnu
Who were quaffing a pint (well, a few!).
While sharing their beer,
The gnome said, "Oh dear,
This brew's only three damn point two!"

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
You can house your small pet axolotl
In any old jar you have what'll
Remain watertight.
(Though your ocelot might
Find life much too cramped in a bottle.)

limerick_list.author: jeux
limerick_list.text:
I crave to pour hugs on some lass,
With unlimited kisses en masse.
Is there anything sexier,
Than acute basorexia?
If no lass, I must kiss someone's...

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If it ends in a  ?, one surmises
That in reading the piece, the voice rises,
So we know it's a query
(At least that's the theory).
Our language is full of surprises!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Why would anyone sane volunteer
To bring up (that's to raise or to rear)
A six-week-old lion?
Would that cat, without tryin',
One day make your rear disappear?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
She was arm candy.  Both of us knew it.
No kissing.  No sex.  Nothing to it.
When we enter a room
Like young bride and old groom,
It's not my fault if you misconstrue it.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
As long as they're free of the fuzz,
His parents don't care what he does.
Their neglect of him's damnin'
This street urchin (gamin).
The neighborhood's fully abuzz.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
Personality's often defined
Using all Big Five factors combined.
(I would list the traits now
Were they shortened somehow.)
These make all of us one of a kind.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Bang! Bang! Bang! Bang! Bang! Bang! Bang! Bang! Bang!
Bang! Bang! Bang! Bang! Bang! Bang! Bang! Bang! Bang!
Bang! Bang! Bang! Bang! Bang! ..."Dad!
This is driving me mad.
Buy my son one more gun and you'll hang!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
What's next in our botany class is
Elymus, a genus of grasses,
Also known as wildrye.
On our final, let's try
To be certain that everyone passes.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Avian flu is an ailment so scary—
This disease should make everyone chary.
Wash your hands, don't touch that
Or in two seconds flat,
You'll be sicker than sick, so be wary.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
"Though I'm drunk, I'm not cheap, as you think,"
Slurred my wife as she puked in the sink.
"But I'm little, that's all,
And because I'm so small,
I get plastered from only one drink."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"So you think I'm a fool?" exclaimed Lee.
"You are wooing my wife.  Can't you see
That I'm reading your mind?
I'm a psychic. You'll find
I've a sixth sense. It's called ESP."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
At times, game-changers come with a force
That will radically alter our course.
New directions they give,
Which affects how we live,
Like my poverty after divorce.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
So how is your earthbank today —
That big dirt pile of rock, soil, and clay
For some reason you save?
Is it fame that you crave?
Better stop, or they'll put you away!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
At the fresh Balfour cheese I would gawk.
'Bout its sweet nutty flavor, I'd talk.
It's both crumbly and hard,
Held in highest regard
In N.Z. Disagree? Take a walk!

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
When you're facing a grim vigilante,
And your chance of escaping seems scanty,
You'd be happy to pay
For a do-over play —
Start anew from the status quo ante.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Where the uterus ends, it constricts
At the cervix, which opens in chicks
During birth, so it's true:
There's a womb with a view,
And the baby is getting its kicks.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"The invaders cannot carry on
With our signposts deranged or just gone."
"Wait — the signs moved or tossed?
This explains why I'm lost.
Is that Ipswich ahead or San Juan?"

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Skiing slopes in the comma position
(Angulation) defies intuition:
Knees bent toward the hill,
You may still take a spill.
All is balance; it needs repetition.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"The OEDILF is my brainchild," I muse,
"But what is the plural I'd use
Should I think up another?
Brainchildren? Oh, brother!"
(Yep, I checked. That is just what I'd choose.)

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
As for me, ocean air's eudemonic:
A salve for the soul, a sure tonic.
The littoral breeze
That I find by the seas
Brings relief from malaise that is chronic.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
To a lower rank boss they'd say "yassuh".
But the guy at the top surely has a
Strong claim to more deference,
So, in light of his preference,
It was always, for Mazza, "Yes, Massa".

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Van Beethoven's Fifth was a hummer.
It featured trombonists and drummer.
Some critics gave grief
Re his four-note motif.
He pronounced them dumb, dumb, dumb and dumber.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Since that dire accidental event
When I fell and I hit the cement,
I accept the enormity
Of my left leg's deformity
As the will of the gods—heaven sent.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
At the station, a fellow named Beck
Wondered: Where is my train? Did it wreck?—
Felt so chafed he could curse,
And to make matters worse,
His collar was chafing his neck.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Now I'm lame, and I face disability.
Life, once brilliant, seems utter futility.
Once I aimed for the sky,
But that's over, and I
Must prepare for old age and senility.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Cried a bare-assed torero from  Sydenham,
"My trousers, señores! You've hydenham!"
He flushed when he learned
They had quickly been burned
When the matadors saw what he dydenham.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
For OEDILF I have written with zest 
Many verses; folks thought me obsessed.
And although I'm long dead,
I have planned far ahead:­
This Z limerick's my loving bequest.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
"Look at Venus de Milo," said Margot.
"Arriving in Paris as cargo,
She did not masquerade
As a gun or grenade,
Yet fell foul of a strict arms embargo."

limerick_list.author: DenmarK
limerick_list.text:
My daughter adores chocolate cake.
"Lots of brownies, oh Daddy, please bake."
Though a girl-guide she's not,
When she's scoffed the whole lot,
She's a browny-faced girl, no mistake.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Thomas Eakens taught students to paint,
But his methods engendered complaint.
Humans viewed in the nude
Were, to Eakins, not lewd.
"I'm an artist," he said, "not a saint."

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
Russian lecture drones on, blah blah blah;
Students nod and agree, da da da.
Concentration diminished,
It's finally finished.
They get up and cheer, rah rah rah!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Antiracism laws are okay,
Keeping bunches of bigots at bay.
But if we're to create
A new world without hate,
Education, no doubt, is the way.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Modern Arabic isn't a tongue
Used by many whom I live among,
But in Middle East lands
And North African sands
It is commonly spoken and sung.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
My bursa blew up; hurt so bad
That I overcame fear and I had
The doctor both drain it
And (let him explain it):
"Shoot cortisone there—just a tad."

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
