At the Methodist Church show in Bedford,
Our lad (he's a right Robert Redford)
Fluffed the lines of his verse
And, to make matters worse,
Farted twice, at our local eisteddfod.

limerick_list.author: Amergin
limerick_list.text:
In the red, Charles could levy a tax
And the gold would weigh heavy in sacks.
But with Parliament's win,
There's a Commonwealth in.
They've axed Chas; and extract cash with Acts.

limerick_list.author: sl8ofhand
limerick_list.text:
If you added -te you'd be able
To describe a small crock on a table.
But a crocket's observed
As stone foliage, curved,
At the edge of a spire or gable.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Foster parents who act with discretion
And avoid any hint of oppression
Can engender success.
Loving care, I would guess,
Often lessens the chance of transgression.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I've had coitus fecundus just twice
In my life, but both times were quite nice.
Two fine daughters resulted.
Say books I've consulted,
"Ingredients: sugar and spice."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In describing the past, is it utile
To declare life was mean, short, and brutal?
I picture the cave men
As loving and brave men
Whose life was austere, but not futile.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I suppose that my husband's neurosis
Gives our marriage a doubtful prognosis.
Since he won't take the pills
Doc prescribed for his ills,
We will quickly approach cagamosis.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
For a track star, high hurdles are tough
When you're 300 pounds in the buff.
When I'm sprinting, they say,
"Put your stopwatch away,
Since a calendar's more than enough."

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
The Christmas flower cheers at first sight.
Scarlet bracts that are showy and bright,
Round their gold inflorescence,
Comprise the quintessence
Of seasonal warmth and delight.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I have taken it under advisement—
I'm not sure I know what those guys meant
When they posed in the nude
For the shot they include
In their classified food advertisement.

limerick_list.author: SusanL and Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
I've been deafened by years on the line
With machines and their mind-numbing whine.
Now my hearing is lost
(And at quite a high cost).
Still, the silence at last seems divine.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I expect your respect for our guest;
Don't play cute—I will not be impressed.
Too clever's annoying,
Too sweet even cloying.
"Be yourself" isn't always the best.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
My Elizabeth's bright as a pearl
And her cookery sets me awhirl,
For she strains food in bowls
That are riddled with holes.
I'm in love with a colander girl.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
All these pissed-off and mixed-up young guys,
Disaffected and heedless who dies,
Are mad wanna-be martyrs
Who are making bad barters,
Believing those afterlife lies.

limerick_list.author: Scott Campisi
limerick_list.text:
Though the others would try to defy us,
I've found a new source to supply us
With news we can use
To confirm all our views,
Since the other news pushes a bias.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
"Please, my date wants it kept from her mom
That we rented a room for post-prom."
"You've been booked for that day.
Tell her mom? There's no way,"
Tom confirmingly said with aplomb.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Anolis: a genus of lizard
That's rarely found out in a blizzard;
They're chameleons that,
At the drop of a hat,
Can disguise themselves, just like a wizard.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
Don Van Vliet and Frank Zappa had wrought
That odd name, Captain Beefheart. They thought
It was great for a movie
With Grunt People—groovy!
The script and the film came to naught.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A civilian who pilots a plane,
A mechanic the Air Force will train,
And a techie for Boeing
Who keeps a jet going
Are airmen, with flight their domain.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My childbirth was slow—I assume
That I've got a dysfunctional womb—
The most listless dystocia
In all Nova Scotia:
Discomfort, exhaustion, and gloom.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Al swatted a foul to the wall,
And the ball boy recovered the ball.
When he lobbed the ball in,
It struck Al on the shin;
And Al fell, with chagrin, in a sprawl.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A beekeeper heads for the fair,
Where they're selling apparel that's rare.
There he purchases jeans
For diminutive queens—
A transaction that's "buyer bee-wear."

limerick_list.author: Gtmac
limerick_list.text:
My boxer, who's lost their command,
Throws a haymaker, swinging their hand
(A wild powerful punch
Causing jaws to go crunch).
Now they just need to get one to land.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
With my nematodes, I'm on good terms;
Each is tiny and hairlike, and squirms.
These capilliform creatures
Have certain good features:
They eat larvae like good little worms.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
I'm a creature as fine as can be.
Do not cast your aspersions on me.
Your sticks and your stones
May well shatter my bones,
But your words wouldn't frighten a flea.

limerick_list.author: Rose Nunez
limerick_list.text:
The witchlet's expensive athame
Was mocked by her big brother Kwame:
"That knife's got no power;
It can't cut a flower!"
Shazam—he became edamame.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Granny Phelps strokes the cat on her knee,
Complacently watching TV.
She knows Grandpa Phelps
Is well-trained, since he helps
Answer doorbells and phones, and makes tea.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
For those condos, front beach, Isle of Palms,
Recent buyers have harbored some qualms.
During storms there's a notion
Sand's engulfed by the ocean,
And it can't be retrieved in the calms.

limerick_list.author: lopey
limerick_list.text:
One concept has left me aghast:
When two statements, both valid, contrast.
It is not mental bliss,
This antinomy, Miss,
To accept it as logic at last.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
But Ptolemy's hand-winning ace
Was, to Kepler, a kludgey disgrace:
From the equant, a place
In the middle of space,
Planets move at a uniform pace.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
While pork's tasty (I'm sure you'll agree),
Only free-range type farming's for me.
Eating bacon, I find
I leave heartache behind
If I know that the piggies roamed free.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In pursuing my chosen vocation,
There's never been one intimation
I'm falling behind,
But it's much on my mind,
So it's clear that I fear antiquation.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"You're being presumptuous, Ari.
I didn't want THAT."  "Gee, I'm sorry.
Hey, waitress, get rid
Of these rings of fried squid.
Seems my date doesn't like calamari."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Re your invoice for teaching the dactyl:
The bill, though well totaled, in fact'll
Stay unpaid. It's a crime
That you've wasted my time.
I had asked you to teach me the fractal.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Can't make it to Salisbury Plain?
Visit Carhenge where autos still reign.
There's a sculpture bizarre,
An homage to the car,
In Nebraska. Now ain't that insane?

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
"Ice cream sam'wich," said 5-year-old Nellie
To the counterman working the deli.
But her mom countermanded
The order, and handed
Her 5-year-old crackers and jelly.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Do you smell his cologne?  Get a whiff.
Here he comes.  Do you notice he's stiff?
Well, he won't be for long.
"Care to dance to this song?"
"Oh my God!  Total loser!  As if!"

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Elizabeth Phelps, known as Lizzy,
Effervesces — you might call her fizzy.
Her persona so bubbles,
You'll forget all your troubles.
She's an airhead, she's blonde and she's dizzy.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Over end-of-the-play interference,
The epilogist made his appearance,
Mouthed the script's last dull word
(Which in truth no one heard).
Grant him points for perverse perseverance.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Will it play in Peoria?" was,
In the past, often asked to mean "Does
It have mainstream appeal?
Take their pulse, get a feel,
And we hope it sparks positive buzz."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Cried my dad, "This is torn; it's a crime.
I believe that it came from your rhyme,
And I fear that our pup
Chewed your limerick up.
Please explain the words:
Since
But my lime."

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
To feague, once: to beat or to whip;
The word feag also made the same trip.
If to beat a man's rear
Was the course you would steer,
Then bumfeage was the word at tongue's tip.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Caveman Dana's inventions would shock.
Once he fashioned a timepiece from rock.
Dripping water filled up,
Twice a day, a stone cup,
And he'd shout, "Now it's one cup o'clock!"

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
Bored with cabbage that comes to a head?
Still want slaw?  Then try colewort instead.
It's tasty and crunchy
With flat leaves (or bunchy)
In colours from green to deep red.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
If the space race you want to embrace,
Start out small with the Ace Baby Ace.
It's a plane from a kit,
Wholly safe, they submit.
(Bring a parachute, though, just in case.)

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
I feel bad for our Holstein, Felicity.
For seven long years, with chronicity,
She's suffered the fate
From a D-cell she ate.
When we milk her, she gives electricity.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Three medieval estates were professed
(First the clergy, then lords, and the rest).
As the fourth estate now
Wielding power somehow,
Would the press be the lowest, or best?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"I've gained weight and I look like a blimp,
But I doubt that my poundage will crimp
My success with the dames,
As my way is paid," James
Now proclaims, "through the neighborhood pimp."

limerick_list.author: Chavi Beck
limerick_list.text:
When Antiochus banned Torah study,
My chavrusa (my study hall buddy)
Shlepped our scrolls to a cave
In Judea. He's brave!
But that tale of the dreidel? Too nutty.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
Has it not ever struck you as odd
That the people who speak most of God,
When they rank rank transgressions,
Make major concessions?
Where's cruelty?  It gets the nod!

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Biconvexity's easily spied:
  A body curves out on each side.
Through the middle part, bulging—
  Like snakes through indulging—
    The tips aren't equally wide.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Our foxtrot's slow-slow fast-fast flow
Danced to swing is quite tricky. Although
Our slick salsa, our waltz
And quick cha cha lack faults,
Critics can can our foxtrot: "So-so."

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
No, a suitcase is not what I choose;
It's a garment bag I like to use.
It hangs up nice and neat,
Holds my suits, saves the pleat
In my slacks, and holds undies and shoes.

limerick_list.author: Steve Andersen
limerick_list.text:
In the garden of Ichabod Barber
Are felonious friends he will harbor.
His wife, who's a lady,
Considers them shady,
As they are, 'neath the trees in the arbor.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
What keeps growing will never decay;
We aggrandize, or else waste away.
Expansionism rules!
Its opponents are fools.
Deny destiny? Perish the day!

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Said a shivering seal, feeling low,
"It's so icy and cold—think I'll go
Far away from this beach;
The whole world is in reach,
So I'm just gonna go with the floe."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Look — a friendship quilt offered for sale,
And authentic — my true holy grail.
Have the gods been unkind?
Here's a patch that's unsigned.
It's a slight! And this quilt hides a tale.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Angialgia, of which I complain,
Is vasalgia, a vascular pain.
Those are terms too arcane
For these worms in my brain
Busy juggling my jugular vein.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Dopart
limerick_list.text:
Want a milk shake with ice cream and flavor?
In Newport you'll need this small favor.
'Cause only poor saps
Try to order cold frappes;
It's a cabinet that you will savor.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Lord Nelson undoubtedly made
The most waves in his French escapade.
But the Admiralty
Sent the navy to sea,
And ensured that his sailors got paid.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
She didn't expect I'd be capping
The climax last night.  She was clapping.
High achievement was needed.
I reached and exceeded
That point, after which I was napping.

limerick_list.author: johng
limerick_list.text:
There can never be anyone flusher
Than plutocrats living in Russia.
They may have two houses
(As well as two spouses?)
And the datcha is probably plusher.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
She's a diva, the finicky sort,
Never found on the runway or court.
She's named Calico Bush,
And she hasn't a tush—
She's uncultured—a heath, not a wort.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
He runs averagely, not fast or slow,
With a moderate distance to go.
He's of medium height
And his weight is just right—
Not a star but your typical Joe.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
There he stands in the headlights, confused,
Kinda baffled and sorely abused.
He sure looks like he'll drown;
Seems he's headed straight down.
Poor puppy, life's left him so bruised.

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
Glance over my tekst, and you'll sea
That it really was ridden by me.
Orthography's rules
And rimes are for fules,
Butt riding fullfills me with glee.

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
Mother Nature a rock will demolish,
Though the fragments she won't quite abolish.
Heat and cold, winds and rains,
Break it up — the remains?
Called eluvium: pieces quite smallish.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Withdrawing from flames, your arm jerked
As your cuneate fasciculus worked.
It sent warnings of pain
From your arm to your brain —
Thus avoiding the danger that lurked.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An astute, perspicacious old colonel
Wrote impressions of life in his jolonel.
"I may seem like a crank;
Sure I value my rank,
But its spelling," he wrote, "is infolonel!"

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
He bilks me in cribbage by thwarting
My chances of scoring—not sporting!
The way that he does it?
By bilking—because it
Is cheating to which he's resorting.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Ima Ball, a young comic from Bristol
Whose routine was as hot as a pistol,
Became pregnant—what girth!
"If," said she, "I give birth
To a girl, I'll be naming her Crystal."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
From Tampa way up to Seattle, a
Guy like me travels to battle a
Wrong that is done
To our favorite Hun.
When you mention him, please call him Attila.

limerick_list.author: Damian Hey
limerick_list.text:
Your honest responses will lead
This committee in word and in deed.
We have no use for posers
Nor sneaky brown-nosers.
Your candor is just what we need!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An investor (not one of the gang)
Is naive and goes down with a bang;
He plays hard and too fast,
Leaves the brokers aghast:
Barefoot pilgrim in stock-market slang.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
My eyeglasses worked—but no more:
There's a blur where no blur was before.
Am I now going blind—
Maybe losing my mind?
Damn! Just stepped on my lens on the floor.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Mine's the bench he'd a penchant to find
In the dim of his criminal mind.
Not a brain, he'd maintain
That my dog and my cane
Furnished proof that my justice was blind.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
A young woman removed all her hair
And went strolling in Castletownbere.
Said the mayor of Berehaven,
"You look so well shaven—
Do bear with me there while I stare."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
She would cruise in that cheap, run-down flivver.
With no heat in that car, she would shiver.
It was tattered, it leaked,
It was ugly, it creaked —
But the best that her daddy could give her.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
American, British, Australian,
Canadian too (but no alien).
ABCA as a group —
Though an alphabet soup —
The alternative's sesquipedalian.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Digging down to the bedrock below,
I discovered a place I can go
And lay down for a while
On my bedroll in style
(It's my rock and roll bed, doncha know?).

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
In the breads, shakes, and stews of my diet,
Tiny flaxseeds are now running riot.
Will the next panacea
Be quinoa or chia?
With omega-3 hype, I'll sure buy it!

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
It's adjectiveless: my new book
Which I wrote on some gobbledygook.
Critics laud it and praise
It in numerous ways
And tell everyone: "Come, take a look."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
He was acromegalic, my paw;
Had a jaw that left people in awe.
And his hands and his feet
Made all men's look petite—
Just the biggest that folks ever saw.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
By her dad, we was under attack
On that evenin' some ten years aback.
We had set in to sparkin'
In a place meant for parkin'
Aback of the Radio Shack.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
All you readers expecting depravity
From a limerick defining a cavity:
You're so darn dirty-minded
You're totally blinded
To matters of great dental gravity.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
A gossip who wagged his tongue loosely
Would blurt hurtful rumors diffusely.
He admits now he lied
Up and down, far and wide,
And is taking some swift kicks caboosely.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
I'm no longer a slave to the wax;
On my iPod are thousands of tracks
Which I hear through my earphones.
If you hear some queer moans,
It's me — I've got Wagner on max.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
What a furtive and wily device,
Early barnyard grass mimicking rice:
All this weeding selection
Reduces detection;
Now crop losses push up the price.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In a medieval library, look
And you may find an animal book,
With a page for each beast,
Where a monk or a priest
Found a lesson in hound and in rook.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
The view from the tower enthused me,
But the head of the stairway confused me.
I misstepped at the top,
Tripped and fell, and the drop—
I went ass over teakettle—bruised me.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In this coupe rode my very first date;
44 in a year, it's a crate.
Bye-bye, Delta! It's time
For the junkyard, so I'm
86ing my Olds 88.

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
We enjoy dining out for our meals
Where the waitress says "Welcome," then spiels,
"Follow me, walk this way,"
As she leads with a sway—
I say, "Sure, if I wore those high heels."

limerick_list.author: Hfox
limerick_list.text:
It's true that we humans are flightless;
In darkness we're very near sightless.
But whatever we're missing,
We've got lips for kissing
To make the long night less delightless.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
What three films won best picture awards
And were movies, without guns or swords,
That each featured a sport?
Plus I'm glad to report
That the public attended in hordes.

limerick_list.author: limarico
limerick_list.text:
On TogetherForever.org
Folks behave pretty much like the Borg.
It's a cult — what a crock!
All its members — en bloc —
May show up pretty soon in a morgue.

limerick_list.author: Screenhog
limerick_list.text:
There once was a JPEG I tweeted;
It now sits on my desktop, unneeded.
And so, with a click
And a drag of that pic,
It goes into the Trash Bin — deleted.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Any traces of talent are faint,
And a Pablo Picasso I ain't,
But just ask my dear spouse—
When it comes to our house,
I can put on a good coat of paint.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A glass eye doesn't work. What I mean:
It's in no way a vision machine.
It is better, it's said,
Than a hole in one's head,
Which, without one, is what would be seen.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When it comes to affairs, Dale's a frail man,
Not a constantly looking-for-tail man.
He stays true to Marie,
Though, concomitantly, she
Has been screwing two cops and the mailman.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Where a secret needs keeping to few
There is something constructive to do:
Compartmentalization,
The manifestation
Of 'need to know' culture — review.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
God, you know that I'm ready to swoon
As you strip by the light of the moon,
But I've got to get going.
Though passion is growing,
Your husband is coming home soon.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
This adverb means nothing but "coldly",
But I failed to define the word boldly.
My friend Lee, standing rigidly,
Asked about frigidly,
So that's what I frostily told Lee.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Told my abbot, "I'm weird, enigmatical —
Loathing all trappings prelatical."
"What! Are you serious!?
Highly mysterious!"
Poof! went my yearly sabbatical.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
"To the social milieu we bring flatus —
For which fault peevish offspring berate us.
Let us state from the start
That our title, 'Old Fart'
Will be mourned, when we're gone." signed, The Late Us.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Time flies like an arrow, it's said.
Fruit flies like a banana instead.
Your program directly
Will translate correctly?
I forecast rough sailing ahead.

limerick_list.author: Quickbeam
limerick_list.text:
A friendly attorney-at-law
Helped my neighbours to settle a score:
When his spiralling fees
Left them both on their knees,
They agreed they would quarrel no more.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
When you're deaf voices merge in a crowd,
And the struggle to listen's a shroud.
It can give the impression
You're swamped by depression,
For hearing aids just make noise loud.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
What's the nature of dialectology?
Part's linguistics and part is psychology,
As regional speech
Has a good bit of each,
And a touch of, I guess, anthropology.

text: This is a test to see how well you are paying attention. This text is a series of limericks. At the end of the list of limericks, there will be a question. The question will be about one of the limericks. Please answer the question as concisely as possible.
